Interaction_Explanation: Major: When ozanimod and zanubrutinib are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.
Major: Apomorphine can cause severe side effects when taken together with ivosidenib. This combination should be avoided unless otherwise advised by your doctor.
Major: Aprepitant and pexidartinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: When drotrecogin alfa is given together with avapritinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because drotrecogin alfa can increase the effects of avapritinib on blood clotting.

Major: The yellow fever vaccine can make your body produce antibodies to fight the virus. These antibodies can also attack ixazomib, a cancer medicine. This can decrease how well ixazomib works. It is important to talk to your health care provider before receiving the yellow fever vaccine if you are taking ixazomib.

Major: Mercaptopurine is used to treat leukemia. It works by blocking the growth of cancer cells. Pexidartinib is used to treat sarcoma. It works by stopping the spread of cancer cells. Taking mercaptopurine together with pexidartinib may decrease the effectiveness of both drugs.

Major: The combination of astemizole and ceritinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens, but it may involve the way that astemizole and ceritinib are metabolized by the liver.

Major: Taking leflunomide together with salsalate can cause major side effects. This is because salsalate can increase the level of leflunomide in your body. The FDA recommends avoiding this combination unless your doctor tells you to do so.
Major: Tinzaparin is used to treat deep vein thrombosis. Edoxaban is an anticoagulant. Taking tinzaparin together with edoxaban increases the risk of bleeding.

Major: When mipomersen and blinatumomab are given together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the side effects of blinatumomab can be increased when given with mipomersen. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking trimipramine with ephedrine can cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure, irregular heartbeat, and seizures.

Major: Taking pazopanib together with lefamulin can cause major side effects. This is because pazopanib increases the amount of lefamulin in your body. However, this interaction has not been studied directly.

Major: When ritonavir is taken together with abemaciclib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This is because ritonavir can increase the levels of abemaciclib in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether this interaction may be harmful for you.

Major: When conivaptan is given together with ivacaftor, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the combination of these drugs may cause dehydration.

Major: The asparaginase can reduce the number of white blood cells in your body. This can make you more likely to get an infection. The typhoid vaccine contains live viruses which can cause problems for people who have low numbers of white blood cells.

Major: Taking chlorphenesin while taking pentazocine can cause severe drowsiness, confusion, hallucinations, and other mental effects. This interaction is due to the fact that chlorphenesin increases the effect of pentazocine.

Major: When taking both spironolactone and potassium citrate together, there is an increased risk of hyperkalemia (high blood potassium levels) compared to taking either drug alone. This is because spironolactone can increase the amount of potassium in your body, while potassium citrate can decrease the amount of potassium in your body. Therefore, when taken together, they may cancel each other out, leading to normal potassium levels. However, this effect may not be seen in all patients, especially those who have kidney problems.
Major: Physostigmine can cause major problems when taken together with bupropion. This problem may occur because physostigmine increases the levels of bupropion in your body.

Major: Enzalutamide and osimertinib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because enzalutamide can increase the effects of osimertinib, which also increases the risk of bleeding.

Major: Digoxin is used to treat heart failure and abnormal heart rhythms. Calcium gluconate is used to treat hypocalcemia (low levels of calcium in the blood) and hyperkalemia (high levels of potassium in the blood). Taking digoxin together with calcium gluconate can increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart such as ventricular tachycardia (fast heart rate). It is important to be aware of this potential interaction when taking these medications together.
Major: The combination of apixaban and plicamycin should be avoided because it can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: Taking ibuprofen with apixaban can cause major bleeding. This may happen because ibuprofen can increase the effects of apixaban.
Major: Taking warfarin together with etodolac can cause major bleeding. This may happen because etodolac increases the effects of warfarin.
Major: When carbamazepine is taken together with venetoclax, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When tamoxifen is taken together with saquinavir, tamoxifen levels in the blood can go up. This may increase the risk of side effects of tamoxifen.
Major: Valproic acid can increase levels of teriflunomide in your body. This may cause side effects such as lymphopenia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, and liver enzyme elevation.

Major: Heparin and ipilimumab can cause major drug interactions. Heparin can increase the risk of bleeding when combined with ipilimumab. This interaction may be due to heparin’s ability to interfere with blood clotting.

Major: Etanercept can increase levels of tacrolimus in your body. This may cause side effects such as high blood sugar, increased risk of infection, and kidney problems. Be alert for these symptoms. Consult your doctor or pharmacist before taking etanercept with tacrolimus.

Major: Toremifene and idarubicin should not be used together because they can cause severe side effects. Toremifene decreases the activity of an enzyme called CYP3A4, which helps break down idarubicin. This causes idarubicin levels to go up, increasing the risk of side effects.

Major: When romidepsin is given together with crizotinib, there is an increased chance of side effects. This is because romidepsin can increase the level of crizotinib in your body. It is important to closely monitor patients for side effects when these drugs are used together.

Major: When primidone is given together with trabectedin, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens.
Major: When cladribine is taken together with sirolimus, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When methoxyflurane is used together with minocycline, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: The yellow fever vaccine can cause the immune system to attack the yellow fever virus. Tocilizumab can affect the immune system. Taking both drugs together may increase the risk of the immune system attacking the yellow fever virus. This is called an allergic reaction.

Major: Fingolimod can cause a rare but serious side effect called progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) when combined with another medicine called brexucabtagene autoleucel. PML is a brain disease caused by a virus. It can cause damage to the brain and nervous system.

Major: When methylphenidate and bupropion are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is very likely to occur because methylphenidate and bupropion are both metabolized by the same enzyme in the liver.

Major: Dabrafenib and pemigatinib should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction is very likely to occur because dabrafenib and pemigatinib both affect the same pathway in the body.

Major: When ziprasidone is taken together with palonosetron, there is an increased risk of QT interval prolongation. This is a condition where the heart beats slowly, which can lead to dangerous side effects such as ventricular tachycardia and sudden death.
Major: When procainamide is taken together with triptorelin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because procainamide can increase the effects of triptorelin on blood clotting.

Major: Taking procyclidine together with potassium citrate can cause serious problems. Procyclidine may increase the levels of potassium citrate in your body. This can be dangerous for people who have certain conditions such as kidney disease.
Major: The drug pomalidomide can cause serious skin reactions when used together with yellow fever vaccine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When dexamethasone is given together with iohexol, there is a major increase in the risk of having an adverse reaction. This can be caused by the fact that iohexol may cause changes in the levels of potassium in your body, which can be affected by dexamethasone.

Major: When taking both drugs together, there is a major drug interaction between ritodrine and ceritinib. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Taking deferasirox with theophylline can cause major side effects. Deferasirox decreases the amount of theophylline in your body by increasing how fast your body breaks down theophylline. This can lead to serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: St. John’s Wort can make naldemedine less effective. This may be because St. John’s Wort reduces the amount of naldemedine in your body.

Major: When neomycin is given together with ioxilan, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Telaprevir lowers fluticasone levels by increasing its metabolism. This can reduce fluticasone’s effectiveness.
Major: When sotalol is combined with abiraterone, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Major: Taking rucaparib together with moxifloxacin can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening.

Major: When taking hydroxychloroquine together with sparfloxacin, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction may be due to the fact that sparfloxacin inhibits the metabolism of hydroxychloroquine by the liver enzyme CYP450.

Major: Fluconazole is an antifungal medication used to treat fungal infections. It works by blocking the action of lanosterol 14 alpha-demethylase, which is needed for the growth of fungi. Entrectinib is a cancer medicine used to treat solid tumors such as lung cancer. It works by blocking the action of the TRK proteins, which are needed for the growth of cancer cells. When these two drugs are taken together, they can interact in a way that may decrease how well fluconazole works. This interaction has

Major: Taking halofantrine together with enzalutamide can cause serious heart problems. This interaction is very likely to occur because halofantrine slows down the way the body gets rid of enzalutamide. It is not clear how this interaction works or why it causes heart problems.

Major: Taking primaquine together with ivosidenib can cause major side effects. Primaquine may increase levels of a chemical called phosphorylated troponin I. This chemical can be harmful at high levels. Ivosidenib may decrease levels of another chemical called platelet count. This chemical is also important for health. When taken together, these drugs may decrease levels of both chemicals. This can be dangerous.

Major: When ketoconazole is taken together with macitentan, there is an increased risk of swelling due to fluid buildup in the body. This is because ketoconazole can increase the levels of macitentan in the blood. It is important to monitor for signs of swelling when taking these medications together.
Major: Taking mefloquine together with saquinavir can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur because of how these drugs are metabolized in the body.

Major: Amprenavir can increase the effects of hydrocodone. This may cause increased side effects such as drowsiness, sedation, or breathing problems. Be especially careful when taking amprenavir together with hydrocodone.

Major: The combination of pegaspargase and typhoid vaccine should be avoided because there is a high risk of serious harm to the patient. This interaction may cause severe side effects such as fever, rash, and inflammation of the blood vessels. It is not clear how this interaction works.

Major: Taking primaquine together with dolasetron can cause serious harm to your body. This interaction is very likely to occur because primaquine and dolasetron are broken down by the same liver enzyme.
Major: Osimertinib is used to treat lung cancer. Upadacitinib is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Taking these drugs together may cause serious side effects such as liver damage.

Major: When vemurafenib is given together with halothane, there is an increased risk of side effects such as cardiac arrest. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking midostaurin together with upadacitinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking lomitapide together with lapatinib can cause major side effects. This is because lomitapide increases the levels of lapatinib in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: The combination of abarelix and ozanimod can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Major: The yellow fever vaccine should not be given together with fluorouracil because the vaccine may not work properly.
Major: Apalutamide can increase the levels of voxelotor in your body. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects from voxelotor.
Major: Taking golimumab and brodalumab together can cause serious side effects. It is not clear how these drugs interact to cause this effect.
Major: Taking phenylpropanolamine together with ergotamine can cause severe high blood pressure. This may be dangerous for people who already have high blood pressure.

Major: Erythromycin can cause serious problems when taken together with nefazodone. This problem has been found in studies of people taking these drugs together. The problem may be caused because erythromycin slows down how quickly nefazodone is broken down by the body. This can lead to too much nefazodone being present. It is important to talk to your doctor or pharmacist before taking these drugs together.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause skin rashes. If you take the smallpox vaccine and then take paclitaxel within 1 month, your risk of having a severe reaction like skin rash increases.
Major: The combination of morphine (liposomal) and dextropropoxyphene can cause severe respiratory depression. This means that your breathing slows down too much.
Major: Gemzar can cause serious liver problems when taken together with Loop. This may be due to the fact that Gemzar is broken down by the liver and Loop affects how the liver works.

Major: When budesonide is taken together with saquinavir, there is an increased chance of side effects. This is because saquinavir increases the levels of budesonide in the blood. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.

Major: Cisapride and ofloxacin should not be used together because cisapride can increase the levels of ofloxacin in your body. This may cause serious side effects such as seizures, mental status changes, and heart rhythm problems.

Major: Fedratinib and pemigatinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Fedratinib may increase levels of pemigatinib in your body, which could lead to bleeding and other side effects.

Major: Taking oxaprozin together with regorafenib can cause major side effects. This is because oxaprozin increases the level of regorafenib in your body. The FDA recommends avoiding this combination.

Major: Iloperidone can increase the effects of morphine. This may cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, sedation, and respiratory depression. Patients should be closely monitored for these symptoms.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking lumacaftor together with pemigatinib can cause serious side effects. The body may have problems digesting food.

Major: Taking lorazepam together with codeine can be dangerous. It may cause drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and impaired coordination. The combination of these drugs should be avoided unless specifically directed by a doctor.
Major: When phenytoin is taken along with nitrous oxide, there is an increased risk of seizures. This interaction is major.
Major: Tipranavir decreases the levels of encorafenib in your body. This may decrease the effectiveness of encorafenib.
Major: Taking cocaine by nose while also taking doxepin can cause very serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, coma, seizures, hallucinations, and even death.
Major: Iloperidone can increase the side effects of lumefantrine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Dasatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Deferiprone is used to treat iron overload in people who have had a heart attack or who have had too many blood transfusions. Taking deferiprone together with dasatinib can increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart. This drug interaction is considered major because it can cause serious harm to the patient.

Major: Heparin is an anticoagulant used to treat blood clots. Telavancin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Taking these drugs together may cause bleeding because heparin increases the risk of bleeding from taking telavancin.

Major: When cangrelor is taken together with zanubrutinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because cangrelor increases blood flow by blocking platelets from sticking together, while zanubrutinib blocks blood clotting.
Major: Taking acitretin together with minocycline can cause severe skin irritation and rash. This is because acitretin increases the levels of minocycline in your body.
Major: When simvastatin and gemfibrozil are taken together, they can increase each other’s side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Thioridazine and gilteritinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because thioridazine slows down the heart rate and gilteritinib speeds up the heart rate. The combination of these two drugs can lead to an abnormal heart rhythm called torsades de pointes.

Major: When morphine and carisoprodol are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as overdose and death. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are metabolized by the same enzyme.
Major: Saquinavir can increase ivacaftor levels by about 50%. This may lead to increased side effects of ivacaftor.

Major: When bacitracin is given together with iopromide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Major: Goserelin can increase levels of estrogen in your body. Vandetanib decreases levels of estrogen in your body. When these drugs are used together, they may cancel each other out and cause unexpected effects.

Major: When morphine and halazepam are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, confusion, and difficulty breathing. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are broken down by the same enzyme in the liver.

Major: When taking both procainamide and siponimod together, there is an increased risk of certain side effects such as headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. This interaction may be due to the fact that these drugs can affect the way the body processes other medications. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these two drugs together.
Major: The combination of infliximab and mipomersen can cause major side effects. Infliximab may not work properly when given together with mipomersen.
Major: Taking procarbazine together with levacetylmethadol can cause severe sleepiness and drowsiness. This may increase the risk of falling asleep while driving or operating heavy machinery.
Major: Taking phenytoin together with olaparib can be dangerous. Phenytoin may increase the effects of olaparib, which could lead to an increased risk of bleeding.
Major: Taking trimipramine together with procarbazine can cause severe drowsiness and sedation. This may increase the risk of falling asleep while driving or operating machinery.

Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause skin rashes when given together with certain medicines. This vaccine may be given to people who have already been vaccinated against smallpox but who need protection from smallpox because of a weak immune system. Methylprednisolone is one such medicine. If methylprednisolone is given within 1 month before or after the smallpox vaccine, the vaccine may not work as well.

Major: When anisindione is taken together with cabozantinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body absorbs or breaks down one or both drugs. It is important to follow the prescribing information that comes with your medications for recommended doses and other instructions. If you have questions about possible drug interactions, talk to your healthcare provider or pharmacist before you take any new medication.

Major: Fludrocortisone is a steroid hormone used to treat Addison’s disease. It can be taken as a tablet or injected into the skin. Leflunomide is an immunosuppressant used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Taking leflunomide together with fludrocortisone increases the risk of high blood pressure. This may cause headaches, dizziness, fainting, or other symptoms. Patients should talk to their doctor or pharmacist before taking leflunomide

Major: Natalizumab and irinotecan should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Natalizumab decreases the way the body breaks down irinotecan, which increases the amount of irinotecan in the bloodstream. This can lead to nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and other symptoms.
Major: When levacetylmethadol is taken together with zafirlukast, there is an increased risk of side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and headache. This interaction is major.
Major: When vinorelbine is taken together with saquinavir, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When moexipril is taken together with potassium acetate, there is an increased risk of low blood pressure. This can cause dizziness, fainting, and other symptoms.

Major: Fluconazole can increase the risk of bleeding when used together with olaparib. This is because fluconazole may decrease the levels of olaparib in your body. However, this interaction has not been well studied. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether these drugs should be used together.
Major: When sotalol and enzalutamide are taken together, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.
Major: The combination of ibritumomab tiuxetan and argatroban can cause major drug interactions. This means that the combination of these drugs can have serious side effects.
Major: The anticoagulant drugs apixaban and edoxaban should not be taken together because they can increase bleeding risk. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: When cladribine is given together with tisagenlecleucel, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Major: Taking baricitinib together with selinexor can cause major side effects. This is because baricitinib increases the levels of selinexor in your body. The FDA recommends avoiding this combination unless you have no other choice.

Major: Telithromycin is an antibiotic used to treat respiratory tract infections. Axitinib is a cancer medicine used to treat kidney cancer. Taking telithromycin together with axitinib can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, and fever. These side effects may be severe enough to require hospitalization. It is recommended to stop taking telithromycin at least 7 days before starting axitinib and to avoid taking them together.

Major: When doxepin is taken along with iodine-131 (I-131), there is an increased chance of having a severe reaction. This can be due to the fact that doxepin slows down the body’s ability to remove iodine from the bloodstream.

Major: Dolasetron can be used to treat nausea caused by chemotherapy. Mifepristone is used for emergency contraception. Taking mifepristone together with dolasetron may increase the risk of side effects such as vomiting.

Major: Labetalol is used to treat high blood pressure. It can be taken by mouth or as a liquid through the nose. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It is taken by mouth. Taking labetalol and siponimod together may cause a drop in blood pressure. This can be serious. People taking both drugs should talk to their doctor or pharmacist before taking them together.

Major: Taking oxycodone together with clarithromycin can be dangerous. This is because clarithromycin slows down the way the body breaks down oxycodone. This can cause oxycodone to build up in the body, which could lead to overdose and serious side effects.
Major: Papaverine can cause major side effects when taken together with doxepin. This combination should be avoided.
Major: The uracil mustard drug can cause severe skin reactions when given together with yellow fever vaccine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with avapritinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, taking anagrelide together with avapritinib may increase the risk of bleeding. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid taking anagrelide together with avapritinib unless specifically advised by a healthcare professional.

Major: Cilostazol and apixaban should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because cilostazol slows down blood clotting while apixaban helps to speed up blood clotting.

Major: Leflunomide is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It is metabolized by an enzyme called CYP1A2. Fenofibrate is used to treat high cholesterol. It is also metabolized by CYP1A2. Taking both drugs together can increase the amount of leflunomide in your body. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: When streptokinase is given together with ramucirumab, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because streptokinase increases the body’s ability to break down blood clots, while ramucirumab can increase bleeding.
Major: When sumatriptan is taken together with dexfenfluramine, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.
Major: The antibiotic tobramycin can cause kidney damage when taken together with the dye iohexol. This combination should be avoided unless specifically recommended by a doctor.
Major: Cobicistat can increase the levels of cariprazine in your body by about two times. This may cause increased side effects.

Major: Taking clopidogrel together with tucatinib can be dangerous. This is because taking them together may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because clopidogrel and tucatinib both affect how the body processes blood thinners.

Major: Naloxegol and fedratinib should not be used together because naloxegol can make fedratinib less effective. Fedratinib works by blocking the action of certain proteins in the body. Naloxegol also blocks these same proteins. Therefore, when taken together, naloxegol may reduce the amount of fedratinib that reaches the body. This can decrease the effectiveness of fedratinib.

Major: Irinotecan (liposomal) is used to treat cancer. Boceprevir is an antiviral drug used to treat hepatitis C. Taking irinotecan (liposomal) together with boceprevir can cause serious side effects such as diarrhea and vomiting.
Major: Taking bromfenac together with edoxaban can cause major side effects. Bromfenac may increase the risk of bleeding caused by edoxaban. This interaction should be avoided.

Major: Degarelix can increase levels of bedaquiline in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of bedaquiline such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, sleep disturbances, and abnormal dreams.

Major: Taking mirabegron together with venetoclax can cause major side effects. This is because mirabegron increases levels of venetoclax in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these drugs together.

Major: When ketoconazole is taken together with copanlisib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as diarrhea, vomiting, nausea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening.

Major: When deferasirox is taken together with ruxolitinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction may be due to the fact that ruxolitinib inhibits the activity of an enzyme called CYP2C19, which helps break down deferasirox into its active form. It is important for patients taking these medications together to monitor their symptoms and report them to their healthcare provider.
Major: Amiodarone can increase the levels of docetaxel in your body by about two times. This may increase the side effects of docetaxel.

Major: Taking droperidol together with degarelix can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because degarelix can increase the level of droperidol in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these drugs together.

Major: The combination of ozanimod and satralizumab can cause serious problems. Ozanimod may increase the levels of satralizumab in your body. This can lead to side effects such as inflammation of the brain. Avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor has told you to do so.

Major: When methadone is taken along with palonosetron, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This means that the electrical activity of the heart is altered, which can lead to potentially fatal abnormal heart rhythms.

Major: When sotalol and vilanterol are taken together, they can cause dangerously low blood pressure. This happens because sotalol slows down the heart rate too much, while vilanterol increases blood pressure too much.

Major: Taking protriptyline together with flumazenil can cause major harm. Protriptyline works by blocking certain receptors in the brain. Flumazenil works by unblocking these same receptors. This can lead to a dangerous increase in activity.

Major: When hydroxyurea and teriflunomide are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear.

Major: Dabrafenib is used to treat melanoma skin cancer. It works by blocking an abnormal protein called BRAF. Norgestrel is a type of birth control pill. It works by stopping the production of sperm in men and preventing ovulation in women. Taking norgestrel together with dabrafenib can increase the risk of bleeding. This may be due to the fact that both drugs affect blood clotting.

Major: When butalbital is taken with hydrocodone, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because both drugs have sedative effects. Therefore, when these two drugs are used together, they can cause more drowsiness than when used alone.
Major: Taking triflupromazine together with ribociclib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Risperidone is used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. It should not be taken together with lumefantrine because it can increase the risk of serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: When dicoumarol is taken along with ibuprofen, the blood thinning effect of dicoumarol can be reduced by up to 40%. This may increase the risk of bleeding and blood clots.
Major: Taking vandetanib together with adenosine can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When procainamide is used together with doxepin, there is a high risk of serious side effects such as severe allergic reactions. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are metabolized by the same enzyme in the liver.
Major: Flecainide can increase the levels of macimorelin in your body. This may cause some side effects. Be especially careful when taking these drugs together.
Major: Telaprevir and encorafenib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: When sotalol and cabozantinib are taken together, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When propafenone is taken together with panobinostat, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and constipation. This interaction is moderate to major.

Major: Taking celecoxib while taking eliglustat can cause major side effects. This is because celecoxib may increase the levels of eliglustat in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of heart disease and stroke.

Major: Taking ticagrelor together with boceprevir can cause major side effects. This is because ticagrelor may be broken down by an enzyme in the body called CYP3A4. Boceprevir, however, also blocks this enzyme from working normally. As a result, ticagrelor levels in the blood may go up, increasing the risk of bleeding.

Major: When taking tositumomab together with certolizumab pegol, there is an increased risk of side effects such as headache, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, fever, chills, rash, itching, wheezing, dyspnea, hypotension, and bronchospasm.
Major: Taking tetrabenazine together with fingolimod can cause serious problems. Tetrabenazine may increase the effects of fingolimod. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking nortriptyline together with ceritinib can cause serious side effects. Nortriptyline may increase levels of ceritinib in your body. This can lead to increased side effects of ceritinib.

Major: When cinoxacin is taken together with tolazamide, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Natalizumab and dupilumab should not be used together because they can cause serious problems such as decreased white blood cells. This problem has been seen in studies.

Major: When doxepin topical cream is used together with sodium oxybate, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because doxepin can increase the levels of sodium oxybate in the body. It is important to be aware of this potential interaction when taking these medications together.
Major: The combination of panobinostat and tinzaparin can cause major bleeding. This may be due to the fact that panobinostat increases levels of a blood clotting factor.

Major: When ibritumomab tiuxetan and tositumomab are given together, they can have a stronger effect on the body than when they are used alone. This may cause side effects such as fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, weakness, fatigue, headache, dizziness, muscle pain, back pain, chest pain, irregular heartbeat, high blood pressure, low blood pressure, swelling of the hands, feet, ankles, or legs, rash, itching

Major: Taking abiraterone together with panobinostat can cause major side effects. This is because abiraterone and panobinostat affect liver enzymes in the same way. Liver enzymes help to break down drugs into smaller molecules so they can be removed from the body. When these two drugs are taken together, they may increase each other’s effect on liver enzymes. This can lead to increased side effects.

Major: Mifepristone can increase the levels of larotrectinib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of larotrectinib such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, fever, headache, dizziness, and constipation.

Major: Tocilizumab is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It can also be used to treat other autoimmune diseases. The varicella zoster vaccine is used to prevent chickenpox infection in people who have never had chickenpox before. This vaccine may also be used to prevent shingles in adults who have had chickenpox before. If you receive both of these medicines together, there is a high chance of having a severe reaction.

Major: Taking crizotinib together with benzhydrocodone can cause major side effects. This is because crizotinib can increase the levels of benzhydrocodone in your body. Benzhydrocodone is a pain medication that can cause breathing problems when taken alone. Therefore, taking crizotinib together with benzhydrocodone may increase the risk of breathing problems.

Major: The combination of fluorouracil and samarium lexidronam can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the drugs may have harmful effects together when taken at the same time. It is recommended to avoid taking these two drugs together.

Drug_B: Bacillus calmette-guerin substrain tice live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: When bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) vaccine is given together with mitomycin, there is an increased risk of BCG vaccine-related side effects such as skin rash, fever, swollen lymph nodes, and cough. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Thiotepa is a chemotherapy medication used before bone marrow transplantation to help prevent rejection of the transplanted bone marrow. Talimogene laherparepvec is a genetically modified herpes virus used to treat melanoma. The combination of thiotepa and talimogene laherparepvec should be avoided because thiotepa can cause severe liver damage when combined with other medications. This risk may be higher when thiotepa is given together with talimogene laherparepvec.
Major: Saquinavir and elagolix should not be used together because they can increase the risk of liver problems. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Imatinib should be used with caution when taking baricitinib. This combination can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking vilanterol together with propranolol can cause serious problems such as very slow heart rate, shallow breathing, and low blood pressure. This interaction may be due to the fact that vilanterol increases the effects of propranolol on the heart and lungs.

Major: Taking phenylbutazone and deferiprone together can cause severe liver problems. This interaction has been observed in patients taking these drugs together. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When ruxolitinib is taken together with clarithromycin, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Azithromycin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Betrixaban is an anticoagulant used to prevent blood clots. Taking azithromycin together with betrixaban can increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: When cladribine is taken together with acalabrutinib, there is an increased risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Tamoxifen is used to treat breast cancer. It works by blocking the effects of estrogen on breast cancer cells. Pimozide is an antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia and Tourette syndrome. Taking tamoxifen and pimozide together can cause serious side effects such as seizures, muscle spasms, and heart problems. This interaction may be due to the fact that tamoxifen increases the levels of pimozide in your body.

Major: Taking gatifloxacin together with degarelix can cause serious problems. This is because gatifloxacin increases the levels of degarelix in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.
Major: When dicoumarol is taken together with fluoxymesterone, the dose of dicoumarol should be increased because there is a major drug interaction between these two drugs.

Major: Quinine can cause major problems when taken together with ivabradine. This is because quinine slows down the way the body gets rid of ivabradine. This can lead to very high levels of ivabradine in the blood. This can be dangerous and increase the risk of side effects.
Major: Cidofovir and acyclovir are both antiviral drugs used to treat viral eye infections. Taking cidofovir together with acyclovir can cause severe side effects such as kidney damage.

Major: Taking delavirdine together with sirolimus can cause major drug interactions. This means that delavirdine can increase the side effects of sirolimus by more than two times. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: Taking ciprofloxacin and chloroquine together can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and seizures.
Major: Amisulpride and gilteritinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Clozapine can cause serious problems when taken together with uracil mustard. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Atazanavir is used to treat HIV infection. It works by blocking an enzyme called CYP3A4. Budesonide is used to treat asthma and other lung diseases. It works by blocking receptors for inflammatory substances. When taken together, atazanavir can increase the levels of budesonide in your body. This may lead to increased side effects.
Major: Taking cyproheptadine together with potassium chloride can cause serious side effects such as heart rhythm problems. This interaction is well known to occur.
Major: When enalapril is taken together with potassium acetate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking midostaurin together with infliximab can cause serious side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because midostaurin is broken down by an enzyme in the body called CYP3A4, which is also used to break down infliximab. When these two drugs are taken together, they compete for this enzyme, which can lead to increased side effects.

Major: The combination of etanercept and gemcitabine can cause major side effects. Etanercept can increase the risk of infection by reducing the body’s ability to fight off germs. Gemcitabine can also weaken the immune system. Therefore, combining these drugs may lead to an increased risk of serious infections.

Major: Terfenadine and voriconazole should not be used together because they can cause serious heart rhythm problems. This problem has been seen in patients taking these drugs together even when the doses of both drugs were at their lowest possible levels.

Major: When diflunisal is taken together with iothalamic acid, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This is because diflunisal can cause kidney damage by itself, and iothalamic acid also causes kidney damage by itself. Therefore, when these two drugs are used together, they may increase each other’s effect on the kidneys.

Major: When certolizumab pegol is given together with isatuximab, there is an increased risk of serious allergic reactions (hypersensitivity) such as skin rashes, hives, itching, swelling of the face, mouth, tongue, throat, or other parts of the body, difficulty breathing, wheezing, wheeze, low blood pressure, tachycardia, flushing, fever, and organ damage. These effects may occur even at the first dose. The mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Taking bictegravir together with ferrous fumarate can lead to major changes in how well bictegravir works and how safe it is. This is because bictegravir may decrease how well ferrous fumarate works.
Major: Ciprofloxacin can increase the side effects of lumefantrine. This is because ciprofloxacin increases the levels of lumefantrine in your body.

Major: When rifabutin is taken together with sirolimus, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, rifabutin may increase the levels of sirolimus in your body by about two times. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects such as kidney problems, high blood sugar, high cholesterol, and diarrhea. It is recommended to avoid taking rifabutin together with sirolimus unless specifically advised by a healthcare

Major: Sevoflurane is a medicine used to help people wake up from general anesthesia. Vemurafenib is a cancer medicine. When these two medicines are taken together, they can interact in a way that makes sevoflurane less effective at waking people up from general anesthesia. This interaction may be harmful.
Major: When anakinra and teriflunomide are taken together, they can cause serious changes in blood cell counts. This has been seen in studies done in animals. It is not clear how this happens.
Major: Taking macimorelin with dolasetron can cause severe diarrhea. This may be due to an increase in the levels of serotonin in the body. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.

Major: When clopidogrel is taken together with cabozantinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because clopidogrel reduces platelet activity while cabozantinib increases platelet activity. The combination of these effects can lead to excessive bleeding.
Major: When baricitinib is taken together with zanubrutinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because baricitinib can increase the effects of zanubrutinib on blood clotting.
Major: Using epinephrine on an area of skin where cocaine has been applied can cause severe reactions.

Major: Valaciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat herpes zoster (shingles) and herpes simplex. Ioversol is an iodinated contrast agent used for radiographic imaging of blood vessels. Taking valaciclovir while being treated with ioversol can cause severe kidney damage.

Major: When mirtazapine is taken together with palonosetron, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This means that the electrical activity of the heart takes longer to complete each beat. It is important to note that this interaction has been observed in studies but the exact cause is unknown.

Major: The combination of everolimus and ioversol can cause major side effects. This interaction may be caused by the fact that everolimus is broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4, which is also used to break down ioversol. When these two drugs are taken together, they compete for this enzyme, which can lead to changes in the levels of everolimus in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these medications together.

Major: If you take itraconazole at the same time as tofacitinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. It is best to avoid taking these two drugs together.

Major: The combination of inotuzumab ozogamicin and rotavirus vaccine can cause severe side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because inotuzumab ozogamicin and rotavirus vaccine are both given through an intravenous injection.

Major: Mercaptopurine can be used to treat leukemia. It works by blocking cancer cells from dividing. Talimogene laherparepvec is a type of treatment for melanoma skin cancer. It works by helping the body’s immune system attack cancer cells. Mercaptopurine may decrease the effectiveness of talimogene laherparepvec. This is because mercaptopurine can increase the number of certain types of white blood cells. These white blood cells can attack and destroy talimogene laherparepvec.

Major: When nizatidine and rilpivirine are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: The combination of maprotiline and cabozantinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens, but it may involve the way these drugs are broken down by the body.

Major: Taking trovafloxacin together with iohexol can cause serious harm to your body. This is because trovafloxacin can increase the level of iohexol in your blood. However, this interaction has been well studied and there is enough evidence to support this finding.
Major: When golimumab and sarilumab are given together, they can have a stronger effect than when used alone. This may increase the risk of side effects.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction between ibritumomab tiuxetan and caplacizumab. It can cause severe reactions such as thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA), which can be life threatening. TMA is a condition where blood vessels become narrow due to clotting. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown but may involve complement activation.
Major: Osimertinib is used to treat lung cancer. Berotralstat is used to treat cystic fibrosis. Taking osimertinib together with berotralstat can cause serious side effects.
Major: The drug thiotepa can cause severe allergic reactions when given together with rotavirus vaccine. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Vandetanib should not be taken together with vemurafenib because it can increase the side effects of vemurafenib. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: When voriconazole is taken together with irinotecan, there is an increased risk of side effects such as diarrhea, vomiting, nausea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking ondansetron together with bedaquiline can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. This is because ondansetron slows down the heart rate and bedaquiline increases the heart rate. The combination of these two drugs can lead to an abnormal heart rhythm. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid taking ondansetron together with bedaquiline unless specifically advised by a healthcare professional.

Major: The combination of aflibercept and measles virus vaccine live attenuated can cause major drug interactions. This means that the combination may have an effect on your body that is greater than the effects of either drug alone.

Major: Lurasidone and enzalutamide should not be used together because they can increase QT interval. This is a known risk of both drugs when taken alone. The combination may also cause other side effects such as irregular heartbeat, dizziness, fainting, and sudden death.

Major: The combination of ioxilan and inotersen can cause major drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in a way that could be harmful. Inotersen decreases how much ioxilan is eliminated from the body. This can increase the level of ioxilan in your blood. It is important to follow the prescribing information for both drugs when they are used together.

Major: When balsalazide is given together with ioversol, there is an increased risk of side effects such as hypersensitivity reactions. These can include rash, swelling, difficulty breathing, low blood pressure, and even shock. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: The drug tofacitinib can increase the risk of infection when used together with rotavirus vaccine. This is because tofacitinib may affect the immune system’s ability to fight off infections. It is important for patients to get vaccinated against rotavirus before starting tofacitinib. Patients should also talk to their healthcare provider about whether to get vaccinated while taking tofacitinib.

Major: Imipramine can cause serious problems when taken together with cisapride. This is because imipramine slows down the activity of an enzyme called CYP2D6. CYP2D6 helps to break down cisapride into smaller molecules that are easier for your body to use. When this enzyme is slowed down by imipramine, cisapride builds up in your body and may cause serious side effects.

Major: Ciprofloxacin can cause major problems when taken together with aminophylline. This is because ciprofloxacin increases the level of aminophylline in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and muscle weakness.

Major: Taking esketamine while taking fenfluramine can be dangerous. It may cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure, heart attack, stroke, seizures, and abnormal thoughts or behaviors. The interaction between these drugs is moderate.
Major: Tucatinib and deflazacort can cause major side effects when taken together. This interaction may increase the risk of liver problems.

Major: Taking St. John’s wort with doxepin can be dangerous. St. John’s wort decreases the levels of doxepin in your body more than other drugs. This can lead to serious side effects such as seizures, coma, hallucinations, and even death.

Major: The drugs cobicistat and berotralstat both affect the way the body processes the drug efavirenz. This can cause efavirenz levels to be too high or too low. This may increase side effects of efavirenz or make efavirenz less effective.

Major: Leuprolide can cause menstrual irregularities. Dofetilide is used to treat an irregular heartbeat called tachycardia. Taking leuprolide together with dofetilide may increase the risk of serious changes in the heartbeat. Therefore, this combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking trazodone together with cabozantinib can cause serious side effects. Trazodone may increase the levels of cabozantinib in your body. This can lead to increased side effects of cabozantinib such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, and bleeding.
Major: When tenecteplase and eptifibatide are given together, they can interact in such a way that tenecteplase may lose its effectiveness. This interaction is major.
Major: When certolizumab pegol and polatuzumab vedotin are given together, they can increase each other’s side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking abatacept together with siponimod can cause major side effects. This is because abatacept may increase the levels of siponimod in your body. However, this interaction has not been confirmed by other studies.

Major: Fentanyl is an opioid pain medication used for moderate to severe pain. Nilotinib is a medicine used to treat certain types of leukemia. Taking fentanyl together with nilotinib can cause very serious drowsiness, dizziness, or difficulty breathing. These effects may last for several days after stopping the medicines. Therefore, do not take these medicines together unless your doctor tells you to.

Major: When irbesartan is taken together with potassium chloride, there is an increased risk of hyperkalemia (high blood potassium levels). This can lead to muscle weakness, paralysis, heart rhythm problems, or even death.

Major: Taking tizanidine together with thiabendazole can cause major side effects. This is because tizanidine increases the levels of thiabendazole in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.

Major: Quinidine is an antiarrhythmic drug used to treat irregular heartbeat. It should not be taken together with halofantrine, which is an antimalarial drug. This combination can cause serious side effects such as life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias.

Major: When ticlopidine is taken together with clozapine, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because ticlopidine increases the levels of clozapine in the blood. It is important to monitor patients for signs of bleeding when these two drugs are used together.

Major: When disopyramide is taken together with flutamide, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because flutamide can increase the levels of disopyramide in the blood.
Major: The drugs Belimumab and Siponimod should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. This interaction may increase the risk of liver problems.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking antithymocyte immunoglobulin (rabbit) together with golimumab can cause serious side effects. The immune system of the body will attack the cells of the body.
Major: Irinotecan is used to treat cancer. Primidone is used to treat seizures. Taking irinotecan and primidone together can cause serious side effects such as seizures.

Major: When eptifibatide and vorapaxar are taken together, they can increase bleeding risk. This is because both drugs work on platelets, which are blood cells that help stop bleeding. Eptifibatide works by directly blocking platelet activity. Vorapaxar works by increasing levels of proteins that naturally inhibit platelet activity. Taking these two drugs together increases the chance that platelet activity will be blocked too much, leading to increased bleeding risk.
Major: When voriconazole is taken together with deflazacort, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Enoxaparin is an anticoagulant used to treat blood clots. Cabozantinib is a cancer medicine. Taking these drugs together may increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking fingolimod with doxepin can cause serious problems. Fingolimod slows down the heart rate. Doxepin increases the heart rate. This can lead to a dangerously fast heart rate. Do not take fingolimod with doxepin unless your doctor says you should.
Major: When cladribine is given together with corticotropin, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When diatrizoate is given together with givosiran, there may be a major increase in the level of potassium in your blood. This can cause serious side effects such as heart rhythm problems.

Major: Taking aminolevulinic acid together with pirfenidone can cause major side effects. Aminolevulinic acid may increase the levels of pirfenidone in your body by an unknown amount. This could lead to serious side effects.

Major: When human immunoglobulin G (IgG) is given together with amphotericin B liposomal, there is a moderate to major increase in the risk of serious side effects. This includes infusion reactions, which can be life threatening.

Major: Mercaptopurine is used to treat leukemia. It should not be taken together with clozapine because this can cause severe liver damage. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of cabergoline in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects such as nausea, vomiting, dizziness, and breast enlargement.
Major: Erythromycin and lefamulin are antibiotics used to treat bacterial pneumonia. When taken together, they can increase the risk of hearing loss.
Major: The combination of panobinostat and fostemsavir can cause severe side effects. This interaction may be due to the fact that panobinostat increases the levels of fostemsavir in the blood.

Major: Enzalutamide can increase levels of valbenazine in your body by about 10%. This may increase side effects of valbenazine such as involuntary movements. Be aware of these possible side effects when taking both drugs together.
Major: Clozapine and nilutamide should not be used together because they can increase the risk of blood clots.

Major: Taking topiramate together with chlorpheniramine can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion. This is because chlorpheniramine can increase the levels of topiramate in your body.
Major: When canakinumab is used together with fingolimod, there is a high risk of serious problems with the heart rate. This problem has been observed in studies.
Major: Mazindol can cause serious side effects when taken together with Isocarboxazid. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Caffeine can increase the side effects of tizanidine. This is because caffeine increases the levels of tizanidine in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: Taking tofacitinib together with abemaciclib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor tells you otherwise.

Major: Taking pregabalin together with morphine can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating. This is because both drugs act on the brain to reduce pain and induce sleep.

Major: When cobimetinib is used together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the combination of these drugs may increase the risk of liver problems.

Major: Taking papaverine together with saquinavir can cause major side effects. Papaverine slows down the breakdown of saquinavir by the liver, which increases the levels of saquinavir in your body. This may increase the risk of side effects.
Major: When cholecalciferol and doxercalciferol are taken together, they can interact in a way that may cause serious side effects.

Major: Flecainide is a medication used to treat arrhythmias. Cobicistat is used to increase the effects of other medications. Taking these two together can cause serious side effects such as heart problems.

Major: Pimozide is a medication used to treat certain mental disorders. Bosutinib is a medication used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking pimozide and bosutinib together can cause serious side effects. Therefore, taking these medications together should be avoided.

Major: Taking delavirdine together with sirolimus can cause major drug interactions. This means that delavirdine can increase the side effects of sirolimus by more than two times. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: When bupropion is taken together with iopamidol, there is an increased risk of seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking panobinostat together with ivosidenib can cause major side effects. This is because panobinostat can increase the levels of ivosidenib in your body. This may raise your risk for bleeding. Take care when taking these drugs together.
Major: Taking voriconazole together with trabectedin can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase the risk of liver problems.
Major: Taking trastuzumab emtansine together with acetylsalicylic acid can cause major bleeding problems.

Major: Taking trimetrexate together with teriflunomide can cause major harm. Trimetrexate works by stopping cells from making folic acid. Teriflunomide also stops cells from dividing. Together, they can stop cells from working properly.

Major: The combination of oxaprozin and cabozantinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens, but it may involve the way these drugs are broken down by the body.
Major: Taking palonosetron together with pentazocine can cause severe constipation. This may be due to an effect on the brain by pentazocine. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: Delavirdine can increase vorapaxar levels in the blood by about 40%. This may increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: When carbamazepine is taken together with venetoclax, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When methadone is taken together with nilutamide, the amount of methadone in the blood can go up by more than 50%. This can increase side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and problems with concentration. It is not clear why this happens.
Major: When idelalisib is taken together with docetaxel, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Major: When ruxolitinib is taken together with lonafarnib, there is an increased risk of serious skin reactions. This interaction is major.

Major: The combination of haloperidol and histrelin can cause major side effects. Haloperidol may increase the levels of histrelin in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as changes in sexual function.
Major: Taking insulin human together with ciprofloxacin can cause major effects on your body. Ciprofloxacin can make insulin human less effective.

Major: Taking panobinostat together with lenvatinib can cause major side effects. This is because panobinostat can increase the levels of lenvatinib in your body. This may lead to too much lenvatinib in your body, causing serious side effects.
Major: When taking both drugs together, there may be a change in how well they work or side effects. The risk of serious liver problems increases when taking these two drugs together.

Major: Taking clopidogrel together with loperamide can be dangerous. Clopidogrel works by blocking blood clots from forming. Loperamide works to slow down bowel movements. When these two drugs are taken together, they may slow down blood flow too much. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: When taking both drugs together, there is a high risk of bleeding. This is because betrixaban can increase the effects of cabozantinib on blood clotting. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether to take these medications together.
Major: Taking perphenazine with potassium citrate can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This interaction is well known to occur.

Major: Taking oxycodone together with dabrafenib can be dangerous. It may cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and constipation. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear but it might be due to changes in how these drugs are metabolized in the body.

Major: Simvastatin is a cholesterol-lowering medication. Mipomersen is an antisense oligonucleotide used to treat familial hypercholesterolemia. Taking simvastatin together with mipomersen can cause severe liver problems.

Major: Valaciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat herpes zoster (shingles) and herpes simplex. Iothalamic acid is a diuretic medication used to treat fluid overload. Taking valaciclovir together with iothalamic acid can cause severe kidney damage.

Major: When alfentanil is taken together with ketoconazole, the amount of alfentanil in the blood can go up by more than 50%. This can lead to stronger side effects such as drowsiness, nausea, vomiting, and respiratory depression. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.

Major: Taking ondansetron with procainamide can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. This is because ondansetron inhibits the activity of an enzyme called CYP2D6, which helps break down procainamide into its active form. When this enzyme is inhibited, more procainamide stays in the body and builds up in the heart, causing abnormal electrical activity.

Major: Taking lorazepam together with hydrocodone can be dangerous. It may cause drowsiness, dizziness, and impaired coordination. The risk of these side effects is higher when taking both drugs together than when taking either drug alone.

Major: When certolizumab pegol is used together with palbociclib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening. The reason for this interaction is that both drugs are metabolized by the same enzyme in the liver. This means that when they are taken together, the enzyme may become overloaded and unable to break down either drug properly. As a result, more of the drug remains in the body and increases the chance of side effects.

Major: Desmopressin is used to treat diabetes insipidus, which causes excessive thirst and urination. Prednisolone is an anti-inflammatory drug. Taking prednisolone together with desmopressin can increase the risk of high blood pressure.

Major: When posaconazole and vandetanib are taken together, they can increase levels of vandetanib in your body. This may cause serious side effects such as diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, rash, and/or fatigue.
Major: Taking phenobarbital with nintedanib can cause major changes in how quickly these drugs are broken down by the body. This may lead to side effects of both drugs.

Major: When dextromethorphan and levomilnacipran are taken together, they can increase each other’s effects. This may cause increased side effects such as dizziness, drowsiness, nausea, vomiting, and headache.
Major: Taking prednisone together with bempedoic acid can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase your risk of developing muscle weakness.
Major: When ibutilide is taken together with terfenadine, there is an increased risk of dangerous abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening.

Major: Remifentanil can cause major problems when taken with bupropion. Remifentanil is used to treat pain during procedures. It works quickly and is broken down by the body within minutes. Bupropion is an antidepressant. It takes longer for the body to break down than remifentanil. When these drugs are taken together, they can build up in your body and cause serious side effects.
Major: When mesoridazine is used together with doxepin topical, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This means that you may feel sleepy or dizzy.
Major: When doxepin is taken together with lumefantrine, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because doxepin can increase the levels of lumefantrine in the body.

Major: Taking mephentermine with methylene blue can cause severe side effects such as high blood pressure, fast heart rate, and seizures. This interaction may be due to an increase in the level of norepinephrine in the body.

Major: Isotretinoin is used to treat acne. It can be taken by mouth as a pill. Teriflunomide is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It is taken once daily as a capsule. This interaction is well known and has been reported in many studies.
Major: Ibutilide and primaquine should not be used together because they can cause a dangerous heart rhythm called torsades de pointes. This interaction is well known to occur.
