Major: Amikacin can cause hearing loss when used for long periods of time. Iodipamide also causes hearing loss when used to treat high blood pressure. When these drugs are used together, they may increase the risk of hearing loss.

Major: Papaverine and siponimod should not be used together because they can cause dangerous side effects. Papaverine decreases blood pressure while siponimod increases blood pressure. This combination can lead to serious problems such as dizziness, fainting, and falls.

Major: Morphine (liposomal) can be taken together with phenobarbital. However, when these drugs are taken together, the dose of phenobarbital may need to be adjusted because phenobarbital can increase the level of morphine in your body.

Major: When vinblastine and tucatinib are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, taking vinblastine and tucatinib together may increase the risk of diarrhea.

Major: Fingolimod and gilteritinib should not be used together because they can cause serious problems such as bradycardia (slow heart rate) and prolonged QT interval. These effects may be more likely to occur when fingolimod is given first, but they could also happen if gilteritinib is given first. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.
Major: When glimepiride and norfloxacin are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur.

Major: When tipranavir is taken together with panobinostat, there is an increased chance of side effects. This is because tipranavir can increase the levels of panobinostat in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether this combination is safe for you.
Major: Grepafloxacin can increase the levels of doxorubicin in your body by about 10%. This may increase the side effects of doxorubicin such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and myelosuppression.

Major: Taking insulin glargine together with ciprofloxacin can cause major changes in blood sugar levels. This is because ciprofloxacin blocks the action of an enzyme that helps insulin glargine work properly.

Major: Omacetaxine mepesuccinate is used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia. It can increase the risk of bleeding when taken together with rivaroxaban, which is used to prevent blood clots. This interaction is major.
Major: Sulfinpyrazone can increase the risk of bleeding when taken together with dasatinib. This is because sulfinpyrazone may increase the effects of dasatinib on blood clotting.

Major: The combination of nabumetone and apixaban should be avoided because there is a major risk of bleeding. This interaction may occur because nabumetone can increase the levels of apixaban in your body.

Major: Efalizumab is an immune system suppressing drug used to treat psoriasis. It should not be given together with smallpox vaccine because efalizumab may increase the risk of severe smallpox infection.

Major: When rifabutin is taken together with irinotecan, it can increase the risk of side effects on the skin, eyes, mouth, stomach, intestines, liver, or other parts of the body. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking indomethacin together with temsirolimus can cause major side effects. This is because indomethacin increases the level of temsirolimus in your body.
Major: When nintedanib and lorlatinib are taken together, they can interact in a way that increases side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When lithium is taken together with anagrelide, there is a major increase in the risk of bleeding. This may be due to the fact that anagrelide decreases platelet count while lithium increases it. However, this is not completely clear.

Major: When nitric oxide is used together with prilocaine, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. Nitric oxide causes vasodilation, while prilocaine inhibits the production of nitric oxide. The result is that when nitric oxide is combined with prilocaine, it may lead to excessive vasodilation.
Major: Taking methotrexate while getting a live typhoid vaccine can cause severe liver problems. This is because methotrexate can increase the risk of liver damage caused by the vaccine.

Major: Taking amoxapine together with sibutramine can be dangerous. It may cause serious side effects such as increased heart rate, high blood pressure, and stroke. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but it might be due to the effect of both drugs on the central nervous system.
Major: Saquinavir and tofacitinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Levacetylmethadol (LAMA) is a pain medication. It can be used to treat coughs and pain. It works by blocking the body’s ability to feel pain. Pasireotide (PASI) is a medicine used to treat Cushing’s disease. It works by decreasing the amount of certain hormones made by the body. When these two drugs are taken together, they may increase the risk of drowsiness. This means you could feel sleepy when taking them together.

Major: The combination of mazindol and linezolid can cause serious side effects such as heart problems. This interaction has been observed in patients taking both drugs together. It is important to avoid this combination when possible.

Major: Ibutilide can increase the levels of toremifene in your body by about 50%. This may lead to increased side effects of toremifene such as hot flashes, headaches, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness, drowsiness, and weakness.

Major: When taking both drugs together, there may be a higher risk of side effects than when taking each drug alone. This is because these drugs can increase levels of an enzyme called CYP3A4, which can change how other drugs work in your body.
Major: Imatinib should not be taken together with sonidegib because imatinib can increase the level of sonidegib in your body. This may cause serious side effects.

Major: Ifosfamide is used to treat cancer. Deferiprone is used to treat iron overload conditions such as thalassemia. Taking deferiprone together with ifosfamide can increase the risk of liver problems.
Major: When fluorouracil is taken together with thalidomide, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as hand and foot skin reactions. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking amisulpride together with hydroxychloroquine can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. This is because hydroxychloroquine can increase the levels of amisulpride in your body.
Major: Fluoxetine increases the levels of halofantrine in your body. This can lead to overdose and serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: When oxaprozin is taken together with ramucirumab, there is an increased risk of stomach bleeding. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking mefenamic acid while taking drotrecogin alfa can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because mefenamic acid may decrease the ability of drotrecogin alfa to work normally.
Major: Taking panobinostat together with pentamidine can cause major side effects. This is because pentamidine increases blood levels of panobinostat. It is not clear how this happens.
Major: When acebutolol is taken together with fingolimod, there is an increased risk of bradycardia (slow heart rate) and other cardiovascular events. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking olmesartan with potassium chloride can cause major side effects. Olmesartan can raise blood levels of potassium. This can cause serious heart problems.

Major: When balsalazide is given together with iohexol, there is an increased risk of side effects such as diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction is moderate in severity. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When erdafitinib is taken together with calcium phosphate, erdafitinib may not work as well as when it is used alone. This means that the treatment for your condition might be less effective.
Major: The pentostatin drug can cause severe allergic reactions when taken together with the varicella zoster vaccine.
Major: The combination of astemizole and aprepitant can cause serious abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is well known to occur because both drugs affect the electrical activity of the heart.

Major: When grepafloxacin and cabozantinib are taken together, they can increase the risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture. This is because these drugs may affect the way the body processes certain proteins.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking trastuzumab emtansine together with dalteparin can cause bleeding problems. The risk of bleeding is higher than when taking either drug alone.

Major: Vardenafil is used to treat erectile dysfunction. Amyl nitrite is used as a recreational drug. Taking vardenafil together with amyl nitrite can cause severe headaches, flushing, and breathing problems. This interaction is very dangerous.

Major: Taking phenobarbital with copanlisib can be dangerous. It may increase the side effects of copanlisib. The body processes (metabolizes) both drugs differently, so this interaction is likely to happen.

Major: When disopyramide is taken together with picosulfuric acid, there is a major drug interaction. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: Simvastatin can be taken together with leflunomide. However, there is an increased risk of side effects when these drugs are taken together. The most common side effect is muscle pain.
Major: When diatrizoate and streptozocin are taken together, they can cause severe side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is well known to occur.

Major: Efalizumab and natalizumab are both drugs used to treat autoimmune diseases such as multiple sclerosis. They are both monoclonal antibodies that work by binding to certain cells of the immune system. However, they bind to different cells. When given together, they can bind to each other instead of binding to their targets. This can make them less effective at treating the disease. It is important for patients taking these drugs to follow their doctor’s instructions carefully and report all medications they are taking.

Major: Taking chlorcyclizine with potassium citrate can cause serious problems. Chlorcyclizine may increase the level of potassium in your blood. This can be dangerous for people who have certain conditions such as kidney disease or heart failure.

Major: The combination of Abciximab and Trastuzumab emtansine can cause major drug interactions. Abciximab is a blood thinner used during heart attacks to prevent blood clots. Trastuzumab emtansine is an antibody used to treat breast cancer. This combination should be avoided because it may increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking vandetanib together with trazodone can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating. This is because trazodone may increase the levels of vandetanib in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these medications together.
Major: When benazepril is taken together with potassium iodide, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Teriflunomide decreases the activity of immune cells called lymphocytes. Mogamulizumab also decreases the activity of these same lymphocytes. When taken together, teriflunomide and mogamulizumab may decrease the activity of lymphocytes too much. This can increase the risk of infections.

Major: Valganciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat cytomegalovirus infection. Golimumab is an immunosuppressant used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, and axial spondyloarthritis. Taking valganciclovir together with golimumab can increase the risk of serious infections. This is because valganciclovir may decrease the body’s ability to fight off infections by weakening the immune system. Golimumab

Major: Thioridazine and macimorelin should not be taken together because they can cause serious changes in heart rate and rhythm. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs affect the electrical activity of the heart.
Major: When nadolol and indacaterol are taken together, they can cause a severe drop in heart rate. This may lead to serious problems such as dizziness, fainting, or even death.
Major: Simeprevir and apalutamide should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Diflunisal can increase the levels of edoxaban in your body by about two times. This may lead to bleeding and other side effects. Be sure to follow the prescribing information for taking edoxaban.
Major: When lomitapide and carfilzomib are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects such as low blood pressure.

Major: Disopyramide can increase the risk of cardiovascular death when taken together with siponimod. This is because disopyramide slows down the heart rate, while siponimod increases the heart rate. The combination of these effects may lead to an increased risk of cardiovascular death.
Major: When drotrecogin alfa is given together with cangrelor, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because drotrecogin alfa increases the effect of cangrelor.
Major: Grepafloxacin increases the levels of doxorubicin in your body by about 10%. This can increase the side effects of doxorubicin such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and myelosuppression.
Major: When epirubicin is given together with droperidol, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with mefloquine, it can increase the risk of side effects such as headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction has been observed in some patients taking these drugs together. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: When vilanterol is taken with macimorelin, there is an increased risk of side effects such as hypokalemia (low potassium levels) and hyperkalemia (high potassium levels). These changes can be severe.

Major: Topiramate can cause drowsiness when taken alone. However, taking topiramate together with doxepin increases this drowsiness to a major level. This means that you should be especially careful about possible drowsiness if you take these drugs together.

Major: When insulin degludec is used together with sparfloxacin, there is an increased risk of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar). This is because sparfloxacin can increase the effects of insulin degludec.

Major: Cyclosporine and venetoclax should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. Cyclosporine can also decrease how well venetoclax works. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens.
Major: Tacrolimus and bromfenac should not be used together because they can increase the risk of kidney injury. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Taking probucol together with ribociclib can cause major side effects. This is because probucol may increase the levels of ribociclib in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: Epoprostenol is used to treat pulmonary hypertension. It can be taken by mouth or injection under the skin. Tinzaparin is an anticoagulant used to prevent blood clots. It is given by injection under the skin. Taking tinzaparin together with epoprostenol may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because both drugs can lower platelet levels. Platelets are small blood cells that help blood clot. The interaction between these two drugs has been studied in vitro and in animals. However, there have been no

Major: The combination of iodine-131 (I-131) and methylene blue can cause severe side effects. I-131 is used to treat thyroid cancer. It works by releasing radioactive particles that destroy thyroid cells. Methylene blue is used as a dye for eye exams and to treat methemoglobinemia. Major: Taking ergotamine together with lorcaserin can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Mifepristone can increase the levels of salbutamol in your body by about 50%. This may lead to increased side effects such as tremors, headache, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness, sleep disturbances, and changes in heart rate.
Major: Taking hydrocodone together with boceprevir can cause major side effects. This is because boceprevir decreases the levels of hydrocodone in your body.

Major: Taking lisdexamfetamine and ivosidenib together can cause major side effects. Lisdexamfetamine increases the levels of ivosidenib in your body by about 10 times. This may increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Irinotecan (liposomal) is used to treat cancer. It works by stopping cancer cells from dividing. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. Irinotecan (liposomal) and siponimod should not be taken together because they can increase the risk of serious side effects.
Major: Taking pentostatin together with upadacitinib can cause major side effects. This is because pentostatin may increase the levels of upadacitinib in your body.

Major: Bupropion is used to treat depression and smoking cessation. It may cause seizures as a side effect. Eliglustat is used to treat Gaucher disease. Taking bupropion and eliglustat together can increase the risk of having a seizure.
Major: The pentostatin drug can increase the risk of serious side effects when given together with rotavirus vaccine. This interaction is major.

Major: The drugs pimozide and osilodrostat should not be used together because they have a major drug interaction. Pimozide increases the blood levels of osilodrostat by about 10 times. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: When perphenazine is given together with iopamidol, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body.
Major: Ocrelizumab and ozanimod should not be used together because they can cause serious problems such as low blood pressure. This problem has been observed in studies of these drugs in people.

Major: When dexfenfluramine is taken together with lithium carbonate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as serotonin syndrome. Serotonin syndrome is a potentially life-threatening condition that can cause changes in mental state, muscle control, heart rate, and temperature. This interaction should be avoided.
Major: Dabrafenib and zanubrutinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Amikacin can cause serious problems when used together with cisatracurium. This problem has been reported in patients who were treated with amikacin and cisatracurium at the same time. The exact reason for this problem is unknown but may be related to the way these drugs work inside the body. It is important to avoid taking amikacin and cisatracurium together unless your doctor tells you otherwise.
Major: Amphotericin B (lipid complex) can cause serious kidney problems when taken together with iothalamic acid. This problem has been reported in patients taking both drugs together.
Major: Alteplase is used to treat heart attack and stroke. Acalabrutinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking these drugs together may increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Morphine (liposomal) can increase oxazepam levels in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as drowsiness, sedation, impaired coordination, and difficulty concentrating. Be especially careful when driving, operating machinery, or performing hazardous activities.
Major: Taking bedaquiline together with encorafenib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Eptifibatide and deferasirox should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This interaction is major because eptifibatide is given to prevent bleeding after angioplasty. The interaction may happen because both drugs affect platelets, which are part of the clotting process.
Major: Adalimumab and leflunomide should not be used together because they can cause serious liver problems. This interaction is well known to occur.

Drug_A: Bacillus calmette-guerin substrain tice live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. It should be avoided because it can cause severe inflammation of the small intestine. The risk of this interaction is so high that the manufacturer of Ozanimod recommends avoiding it altogether while taking BCG.

Major: The combination of sulfamethizole and typhoid vaccine can cause severe reactions such as skin rashes, fever, and liver damage. This interaction is well known and has been reported in many patients.

Major: Rifapentine can increase the risk of bleeding when taken together with apixaban. This is because rifampicin decreases the amount of apixaban in your body. The FDA recommends that you should not take apixaban together with rifampicin.
Major: Taking deferiprone with vincristine can increase the side effects of vincristine on the nervous system. This is because deferiprone may increase the levels of vincristine in your body.

Major: Taking omacetaxine mepesuccinate together with mefenamic acid can cause major side effects. Omacetaxine mepesuccinate works by blocking a protein called c-kit, which is involved in blood cell production. Mefenamic acid also blocks this protein. This can lead to an increased risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking procarbazine together with infliximab can cause severe reactions such as skin rashes, fever, and swelling of the blood vessels. This interaction has been observed in patients taking these drugs together.
Major: When trimethoprim is taken together with potassium bicarbonate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Flutamide is used to treat prostate cancer. Cabozantinib is used to treat thyroid cancer. Taking flutamide together with cabozantinib can cause serious side effects such as bleeding and blood clotting problems. This interaction is very likely because flutamide can increase levels of an enzyme called CYP2C9 which can break down cabozantinib.
Major: Nelfinavir increases the levels of budesonide in your body. This can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, breathing, and blood pressure.
Major: Taking estradiol topical together with pomalidomide increases the risk of side effects. This is because estradiol topical can increase the level of pomalidomide in your body.

Major: The drug methadone should be used with caution when taken together with midostaurin because of major drug–drug interactions. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects or change how well the drugs work. It is best to avoid this combination unless your doctor has told you it is safe.

Major: When leucovorin is given together with ceftriaxone, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact reason for this interaction is that ceftriaxone reduces the amount of leucovorin in your body. As a result, leucovorin may not work properly to prevent side effects from other medicines.

Major: When streptokinase is given together with caplacizumab, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by the fact that caplacizumab blocks a protein called FVIII-A. Streptokinase can break down FVIII-A. Therefore, when the two drugs are used together, they can cancel each other out.

Major: Osimertinib is used to treat lung cancer. It works by blocking a protein called epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR). Talimogene laherparepvec is used to treat skin cancer. It works by introducing a virus into the tumour which causes the tumour cells to produce a protein that stimulates the immune system to attack the tumour. Using osimertinib together with talimogene laherparepvec may increase the risk of inflammation of the lungs (pneumonitis) because both drugs can cause this.
Major: When bendamustine is taken together with upadacitinib, there is an increased risk of serious skin reactions. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking insulin human (zinc) and enoxacin together can cause major side effects. Enoxacin increases the level of insulin in your body. This can lead to low blood sugar levels.

Major: Cisplatin is used to treat cancer. Ozanimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. Taking cisplatin and ozanimod together can cause serious side effects such as nausea and vomiting. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may be due to the way these drugs affect the nervous system.
Major: Artesunate is an antimalarial medication. Grazoprevir is a hepatitis C virus treatment. Taking artesunate with grazoprevir can cause serious side effects.

Major: Taking iron supplements together with dolutegravir can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is best to take iron supplements at least 4 hours before taking dolutegravir or after dolutegravir has been taken.

Major: Dasatinib should not be taken together with lefamulin because it can increase the risk of side effects. This is because dasatinib can slow down how quickly lefamulin is broken down by the body.
Major: Gemcitabine should not be used together with teriflunomide because gemcitabine can increase the risk of liver damage when combined with teriflunomide. This is a major drug interaction.
Major: St. John’s Wort can make Panobinostat work less effectively. This may be because St. John’s Wort decreases the amount of Panobinostat in the body.

Major: Thioridazine and panobinostat should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, blood pressure, and body temperature. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs affect the nervous system.
Major: Alteplase is used to treat heart attacks and strokes. Defibrotide is used to treat liver damage from heparin. Taking defibrotide together with alteplase can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking gabapentin together with morphine can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and difficulty concentrating. These effects may be due to the fact that both drugs affect the central nervous system.

Major: Gemcitabine is used to treat certain types of cancer. It works by interfering with DNA synthesis. Fingolimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by blocking certain cells from leaving lymph nodes into blood vessels. Taking fingolimod together with gemcitabine can increase the risk of serious effects on your immune system. This can include life-threatening infections. Therefore, do not take fingolimod together with gemcitabine unless your doctor tells you to.
Major: Taking clozapine together with potassium chloride can cause serious changes in heart rate. This interaction is well known to happen. It is not clear how this happens.

Major: When ibutilide is taken together with ketoconazole, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening.

Major: The combination of iopromide and lutetium Lu 177 dotatate should be avoided because there is a high risk of serious side effects. Iopromide can increase the levels of lutetium Lu 177 dotatate in the body, which may lead to an increased risk of radiation damage to organs such as the thyroid gland.

Major: When abiraterone is taken together with venetoclax, there is an increased risk of a serious type of heart rhythm problem called QT prolongation. This can cause dangerous side effects such as arrhythmia (irregular heartbeat) and torsades de pointes (a specific type of irregular heartbeat). It is important to note that this interaction has only been observed in studies done in animals and in people, but not in actual patients taking both drugs at the same time. Therefore, more research is needed to determine whether this interaction will occur in patients.

Major: Taking etanercept together with pazopanib can cause major side effects. Etanercept can increase the levels of pazopanib in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of bleeding, stomach pain, vomiting, diarrhea, and other serious side effects.

Major: Taking primidone together with morphine can be dangerous. Primidone may increase the effects of morphine, which could cause serious side effects such as breathing problems, drowsiness, or coma.
Major: When ritonavir is taken together with gilteritinib, it can increase the levels of gilteritinib in the blood by about 40%. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: When anistreplase is given together with tirofiban, there is a high risk of bleeding. This is because anistreplase can increase the effects of tirofiban, which prevents blood clots from forming.

Major: When ticlopidine is taken along with fondaparinux, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because fondaparinux increases the blood levels of ticlopidine. It is important to note that this interaction has been observed in studies done in animals and in people.
Major: Interferon gamma-1b and leflunomide should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction has been observed in patients taking these drugs together.
Major: Fingolimod can cause a drop in blood pressure when taken with macimorelin. This can be dangerous. Be prepared for this to happen.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. It means that when you take ixekizumab and varicella zoster vaccine at the same time, it can make the vaccine less effective. The vaccine may not fully protect you against chickenpox (varicella) infection.

Major: Fludarabine can increase the risk of side effects when used together with certolizumab pegol. This is because fludarabine may reduce the ability of the body to remove certolizumab pegol from the bloodstream.
Major: Taking norfloxacin together with halofantrine can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur because of how these drugs are metabolized in the body.

Major: When drotrecogin alfa is given together with dextran (a blood thinner), there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as allergic reactions. This interaction is well known and has been studied. It is thought to be due to the fact that dextran can cause the release of histamine from cells in the body, which can lead to allergic reactions. Therefore, when these two drugs are used together, they should be separated by at least 5 minutes.

Major: Tacrolimus and methoxyflurane should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are metabolized by the body.
Major: When pioglitazone is taken together with lumateperone, there is an increased risk of heart failure. This interaction is major.

Major: Levacetylmethadol (LAMA) is used to treat opioid withdrawal symptoms. Alvimopan (ALVIMO) is used to prevent small bowel resection surgery complications. Taking LAMA with ALVIMO may increase the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and flatulence.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of berotralstat in your body by about 50%. This may cause more side effects. Be alert for these side effects.
Major: When carbamazepine is taken together with gilteritinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Major: Cyclosporine is a drug used to prevent organ rejection after transplantation. It can be taken together with cobicistat, which is a drug used to treat HIV. However, taking these two drugs together may increase the side effects of cyclosporine.

Major: When cladribine is given together with niraparib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking pentamidine with ceritinib can cause major side effects. This interaction may be due to an increase in the levels of pentamidine in the body.
Major: When danazol is taken along with warfarin, the dose of warfarin should be reduced by half. This is because danazol can increase the effects of warfarin, which slows down blood clotting.
Major: When cobimetinib is taken along with fosaprepitant, there is an increased risk of vomiting. This interaction is major. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.

Major: When methadone is taken together with ceritinib, it can increase the levels of ceritinib in your body by about 40%. This may lead to increased side effects of ceritinib such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, myalgia, anorexia, and constipation.
Major: The combination of posaconazole and ozanimod can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking glasdegib together with ozanimod can cause major side effects. This is because glasdegib may increase the levels of ozanimod in your body. Talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.

Major: Cisapride and lenvatinib should not be used together because cisapride can increase the side effects of lenvatinib. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are broken down in the body.
Major: Taking terfenadine together with adenosine can cause serious side effects such as heart rhythm problems. This is because terfenadine slows down the way the body gets rid of adenosine.
Major: Taking insulin human (zinc) together with trovafloxacin can cause major side effects. This is because trovafloxacin can increase the level of insulin in your blood.

Major: Taking diethylstilestrol together with paritaprevir can cause major drug interactions. This means that taking these drugs together can change their effects on your body. It can make them less effective or even toxic.
Major: Interferon beta-1b can increase the risk of kidney damage when used together with iodinated contrast media (e.g., iopamidol) used for imaging tests.

This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, droperidol may increase the risk of QT prolongation when given with bicalutamide. QT prolongation refers to changes in the electrical activity of the heart that can lead to potentially dangerous abnormal heart rhythms. It is important for clinicians to be aware of this potential drug interaction and take appropriate measures to monitor patients’ heart rate

Major: When diflunisal is taken together with rivaroxaban, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because diflunisal can increase the effects of rivaroxaban, which slows down blood clotting. It is important to follow the prescribing information for both drugs when taking them together.
Major: Fluvoxamine is an antidepressant. Sibutramine is used to treat obesity. Taking these drugs together can cause serious harm.

Major: When aldesleukin and upadacitinib are taken together, there may be a very high chance of getting a severe reaction called cytokine release syndrome. This can cause fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, muscle pain, and weakness. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether these drugs should be used together.

Major: The combination of iopamidol and lutetium Lu 177 dotatate should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects.

Major: When alteplase is used together with dicoumarol, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. Alteplase is a blood thinner that is used to treat heart attacks and strokes. Dicoumarol is also a blood thinner but it is no longer used clinically because it has many side effects. The problem is that when these two blood thinners are used together, they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because both of them already have an effect on blood clotting. Using

Major: Alteplase is used to treat heart attack and stroke. Dasatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking dasatinib while taking alteplase can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because dasatinib may increase the effects of alteplase.

Major: Irinotecan can increase the risk of side effects from certolizumab pegol. This combination should be avoided unless the benefits outweigh the risks. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: The combination of ezogabine and cabozantinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Drug_B: Mumps virus strain B level jeryl lynn live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: The mumps vaccine contains a live virus. This can interact with an antibody called daratumumab. This interaction may make the vaccine less effective.

Major: The combination of nelarabine and golimumab can cause major drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in ways that could be harmful. In particular, golimumab may increase the levels of nelarabine in your body. This can increase the risk of side effects such as seizures. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should use these medications together.
Major: When clopidogrel is taken together with fluconazole, it may be less effective at preventing blood clots. This is because fluconazole can increase the breakdown of clopidogrel.
Major: When erdafitinib is taken together with calcium phosphate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects on the heart. This interaction is major.
Major: Erythromycin can cause serious problems when taken together with astemizole. This problem has been reported in many patients. It is best to avoid taking these two drugs together.
Major: The combination of abarelix and disopyramide can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this interaction works.

Major: Buspirone should not be used together with doxepin because it can cause serious side effects such as seizures. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are broken down in the body.

Major: Enzalutamide and osimertinib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because enzalutamide can increase the effects of osimertinib, which also increases the risk of bleeding.
Major: Fondaparinux should not be used together with temsirolimus because they can interact in a way that may cause serious side effects. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Major: When quinapril is taken with potassium citrate, there is a major drug–drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. Quinapril lowers blood pressure, while potassium citrate raises blood potassium levels. The combination of these two drugs can lead to dangerously low blood pressure and blood potassium levels.

Major: Taking papaverine together with pentamidine can cause severe side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are used for treating parasite infections of the skin. Papaverine is also used as a pain reliever. The interaction may be caused by an increase in the level of papaverine in the bloodstream.
Major: The combination of iobenguane (I-131) and ozanimod can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the drugs may have an effect on each other that could be harmful.

Major: Leflunomide is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It can be harmful when taken together with dupilumab, which is used to treat eczema. This is because leflunomide may increase levels of liver enzymes in your blood. Taking both drugs together may increase this effect.
Major: Taking vorapaxar together with ceritinib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided.
Major: The combination of cobicistat and encorafenib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless the benefits outweigh the risks.

Major: This is a major drug interaction between hydroxychloroquine and lefamulin. It means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be due to changes in how well the drugs are absorbed into the body.
Major: Taking indomethacin together with temsirolimus can cause major side effects. This is because indomethacin increases the level of temsirolimus in your body.

Major: Taking morphine together with procarbazine can be dangerous. This combination can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, chills, weakness, dizziness, headache, confusion, seizures, coma, and even death. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear but may involve the immune system.

Major: When cladribine and leflunomide are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells to fight infection. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: The combination of carmustine and measles virus vaccine live attenuated should be avoided because there is a high risk for serious side effects.

Major: Nilotinib can increase the levels of edoxaban in your body. This may cause bleeding. Tell your doctor or pharmacist about all the medicines you take. They might change the dose of one or both medicines to avoid side effects.
Major: When phenytoin is taken together with sunitinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When taking conjugated estrogens together with pomalidomide, there is an increased risk of blood clots. This is because conjugated estrogens can increase the levels of clotting factors in the blood. Clotting factors are proteins that help the blood to clot. Pomalidomide can also increase the risk of blood clots by itself. Therefore, when these two drugs are taken together, the risk of blood clots increases even more.

Major: Gemzar (Gemtuzumab) is used to treat acute myeloid leukemia. Cimzia (Certolizumab) is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Taking these drugs together may cause serious side effects such as low blood counts, infections, and liver problems.

Major: Taking dexfenfluramine with frovatriptan can cause major side effects. Dexfenfluramine may increase the amount of frovatriptan in your body by about 10 times. This can lead to serious side effects such as liver problems, seizures, heart attack, and stroke.
Major: When mipomersen and eltrombopag are given together, they can have a severe effect on your body. This is because mipomersen can increase the level of eltrombopag in your blood.

Major: When oxymorphone and naltrexone are taken together, they can interact in a way that may cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, dizziness, drowsiness, confusion, and seizures. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether these drugs should be used together.
Major: Taking cocaine while taking droxidopa can cause severe changes in blood pressure. This may result in serious harm to the patient.
Major: When dipyridamole is taken together with panobinostat, it can increase the side effects of panobinostat. This interaction is major.

Major: The combination of lumefantrine and triptorelin can cause serious side effects. This interaction may be due to changes in how these drugs are metabolized by the liver. It is important to avoid this combination unless your doctor has advised you to use them together.

Major: Using doxepin together with lumefantrine can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before you take these drugs together.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of sonidegib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as muscle pain, weakness, and rash.

Major: The immune system helps protect against viruses and other pathogens. Some vaccines work by exposing the immune system to a weakened form of a virus or bacteria so that the body can fight it off. However, when given together, varicella zoster vaccine and belimumab may weaken the immune system’s response to infection. This interaction has been observed in some patients who were given both drugs together.
Major: If you take infliximab and ifosfamide together, there is a high chance of serious side effects. This is because infliximab can affect how well your body processes ifosfamide.
Major: Taking dacarbazine together with upadacitinib can be dangerous. It may increase the risk of serious side effects such as liver problems.

Major: If you take nalidixic acid and ifosfamide together, there is a high chance of developing severe diarrhea. This interaction is very likely to occur because these drugs are both eliminated from the body through the same pathway.

Major: Heparin is an anticoagulant used to treat blood clots. Inotersen is a drug used to treat amyloidosis. Taking heparin with inotersen can cause bleeding. This is because heparin increases the risk of bleeding when taken with other drugs.

Major: Teriflunomide decreases the activity of immune cells called lymphocytes. Onasemnogene abeparvovec is a gene therapy that replaces a defective gene in lymphocytes. The combination of these drugs may decrease the effectiveness of onasemnogene abeparvovec.
Major: The plicamycin drug can cause severe liver problems when taken with the yellow fever vaccine.

Major: Taking abatacept together with rotavirus vaccine may cause serious problems. This interaction has been found to be severe. It is important to talk to your doctor before taking these drugs together.
Major: Taking temsirolimus together with iothalamic acid can cause serious side effects.
Major: When zonisamide is taken together with promethazine, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because zonisamide increases the effects of promethazine.
Major: When methdilazine is taken together with zonisamide, there is an increased risk of side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and headache. This interaction is major.

Major: Mifepristone is used to end pregnancies. It works by blocking progesterone from working. Apalutamide is used to treat prostate cancer. It works by blocking testosterone from entering cells. When these drugs are taken together, they can block each other from working properly. This can make mifepristone less likely to end a pregnancy and apalutamide less likely to work against prostate cancer.

Major: Oliceridine can increase levels of Osimertinib in your body by about 10%. This may cause more side effects. Take Osimertinib as directed. If you have questions, talk to your doctor or pharmacist.
Major: When ramucirumab is taken together with ticagrelor, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because ramucirumab can increase the effects of ticagrelor.

Major: Taking nortriptyline together with arsenic trioxide can cause serious side effects. Nortriptyline increases the levels of arsenic trioxide in your body. This may increase your risk for certain types of cancer.
Major: Dofetilide and granisetron should not be used together because they can cause serious heart rhythm problems. This problem has been seen in studies and also in patients.

Major: When dabrafenib and selumetinib are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as skin reactions, rash, fever, and inflammation of blood vessels. These drugs should be avoided taking together.
Major: Etanercept can increase the risk of infection when combined with mycophenolate mofetil. This is because etanercept may decrease the activity of white blood cells that fight infection.

Major: Dofetilide is used to treat an irregular heartbeat called arrhythmia. It works by blocking certain electrical signals in your heart. Apalutamide is used to treat prostate cancer. It works by blocking a protein in tumour cells that helps them grow. Taking dofetilide and apalutamide together may increase your risk of side effects such as an irregular heartbeat. This is because dofetilide can block some of the electrical signals that apalutamide uses to work.
Major: Cidofovir should not be used together with kanamycin because cidofovir can increase the levels of kanamycin in your body. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: Iloperidone is an antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia. It should not be taken together with pentamidine because this can cause serious side effects such as heart problems. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are metabolized by the liver.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking hydroxychloroquine together with entrectinib can cause serious side effects such as heart rhythm problems.

Major: Taking amoxapine together with cabozantinib can cause serious side effects. This is because amoxapine increases the levels of cabozantinib in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you to do so.
Major: Amyl nitrite and riociguat should not be used together because they can cause dangerous drops in blood pressure. This interaction is major.
Major: When miconazole is taken together with pexidartinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: The varicella zoster vaccine (VZV) is used to prevent chickenpox infection. It is also used to prevent shingles, which is caused by the same virus as chickenpox. Etoposide is a chemotherapy drug used to treat cancer. Taking etoposide while being vaccinated for chickenpox can increase the risk of severe side effects from the vaccine. This interaction is major.

Major: When methadone is taken together with ceritinib, it can increase the levels of ceritinib in your body by about 40%. This may lead to increased side effects of ceritinib such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, myalgia, anorexia, and constipation.

Major: The uracil mustard drug can cause severe reactions when given together with live vaccines such as the typhoid vaccine. This is because the uracil mustard drug can weaken the immune system’s ability to fight off the infection from the live vaccine.

Major: When trastuzumab and certolizumab pegol are given together, there is a very high chance of side effects. This is because trastuzumab can make certolizumab pegol less effective at reducing inflammation.

Major: When bumetanide is used together with neomycin, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When dicoumarol is taken together with diclofenac, it can cause major bleeding. This is because diclofenac increases the effects of dicoumarol.

Major: When urokinase is given together with regorafenib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Major: The drug haloperidol can cause drowsiness when taken by itself. However, taking haloperidol together with the drug lumacaftor may increase this drowsiness to a major level. Therefore, caution should be exercised when taking these two drugs together.

Major: Taking methotrimeprazine together with osimertinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction may be due to the fact that methotrimeprazine increases the levels of osimertinib in your body.
Major: When doxorubicin is taken together with sparfloxacin, there is an increased risk of heart failure. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking hydroxychloroquine together with gilteritinib can cause serious problems in your heart rhythm. This problem may be more likely to happen when you first start taking these drugs together or when you increase the dose of one of the drugs.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking etidronic acid together with iohexol can cause kidney damage. The mechanism of this interaction is that both drugs are excreted by the kidneys and may compete for elimination from the body.
Major: Taking midostaurin together with grazoprevir can cause major side effects. This is because midostaurin may increase levels of grazoprevir in your body. This can lead to serious liver problems.
Major: Ulipristal can increase levels of venetoclax in your body. This may lead to increased side effects. Be alert for signs of liver problems, blood clots, bleeding, or other serious side effects.
Major: Taking mefenamic acid and deferasirox together can cause major side effects. This is because deferasirox increases the level of mefenamic acid in your body.

Major: Idelalisib and selumetinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Idelalisib decreases the levels of blood cells called platelets. Selumetinib increases the levels of these same platelets. When used together, idelalisib can decrease platelet levels too much, which can lead to bleeding. This interaction has been observed in patients taking both drugs together.

Major: Taking oxaliplatin together with dolasetron can cause severe diarrhea. This interaction is well known to occur. It is likely that this happens because oxaliplatin increases the levels of dolasetron in your body.

Major: Taking teriflunomide together with calaspargase pegol can cause major drug interactions. This means that taking these drugs together may lead to serious side effects. Calaspargase pegol is used to treat acute lymphoblastic leukemia. It works by killing certain white blood cells called lymphoblasts. Teriflunomide is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It slows down the activity of immune cells that attack nerve cells in multiple sclerosis patients. When taken together, calaspargase peg
Major: When sotalol and granisetron are taken together, they can cause serious changes in the heart’s electrical activity. This can increase the risk of dangerous abnormal heart rhythms.

Major: Taking ethchlorvynol together with codeine can be dangerous. It may cause severe drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, hallucinations, seizures, and breathing problems. The combination should be avoided.

Drug_A: Mumps virus strain B level jeryl lynn live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. The combination of mumps vaccine and deflazacort can cause serious side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless there are special circumstances where the benefits outweigh the risks.
Major: The combination of apixaban and tucatinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects.

Major: Taking lomustine together with baricitinib can be dangerous. It may increase the risk of side effects such as liver problems, skin cancer, and blood clots. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear.
Major: Taking pazopanib while getting a live typhoid vaccine can cause serious side effects because pazopanib decreases the body’s ability to fight off the typhoid vaccine.

Major: Taking tacrolimus together with bedaquiline can cause major side effects. This is because tacrolimus slows down how quickly bedaquiline is broken down by the body. This can lead to too much bedaquiline building up in your body.

Major: When sirolimus is taken together with iodipamide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body absorbs or breaks down one or both drugs. It is important to talk to your doctor or pharmacist before taking sirolimus with iodipamide.

Major: Rifapentine can increase levels of fedratinib in your body by about two times. This may cause fedratinib to have stronger side effects. Be alert for signs of bleeding, blood in stools, or unusual bruising. If you experience these symptoms, contact your healthcare provider right away.

Major: Idelalisib and lorlatinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Idelalisib may increase levels of lorlatinib in your body, which could lead to overdose. This interaction has been identified in studies.

Major: When taking both fluticasone and lonafarnib together, there is a high risk of liver problems. This is because lonafarnib can increase levels of an enzyme that breaks down fluticasone into its active form. The active form of fluticasone may then damage the liver.
Major: Taking metoclopramide together with tramadol can cause severe drowsiness. This may increase the risk of falling asleep while driving.
Major: Escitalopram can cause major problems when combined with iohexol. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When rifabutin is taken together with crizotinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, crizotinib may not work as well to treat your condition.

Major: The combination of netilmicin and ioversol can cause severe allergic reactions. This interaction is well known to occur. It is important to be aware of this interaction when prescribing these drugs together.
Major: Desipramine can increase the effects of iodine-131 (I-131), which is used to treat thyroid cancer. This may cause side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and headache.
Major: When bivalirudin is given together with heparin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because bivalirudin and heparin can interact to increase the effects of both drugs.

Major: Taking etanercept together with trastuzumab can cause major side effects. This is because etanercept can increase the level of trastuzumab in your body. The exact mechanism is unknown but may be due to an increase in the amount of trastuzumab in your bloodstream.
Major: Aprepitant and ivosidenib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Taking ibuprofen at the same time as ramucirumab can cause major side effects. This is because ibuprofen may increase the amount of ramucirumab in your body.
Major: The radioactive drug samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause serious problems when taken together with ixazomib. This problem has been found in studies of patients taking these drugs together.
Major: When atorvastatin is taken together with teriflunomide, there is an increased risk of muscle problems. This interaction is major. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.
Major: When ioversol is given together with lithium carbonate, there is an increased risk of side effects such as seizures, tremors, and coma. This interaction is major.

Major: Efalizumab and natalizumab are both drugs used to treat autoimmune diseases such as multiple sclerosis. They are both monoclonal antibodies that work by binding to certain cells of the immune system. However, they bind to different cells. When given together, they can bind to each other instead of binding to their targets. This can make them less effective at treating the disease. It is important for patients taking these drugs to follow their doctor’s instructions carefully and report all medications they are taking.

Major: The combination of warfarin and sulfadoxine can cause major drug interactions. Warfarin is a blood thinner used to treat blood clots. Sulfadoxine is an antibiotic used to treat malaria. When these drugs are taken together, they may increase the risk of bleeding. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times.

Major: Osilodrostat and ozanimod should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Osilodrostat decreases blood pressure and ozanimod increases it. When these drugs are used together, they may have opposite effects on blood pressure, which could be dangerous.
Major: When cytarabine is taken together with fingolimod, there is an increased risk of serious problems with your immune system. This can be severe and life threatening.
Major: St. John’s Wort can make temsirolimus work less effectively. This may reduce the effectiveness of temsirolimus.

Major: The immune system helps protect against infection. Belimumab is used to treat autoimmune disease. It works by affecting the immune system. Rubella is a viral infection that can cause mild flu-like symptoms. The rubella vaccine is safe and effective for most people. However, if you take belimumab at the same time as this vaccine, your body may have too much activity from both drugs. This can increase your risk of side effects.
Major: Cobicistat can increase pemigatinib levels in your body by about 40%. This may cause more side effects. Be alert for signs of bleeding, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and rash.
Major: When dexfenfluramine is taken with rasagiline, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as hypotension (low blood pressure) and syncope (fainting). This interaction is major.
Major: Taking interferon alfa-2b together with eltrombopag can cause major side effects. This is because interferon alfa-2b may increase the level of eltrombopag in your body.
Major: When taken together, clarithromycin and ripretinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Edoxaban is an anticoagulant. Piroxicam is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation. Taking piroxicam with edoxaban increases the risk of bleeding. This is because piroxicam can increase the effects of edoxaban.

Major: Taking diatrizoate together with etodolac can cause major side effects. Diatrizoate can increase the levels of etodolac in your body by about 10 times. This can lead to bleeding, stomach pain, ulcers, and other serious side effects.

Major: The drugs bosutinib and macimorelin should not be taken together because they can increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach pain. This interaction may also decrease how well these drugs work. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens.
Major: Romidepsin should not be used together with lumefantrine because it can increase the risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Cisatracurium should not be used together with neomycin because cisatracurium can block the effects of neomycin. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking trifluoperazine together with potassium citrate can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This is because trifluoperazine slows down the heart rate and potassium citrate increases the heart rate. The combination of these two drugs can lead to dangerously low blood pressure.
Major: When methotrexate is taken together with mezlocillin, there is an increased risk of liver damage. This interaction is major.
Major: When tirofiban and vorapaxar are taken together, they can increase each other’s effects on blood clotting. This may cause bleeding problems.

Major: When cladribine and pralatrexate are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells to fight infection.

Major: Dasatinib and acalabrutinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is because dasatinib and acalabrutinib both affect the same protein in the body. The FDA recommends avoiding this combination.
Major: Enzalutamide can increase levels of elvitegravir in your body. This may cause serious side effects. Be sure to talk to your doctor about taking enzalutamide together with elvitegravir.
Major: Taking infliximab together with thalidomide can cause serious side effects. This is because thalidomide decreases the amount of infliximab in your body.
Major: When diatrizoate and tolmetin are taken together, they can increase the risk of kidney damage. This is because diatrizoate can make it harder for your body to get rid of tolmetin.

Major: The combination of uracil mustard and golimumab can cause severe skin reactions. This is because uracil mustard can increase the activity of golimumab. It is important to be aware of this potential interaction when taking these medications together.

Major: Taking iron supplements together with dolutegravir can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is best to take iron supplements at least 4 hours before taking dolutegravir or after dolutegravir has been taken.
Major: Apalutamide can increase benzhydrocodone levels in your body. This may cause benzhydrocodone to have stronger effects on you. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Etanercept can increase the risk of infection when combined with lutetium Lu 177 dotatate. This is because etanercept may reduce the activity of the immune system, which helps fight infection.
Major: When primaquine is used together with certolizumab pegol, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Amphotericin B can cause serious kidney damage when taken together with iothalamic acid. This combination should be avoided unless specifically recommended by a doctor.
Major: Taking phenylbutazone together with vorapaxar can cause major side effects. This is because phenylbutazone may increase the risk of bleeding caused by vorapaxar.

Major: When cladribine and thiotepa are given together, they can have a severe effect on your body. This interaction may cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, chills, and weakness. It is best to avoid this combination of drugs unless your doctor has specifically told you to use them together.
Major: Iloprost is used to treat blood clots. Apixaban is an anticoagulant. Taking iloprost together with apixaban can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: When buspirone is taken together with dexfenfluramine, there is an increased risk of serotonin syndrome. This is a rare but potentially serious condition where the body has too much of the chemical serotonin. It can cause symptoms such as restlessness, confusion, muscle spasms, and even death.

Major: Taking indinavir together with methylprednisolone can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, increased risk of bleeding, and changes in blood sugar levels. This interaction may be due to indinavir inhibiting the enzyme that breaks down methylprednisolone into its active form. It is important to talk to your doctor or pharmacist before taking these medications together.

Major: Clomipramine and lorcaserin should not be used together because clomipramine increases the levels of lorcaserin in your body. This can increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, headache, dizziness, diarrhea, and constipation.
Major: Taking halofantrine together with fedratinib can be dangerous. This combination may cause serious heart problems.
Major: When darunavir is taken together with teriflunomide, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Major: Taking darunavir together with everolimus can cause major side effects. This is because darunavir can increase the level of everolimus in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects from everolimus.

Major: When cladribine and mycophenolate mofetil are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells, including white blood cells that fight infection.
Major: The combination of gallium nitrate and ioversol can cause severe allergic reactions.
Major: Taking golimumab together with a live typhoid vaccine increases the risk of serious infection. This is because golimumab weakens your body’s ability to fight off infections.

Major: When furosemide and kanamycin are taken together, they can increase the risk of hearing loss. This is because furosemide can cause an increase in the levels of kanamycin in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.

Major: The drugs pasireotide and oliceridine have major drug interactions. This means that taking these two drugs together can cause serious side effects. In this case, taking pasireotide and oliceridine together may cause severe constipation.
Major: Dorzolamide eye drops should not be used together with salicylic acid sodium because they can cause severe eye irritation and inflammation.

Major: When cyclophosphamide is taken together with certolizumab pegol, there is an increased risk of severe infection. This is because cyclophosphamide can weaken the immune system and certolizumab pegol can increase the risk of infection.
Major: When fingolimod is taken together with alimemazine, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the drugs may not work properly together and could cause serious side effects.
Major: This is a major drug interaction between hydrocortisone and bempedoic acid. It can cause serious side effects such as increased risk of infection.

Major: Cisapride and ivosidenib should not be used together because cisapride can increase the side effects of ivosidenib. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are broken down in the body.
