Major: The combination of apomorphine and papaverine should be avoided because they can cause severe hypotension (low blood pressure) when used together. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: When ivabradine is taken together with cabozantinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as bradycardia (slow heart rate) and hypotension (low blood pressure). These effects may be due to ivabradine’s inhibition of the hERG channel, which can increase the risk of QT prolongation (a condition where the heart takes longer than normal to beat). It is important for patients and healthcare providers to monitor these side effects when taking these medications together.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking sulfinpyrazone together with tositumomab (I-131) can cause serious side effects. Sulfinpyrazone may increase the risk of thyroid damage by increasing the amount of tositumomab (I-131) in your body.
Major: When temsirolimus is given together with desirudin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because temsirolimus can increase the effects of desirudin.

Major: When trimipramine is taken together with dexfenfluramine, there is an increased risk of serotonin toxicity. Serotonin is a chemical that helps regulate mood, appetite, sleep, and other functions. The combination of these drugs can lead to serotonin toxicity, which may cause serious side effects such as confusion, hallucinations, seizures, coma, and even death. Therefore, this drug combination should be avoided.

Major: Etanercept is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It works by blocking tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-α), which causes inflammation. Teriflunomide is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by slowing down the production of new white blood cells that cause inflammation. When these drugs are taken together, they can increase the risk of serious infection because both drugs affect the immune system. This is a major drug interaction.

Major: Atazanavir is used to treat HIV infection. Bosutinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking bosutinib together with atazanavir can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking diethylpropion together with topical cocaine can cause serious side effects. Diethylpropion is a stimulant drug used to treat obesity. Topical cocaine is a local anesthetic used as a pain reliever. Both drugs increase blood pressure and heart rate. When taken together, they may cause dangerously high blood pressure and heart rate.

Major: Taking methotrexate together with ozanimod can cause serious side effects. This is because methotrexate may increase the levels of ozanimod in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of certain side effects of ozanimod such as lymphopenia (low number of white blood cells), herpes zoster (shingles) and cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection. It is important to talk to your healthcare provider about whether you should take these medications together.
Major: Efavirenz can increase the risk of liver problems when used together with inotuzumab. This combination should be avoided unless the benefits outweigh the risks.
Major: Taking ephedrine and iopamidol together can cause severe high blood pressure. This may be due to the fact that both drugs increase blood pressure.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. It means that taking deflazacort while receiving measles vaccine can make the vaccine less effective. The reason for this is that deflazacort may weaken the body’s immune system.
Major: Mechlorethamine and samarium lexidronam should not be used together because they can cause severe reactions.

Major: When carmustine is given together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor has specifically told you to use them together.

Major: Taking aminolevulinic acid together with omadacycline can cause major side effects. Aminolevulinic acid may increase the levels of omadacycline in your body by about 50%. This can lead to serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and inflammation of the pancreas.

Major: Taking phenylbutazone together with tacrolimus can cause major side effects. This is because phenylbutazone may increase levels of tacrolimus in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects from tacrolimus.
Major: When doxorubicin is taken together with halofantrine, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking golimumab and olaparib together can cause major side effects. This is because golimumab may increase how much olaparib is taken up by cells. This increases the chance of side effects from olaparib.

Major: When thiotepa and lurbinectedin are given together, they can have a severe effect on your body. This is because thiotepa can increase the level of lurbinectedin in your blood. It is best to avoid taking these drugs at the same time.

Major: Taking droperidol together with lapatinib can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because droperidol slows down the heart rate and lapatinib increases the risk of this happening.
Major: The combination of astemizole and papaverine should be avoided because it can cause serious heart rhythm problems. This interaction has been observed in patients taking both drugs together.

Major: Taking vandetanib with amisulpride can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion. This is because vandetanib increases the levels of amisulpride in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these medications together.
Major: Taking prednisone together with bempedoic acid can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase your risk of developing muscle weakness.
Major: When taking gatifloxacin together with exenatide, there is an increased risk of serious heart rhythm problems. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking methylergometrine together with phenylephrine eye drops can cause dangerously high blood pressure.

Major: Thalidomide can increase the risk of serious side effects when given together with rotavirus vaccine. This interaction is major. It is recommended to give thalidomide at least 3 days before and 4 weeks after rotavirus vaccination.

Major: Telithromycin is an antibiotic used to treat respiratory tract infections. Ceritinib is a cancer medicine used to treat certain types of lung cancer. Taking telithromycin together with ceritinib can cause serious changes in heart rate and may lead to death. This interaction is very likely to occur because telithromycin slows down the metabolism of ceritinib by interfering with the activity of an enzyme called CYP3A. Patients should avoid taking these two drugs together.

Major: Diflunisal is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain, fever, and inflammation. Acalabrutinib is a drug used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking diflunisal together with acalabrutinib can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because both drugs can affect platelets, which are blood cells that help stop bleeding. Therefore, taking these two drugs together should be avoided.
Major: Taking tranylcypromine together with bupropion can cause severe drowsiness, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating. This is because tranylcypromine increases levels of bupropion in the body.

Major: When deferoxamine is given together with inotersen, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs. It is important to tell patients about this potential interaction and what to do about it.
Major: When methadone is taken together with dexamethasone, there is an increased risk of breathing problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When deferiprone is used with tagraxofusp, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Eptifibatide and enoxaparin should not be used together because they can increase bleeding risk. This interaction is well known and has been studied in many patients.
Major: Taking primidone together with lorlatinib can cause major side effects. Primidone may increase levels of lorlatinib in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as liver problems.
Major: When fenoprofen and leflunomide are taken together, they can interact in an undesirable way. This interaction is major. It can cause problems such as liver damage.

Major: Taking lorazepam together with hydrocodone can be dangerous. It may cause drowsiness, dizziness, and impaired coordination. The risk of these side effects is higher when taking both drugs together than when taking either drug alone.

Major: Eplerenone is used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. It works by blocking a hormone receptor called mineralocorticoid receptor. Ceritinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It works by blocking an enzyme called anaplastic lymphoma kinase. Taking eplerenone together with ceritinib can increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart. This is because both drugs work on the same type of receptors in the heart. Therefore, taking these two drugs together should be avoided.
Major: When fenoprofen is taken together with iothalamic acid, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.
Major: When anagrelide is taken together with procainamide, there is a high risk of bleeding. This is because anagrelide lowers platelet levels and procainamide increases bleeding.

Major: Cyclosporine is a drug used to prevent organ rejection after transplantation. It works by suppressing the immune system. Rifampicin is an antibiotic used to treat tuberculosis. When these two drugs are taken together, rifampicin reduces the blood levels of cyclosporine. This can increase the risk of organ rejection. Therefore, cyclosporine should be avoided when taking rifampicin.

Major: Taking dofetilide together with picosulfuric acid can cause major side effects. Dofetilide works by blocking certain electrical signals in the heart. Picosulfuric acid can increase the amount of dofetilide in your body. This can lead to serious changes in your heart rate and rhythm.

Major: Rifampicin can reduce the effectiveness of fedratinib by more than half. Fedratinib can also reduce the effectiveness of rifampicin by about one-third. This interaction is major because it can decrease the effectiveness of both drugs.
Major: Taking etanercept together with atezolizumab can cause major side effects. Etanercept can make atezolizumab less effective.
Major: When methotrexate is taken together with human immunoglobulin G, there is an increased risk of liver damage. This interaction is major.
Major: Polymyxins can cause kidney damage. Doxapram can also cause kidney damage. Taking polymyxin and doxapram together may increase the risk of kidney damage.

Major: When dactinomycin and leflunomide are taken together, they can cause severe side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells, including red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets. These cells help fight infection, fight infection, and help your blood to clot, respectively. It is important to take these drugs only as directed by your doctor.

Major: Cisapride and risperidone should not be used together because cisapride can increase the levels of risperidone in your body. This combination may cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, seizures, and QT prolongation.

Major: Taking moxifloxacin together with dolasetron can cause serious side effects such as prolonged QT interval. This is because moxifloxacin slows down the heart rate and dolasetron blocks the potassium channels in the heart. It is important to follow the prescribing information of both drugs when taking them together.

Major: The drug midostaurin should not be taken together with cobicistat because this combination can cause severe side effects. This interaction may occur because midostaurin is broken down by an enzyme in the body, but cobicistat slows down this process.
Major: Taking pazopanib together with dolasetron can cause severe side effects such as vomiting. This may be due to the fact that pazopanib increases the levels of dolasetron in your body.
Major: Taking ondansetron together with tryptophan can cause severe drowsiness. This may be due to how these drugs affect the brain. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When ketoconazole is taken together with lovastatin, it can increase the levels of lovastatin in your body by about 10 times. This increases the risk of muscle problems and liver damage.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause a severe reaction when given together with dexamethasone. This reaction may be serious or life threatening.

Major: Taking paroxetine together with panobinostat can cause serious side effects. This is because paroxetine may increase levels of panobinostat in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.

Major: Letrozole is used to treat breast cancer. It works by blocking a hormone called estrogen. Thalidomide is used to treat multiple myeloma, a type of blood cancer. It works by reducing the amount of tumor cells in the body. When these drugs are taken together, they can increase the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and dizziness. This interaction is very likely to occur because letrozole is broken down in the liver by an enzyme called CYP3A4, which th

Major: The combination of carmustine and ozanimod can cause major drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in a way that could be harmful. Carboplatin and oxaliplatin are similar drugs to carmustine that also have major drug interactions when given with ozanimod.

Major: When taking both procainamide and crizotinib together, there is a high risk of serious side effects such as severe skin rashes, liver damage, and heart problems. This interaction is very likely to occur because crizotinib can increase the levels of procainamide in your body.
Major: When cladribine and tafasitamab are taken together, they can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: The combination of obinutuzumab and live typhoid vaccine should be avoided because there is a high risk of severe side effects. This is because obinutuzumab can reduce the body’s ability to fight off infections.

Major: Taking salsalate together with tacrolimus can cause major drug interactions. Salsalate can increase the level of tacrolimus in your body by about 10 times. This can lead to side effects such as kidney damage, high blood pressure, and increased risk of infection.
Major: When taking histrelin together with sparfloxacin, there is an increased risk of side effects such as seizures, muscle cramps, and heartbeat changes. This interaction is major.
Major: When ivacaftor is taken together with crizotinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When cinacalcet is taken together with tetrabenazine, there is an increased risk of side effects such as dizziness, lightheadedness, and falls. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking temsirolimus together with baricitinib can cause major side effects. Temsirolimus works by blocking certain proteins from working properly. Baricitinib also blocks these same proteins from working properly. When used together, they may block these proteins too much, which could be harmful.

Major: Levacetylmethadol (LAMA) is used to treat chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Osimertinib is used to treat certain types of lung cancer. Taking these drugs together may cause severe breathing problems.

Major: Imatinib should be avoided when taking thioridazine because of major drug interactions. This means that imatinib and thioridazine can affect each other in ways that could cause serious side effects.

Major: Taking hydroxyurea while getting a live typhoid vaccine can cause severe (life-threatening) reactions in your body. This is because hydroxyurea weakens your immune system. The typhoid vaccine works by giving you a small amount of the typhoid virus to help your body fight off the infection. If your immune system is weakened, this can react badly with the vaccine and cause serious problems.

Major: Flibanserin and betrixaban should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because flibanserin may increase the effects of betrixaban, which slows down blood clotting.

Major: Idelalisib and ripretinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Idelalisib may increase the levels of ripretinib in your body, which can lead to an increased risk of bleeding. Ripretinib may also increase the levels of idelalisib in your body, which can lead to an increased risk of infection. It is not clear how these interactions happen.

Drug_B: Mumps virus strain B level jeryl lynn live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: Topotecan is an anti-cancer medication used to treat ovarian cancer. It works by stopping cells from dividing and reproducing. The mumps vaccine is a live virus vaccine used to prevent infection of mumps. This vaccine is safe and effective. However, if someone receives this vaccine while taking topotecan, there is a chance of a severe reaction. This reaction can be life threatening. Therefore, it is recommended that people avoid receiving the mumps vaccine while taking topotecan.

Major: Fondaparinux should not be used together with plicamycin because of major drug interactions. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When palbociclib and lemborexant are taken together, they can cause severe sleepiness. This may increase the risk of falling asleep while driving.
Major: The combination of golimumab and ozanimod can cause major side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor specifically recommends it.
Major: When iothalamic acid and edetate calcium are given together, they can cause serious problems such as kidney damage.
Major: When buspirone is taken together with granisetron, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Fingolimod can cause a drop in blood pressure. If you take fingolimod with asenapine, this drop in blood pressure may be worse. This is because asenapine also causes a drop in blood pressure.
Major: When doxepin is taken together with safinamide, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This interaction is major.
Major: Bexarotene can increase the risk of skin reactions when used together with talimogene laherparepvec. This combination should be avoided unless the benefits outweigh the risks.

Major: When cladribine and valrubicin are given together, they can cause serious side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This is because both drugs work by damaging cells in the body, including healthy cells in the bone marrow.
Major: Droperidol and doxepin together can cause severe drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and difficulty breathing. This interaction may be due to an increase of droperidol in the bloodstream.

Major: The combination of antithymocyte immunoglobulin (ATG) and smallpox vaccine can cause severe reactions. ATG can make the immune system more active. This can increase the chance of having a reaction to the smallpox vaccine.

Drug_B: Human botulinum neurotoxin A/B immune globulin
Interaction_Explanation: Major: Cyclosporine can increase the level of human botulinum neurotoxin A/B immune globulin in your body by about 10%. This may lead to increased side effects such as weakness, dizziness, muscle pain, blurred vision, drooping eyelids, or other symptoms.

Major: Sibutramine is an appetite suppressant used to treat obesity. It works by blocking certain chemicals in the brain that cause sleepiness. Safinamide is a drug used to treat Parkinson’s disease. It works by increasing levels of a chemical called dopamine in the brain. Taking these drugs together may increase your heart rate, blood pressure, and risk of stroke. This can be very dangerous. If you take both drugs together, talk to your doctor first.

Major: Irinotecan (liposomal) is a cancer medicine used to treat ovarian cancer. Talimogene laherparepvec is a cancer vaccine used to treat melanoma. Irinotecan (liposomal) can cause severe skin reactions when used together with talimogene laherparepvec. This combination should be avoided.
Major: When salsalate is taken together with ioxilan, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because salsalate can increase the effects of ioxilan, which increases the chance of bleeding.
Major: Taking mefenamic acid with regorafenib can cause major side effects. This is because regorafenib increases the level of mefenamic acid in your body.
Major: When bexarotene is taken together with gilteritinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Tacrolimus and siponimod should not be used together because they can increase the risk of certain side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: The combination of etanercept and irinotecan can cause severe reactions such as allergic reactions.

Major: When lumacaftor and selumetinib are taken together, they can increase each other’s side effects. This is because these drugs affect the same pathway in the body. The most common side effect of this combination is diarrhea.

Major: Taking palonosetron together with osimertinib can cause severe side effects such as nausea and vomiting. This interaction may be due to the fact that palonosetron and osimertinib are metabolized by the same enzyme in the body.
Major: Taking fluoxetine together with sibutramine can cause serious harm to your body. Fluoxetine may increase the effects of sibutramine. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Taking phenytoin together with teriflunomide can cause major side effects. Phenytoin may increase the levels of teriflunomide in your body, which could lead to serious liver problems.

Major: Cyclosporine is a drug used to prevent organ rejection after transplantation. It is also used for autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis. Ritonavir is an antiretroviral drug used to treat HIV infection. Taking ritonavir together with cyclosporine can cause serious side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is very strong (major) because ritonavir inhibits the metabolism of cyclosporine by the liver enzyme CYP3A4

Major: When sulfasalazine and leflunomide are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, rash, and liver damage. This interaction may be due to an increase in the levels of leflunomide in the bloodstream. Patients should avoid taking these drugs together unless their healthcare provider recommends it.

Major: Taking methotrexate together with infliximab can cause major side effects. This is because methotrexate can increase the levels of infliximab in your body. This can lead to serious liver problems.

Major: The combination of warfarin and oxymetholone can cause major drug interactions. Oxymetholone increases the effects of warfarin by increasing its absorption into the body. This can lead to excessive anticoagulation and increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: When heparin is given together with dalteparin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because heparin can increase the effects of dalteparin. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.

Major: When epirubicin is combined with ceritinib, there is an increased risk of heart failure. This is because epirubicin can cause changes to the heart muscle, and ceritinib can worsen these changes.

Major: Dasatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It works by blocking proteins called kinases. Inotersen is used to treat certain types of genetic disorders. It works by adding small pieces of genetic material into cells. Taking dasatinib and inotersen together may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because dasatinib can block other proteins called platelet receptor gamma. These proteins help keep blood clots from forming. Inotersen may also cause bleeding because it can affect how well platelets work. The exact reason for this interaction is
Major: Interferon gamma-1b and teriflunomide should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage.

Major: Taking metoprolol together with theophylline can cause major side effects. This is because metoprolol slows down how quickly the body gets rid of theophylline. This can lead to too much theophylline in the blood, which can be dangerous.

Major: The combination of lapatinib and mipomersen can cause major side effects. This is because lapatinib increases levels of mipomersen in your body. However, this interaction has not been reported to occur in patients taking these drugs together.
Major: When deferasirox is taken together with zanubrutinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and rash. This interaction is major.
Major: When lenalidomide is taken together with nivolumab, there is an increased risk of serious skin reactions. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking sacituzumab govitecan together with infliximab can cause serious side effects. This is because infliximab may affect how sacituzumab govitecan works.

Major: Encorafenib is used to treat advanced colorectal cancer. It works by blocking a protein called BRAF. Voxelotor is used to treat sickle cell disease. It works by increasing the oxygen-carrying capacity of red blood cells. Taking encorafenib together with voxelotor may increase the risk of serious bleeding. This is because encorafenib can increase the risk of bleeding when taken alone, and voxelotor can also increase the risk of bleeding when taken alone. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown

Major: Etanercept can increase the risk of infection when combined with mycophenolic acid. This is because etanercept may decrease the activity of an enzyme called CYP3A4, which helps break down mycophenolic acid into smaller molecules that are easier to be removed from the body. As a result, higher levels of mycophenolic acid could remain in your body for longer periods of time, increasing the risk of infection.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. The measles virus vaccine live attenuated can be given to people who take guselkumab. However, guselkumab may decrease the effectiveness of the measles virus vaccine live attenuated.

Major: Taking pimozide together with vandetanib can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because pimozide slows down the heart rate and vandetanib increases the heart rate. The combination of these two drugs can lead to abnormal heart rhythms. Therefore, patients should avoid taking these two drugs together.
Major: When fondaparinux and rivaroxaban are taken together, they can increase each other’s blood thinning effects. This can increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: Taking typhoid vaccine while taking trabectedin can cause serious side effects because the immune system is weakened by trabectedin.

Major: Taking etanercept and secukinumab together can cause major side effects. Etanercept decreases the amount of secukinumab in your body. This can increase the chance of side effects from secukinumab.

Major: Conivaptan and hydrocodone should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, confusion, seizures, and coma. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs affect the brain.

Major: Valganciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat cytomegalovirus infection. Golimumab is an immunosuppressant used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, and axial spondyloarthritis. Taking valganciclovir together with golimumab can increase the risk of serious infections. This is because valganciclovir may decrease the body’s ability to fight off infections by weakening the immune system. Golimumab

Major: Cenobamate and neratinib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because cenobamate can increase the effects of neratinib, which also increases the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking olaratumab together with infliximab can cause major side effects. Olaratumab works by binding to a protein called CD147 on cells. This can block the growth of cancer cells. Infliximab works by blocking a protein called TNF-alpha. This can also help reduce inflammation. When these two drugs are taken together, they may bind to each other instead of binding to their normal targets. This can change how well olaratumab or infliximab work, or it could increase the side effects.
Major: The smallpox vaccine may increase the risk of cancer. If you are taking niraparib, your healthcare provider should check whether you can be vaccinated against smallpox.

Major: Cisapride should be avoided in patients taking dronedarone because of a major drug interaction. Cisapride slows down the heart rate, while dronedarone speeds up the heart rate. This combination can cause serious side effects such as ventricular tachycardia.

Major: The combination of papaverine and relugolix can cause major side effects. Papaverine decreases blood pressure and relugolix increases blood pressure. This combination can lead to dangerous changes in blood pressure.

Major: Taking pimozide together with midostaurin can cause serious side effects. Pimozide may increase the levels of midostaurin in your body. This can lead to too much midostaurin causing side effects such as liver problems, bleeding, or blood clots.

Major: The combination of pazopanib and talimogene laherparepvec can cause major drug interactions. Pazopanib decreases the effectiveness of talimogene laherparepvec. It is recommended to avoid this combination.

Major: Mycophenolate mofetil is used to treat autoimmune diseases such as lupus. It works by suppressing the body’s immune system. Ozanimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by reducing the activity of certain cells in the central nervous system. Taking these drugs together may increase the risk of serious infections because mycophenolate mofetil can lower the body’s ability to fight infections.

Major: Ibrutinib and fedratinib should not be used together because they can cause severe side effects. Ibrutinib may increase levels of fedratinib in your body, which could lead to bleeding. Fedratinib may also increase levels of ibritinib in your body, which could lead to serious liver damage.

Major: When diclofenac is taken together with omacetaxine mepesuccinate, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because diclofenac can increase the effects of omacetaxine mepesuccinate on platelets.
Major: Taking pasireotide with atomoxetine can cause major side effects. This is because atomoxetine increases levels of pasireotide in your body.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with panobinostat, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body. It is recommended to avoid taking anagrelide together with panobinostat unless specifically advised by a healthcare provider.
Major: Arsenic trioxide can increase levels of potassium in your blood when taken with bendroflumethiazide. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Cidofovir should not be used together with neomycin because cidofovir levels may increase in your body. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: Taking desipramine with arsenic trioxide can cause serious side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because desipramine is broken down by an enzyme in the liver that arsenic trioxide also affects.
Major: When salmeterol is taken together with ribociclib, there is an increased risk of heart problems. This interaction is major.
Major: Ozanimod can increase the risk of serious infection when used together with axicabtagene ciloleucel. This is because ozanimod may affect the body’s ability to fight infection.

Major: The drug pimozide can cause major problems when taken together with rucaparib. This problem may happen because pimozide can block the effects of rucaparib. It is important to talk to your doctor about this problem before taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking carboplatin and deferiprone together can cause serious side effects. Carboplatin works by binding to DNA and stopping cell division. Deferiprone also binds to DNA but in a different way. This can lead to unexpected interactions between the two drugs.

Major: When flurbiprofen is used together with desirudin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because flurbiprofen can increase the effects of desirudin. It is important to closely monitor patients for signs of bleeding when these drugs are used together.

Major: Taking amitriptyline together with cisapride can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is very likely to occur because amitriptyline slows down the elimination of cisapride from the body. It is best to avoid taking these two drugs together.

Major: When ritonavir is given together with paclitaxel, it can increase the side effects of paclitaxel. This is because ritonavir slows down how quickly paclitaxel is broken down by the body. The increased level of paclitaxel in the blood may cause more side effects.
Major: When methotrexate is taken together with rabeprazole, there is an increased risk of severe liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Cidofovir should not be used together with bacitracin because they can interact in an unpredictable way. This interaction has been observed in studies done in animals and in humans. The interaction may cause unexpected side effects.
Major: Taking tetracycline together with pexidartinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking pimozide together with picosulfuric acid can cause major side effects. This is because pimozide increases the level of picosulfuric acid in your body.

Major: Alefacept can cause a decrease in white blood cells. Fingolimod can also cause a decrease in white blood cells. Taking fingolimod together with alefacept may increase the chance of getting infections because both drugs can lower white blood cell counts.

Major: Taking prednisone with delafloxacin can cause serious side effects. This is because prednisone can increase the level of delafloxacin in your body. The FDA recommends that prednisone be stopped at least 14 days before starting delafloxacin.

Major: Lepirudin is an anticoagulant used to treat blood clots. Alteplase is a thrombolytic agent used to dissolve blood clots. When these drugs are given together, they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because lepirudin and alteplase both work on the blood to prevent or break up clots. The risk of bleeding increases when these drugs are given together. Therefore, it is recommended that lepirudin should be stopped at least 24 hours before giving alteplase.
Major: Taking leflunomide together with tioguanine can cause major harm. Leflunomide may increase levels of tioguanine in your body, which can lead to severe liver problems.

Major: When cladribine is taken together with dexamethasone, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas), liver problems, and severe infections. It is not clear how these interactions occur.

Major: Taking acarbose together with gatifloxacin can cause severe side effects such as severe allergic reactions. This is because acarbose slows down the breakdown of gatifloxacin by the liver. The exact mechanism is unknown but may be related to the way these drugs are metabolized.

Major: The rotavirus vaccine can cause serious problems when given together with deflazacort. This problem has been seen in studies done in the lab and in patients. It is not clear how this problem happens.

Major: When idarubicin and certolizumab pegol are given together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the drugs affect each other in a way that can be harmful. In this case, idarubicin increases how much certolizumab pegol affects your immune system. This can increase your risk of infection.
Major: Escitalopram can cause serious harm when taken together with midostaurin. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Dolutegravir is used to treat HIV infection. It works by blocking the action of an enzyme called integrase. Tetraferric tricitrate decahydrate is used to treat iron deficiency. Taking these drugs together can lead to a decrease in the amount of dolutegravir in your blood. This may reduce the effectiveness of dolutegravir.

Major: The combination of vilazodone and methylene blue can cause major side effects. Vilazodone lowers blood pressure by relaxing blood vessels. Methylene blue increases blood pressure by constricting blood vessels. This opposite effect on blood pressure can cause serious problems.
Major: Tipranavir decreases how well ramucirumab works. This may increase your risk of bleeding.
Major: When celecoxib is taken along with iopamidol, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking dexamethasone together with encorafenib can cause major side effects. Dexamethasone can increase the levels of encorafenib in your body, which may lead to serious side effects.
Major: When vemurafenib is taken together with rifabutin, there is an increased risk of skin reactions. This is because rifabutin inhibits the breakdown of vemurafenib.

Major: Saquinavir can increase fluticasone levels in your body by about 100%. This can lead to increased side effects of fluticasone such as headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.
Major: Delavirdine can increase the levels of artemether in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects of artemether.
Major: Dronedarone and ivosidenib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When rifabutin is taken together with ribociclib, it can increase the levels of ribociclib in your body by about 10 times. This may lead to side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, fatigue, and rash.
Major: Osimertinib is used to treat lung cancer. Ribociclib is used to treat breast cancer. Taking osimertinib together with ribociclib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Ranolazine should not be used together with nilotinib because it can increase levels of nilotinib in your body. This may cause serious side effects.
Major: The combination of cobimetinib and stiripentol can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless otherwise recommended by your doctor.
Major: Bepridil can increase the levels of eribulin in your body by about 10 times. This may lead to increased side effects.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. The risk of infection is increased when taking brexucabtagene autoleucel with baricitinib.
Major: The combination of perflutren and cisapride can cause major side effects. This is because perflutren can increase the levels of cisapride in your body. This can lead to serious heart problems.
Major: When tipranavir is used together with heparin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because tipranavir can increase the effects of heparin.

Major: Taking palonosetron together with vortioxetine can cause severe side effects such as QT interval prolongation. This is because palonosetron can increase the levels of vortioxetine in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these medications together.
Major: When vandetanib is taken together with ivosidenib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When bexarotene is taken together with raloxifene, there is an increased risk of skin reactions. This interaction is major.
Major: When simvastatin is taken together with levamlodipine, there is an increased risk of muscle problems. This interaction is major.
Major: Ranolazine should not be used together with vandetanib because it can increase the risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Nebivolol is used to treat high blood pressure. It works by relaxing the blood vessels. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by slowing down how quickly certain cells leave the brain and spinal cord. Taking nebivolol together with siponimod can cause the level of siponimod in your body to go up. This can increase the risk of bradycardia (slow heart rate) and other side effects.

Major: Taking citalopram and lorcaserin together can cause serious harm. Citalopram increases blood levels of lorcaserin by about 10 times. This may increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, and sleepiness.

Major: Taking phenylpropanolamine (PPA) at the same time as iodine-131 (I-131) can cause severe side effects. This is because PPA increases the level of a hormone called thyroxine, which can counteract the effect of I-131 on thyroid cancer cells.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. It means that selinexor can make the varicella zoster vaccine less effective. The varicella zoster vaccine is used to prevent chickenpox infection and shingles. Shingles is caused by the same virus that causes chickenpox. After you have chickenpox, the virus stays in your body and is usually dormant (inactive). As you age, the chance of the virus reactivating increases. When this happens, it causes shingles. Major: Gemfibrozil should be avoided when taking eluxadoline because gemfibrozil can increase the levels of eluxadoline in your body, which may cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: When ticlopidine is taken together with clozapine, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because ticlopidine increases the levels of clozapine in the blood. It is important to monitor patients for signs of bleeding when these two drugs are used together.

Major: When iloperidone is taken together with alimemazine, it can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur. It is thought that this happens because alimemazine increases the amount of iloperidone in the body.

Major: The combination of temsirolimus and human cytomegalovirus immune globulin can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in ways that could be harmful. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should use these drugs together.

Major: Using cocaine topically while taking nortriptyline can be dangerous. Nortriptyline and cocaine interact by increasing the effects of each other. This can lead to serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, coma, seizures, hallucinations, and even death.

Drug_B: Vibrio cholerae CVD 103-HgR strain live antigen (live)
Interaction_Explanation: Major: Taking neomycin together with the live antigen for cholera can cause severe diarrhea. This is because neomycin decreases the body’s ability to absorb the live antigen.

Major: Epirubicin is used to treat cancer. It works by interfering with DNA in cells. Leflunomide is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It works by slowing down the immune system. Taking epirubicin together with leflunomide may increase the risk of heart failure. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking phenylpropanolamine together with diethylpropion can cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure, headache, and seizures. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are broken down by the same enzyme in the body.

Major: Eptifibatide is used to prevent blood clots after stent placement. Ardeparin is used as an anticoagulant for patients with deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism. Taking ardeparin together with eptifibatide can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: The combination of temsirolimus and golimumab can cause major side effects. Golimumab decreases the ability of the body to remove temsirolimus from the bloodstream. This causes an increase in the level of temsirolimus in the bloodstream.
Major: Rifampicin can make apixaban less effective. This may increase the risk of blood clots.
Major: Arsenic trioxide can cause serious side effects when taken together with lisdexamfetamine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Nilotinib is used to treat certain types of leukemia and some tumors. It works by blocking a protein called c-KIT. Fingolimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by blocking a protein called S1P1 receptor. When these drugs are taken together, they can block both c-KIT and S1P1 receptors at the same time. This can increase the risk of side effects such as low blood pressure, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and dizziness

Major: When moxifloxacin and oxaliplatin are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as peripheral neuropathy. This is because moxifloxacin inhibits the activity of an enzyme called CYP1A2, which normally helps to break down oxaliplatin into less harmful substances. As a result, more oxaliplatin remains in the body and causes peripheral neuropathy.
Major: Taking methylergometrine together with naphazoline can cause severe drowsiness. This may be due to an increase in the level of a chemical called serotonin in the brain.

Major: Imatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It should not be taken within 14 days before or after receiving the rubella vaccine because imatinib may decrease the effectiveness of the vaccine.

Major: When ziprasidone is taken together with sorafenib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and sleepiness. This interaction may be due to the fact that ziprasidone inhibits the metabolism of sorafenib by the CYP3A4 enzyme.

Major: When anisindione is taken together with regorafenib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, taking anisindione with regorafenib may increase the risk of bleeding. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid taking anisindione with regorafenib unless specifically advised by a healthcare provider.

Major: Valbenazine is used to treat movement disorders such as tardive dyskinesia. Macimorelin is used to help diagnose growth hormone deficiency. Taking macimorelin with valbenazine can cause severe side effects.

Major: Etanercept can increase the side effects of romidepsin. This is because etanercept can block the action of a protein called interleukin-1 receptor antagonist protein (IL-1Ra), which normally reduces the side effects of romidepsin.
Major: Taking methysergide while taking ephedrine nasal spray can cause severe high blood pressure.

Major: Taking insulin human (zinc) together with lomefloxacin can cause major side effects. The body absorbs insulin human (zinc) less well when taken with lomefloxacin, which may lead to too much or too little sugar in the blood.
Major: When terbinafine is taken together with pexidartinib, there is an increased risk of liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When voriconazole is taken together with astemizole, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by the fact that astemizole inhibits the enzyme that metabolizes voriconazole. This causes an increase in the level of voriconazole in the blood. It is important to avoid this combination unless specifically advised by a healthcare professional.
Major: Taking lithium carbonate together with ribociclib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Flecainide is a heart medication used to treat certain types of irregular heartbeats. Ozanimod is an experimental medicine being studied for multiple sclerosis. Taking these drugs together may cause serious changes in the electrical activity of the heart. This interaction is very likely to occur because flecainide is eliminated from the body through the liver and intestines, while ozanimod is taken up into the liver. The interaction should be avoided.
Major: Mitotane can reduce the effectiveness of delavirdine. This means that delavirdine may not work as well when given together with mitotane.

Major: When pimozide is taken along with bicalutamide, there is an increased risk of side effects such as priapism (a condition where the penis becomes erect on its own without sexual stimulation) and other sexual dysfunction. This interaction is major.

Major: Aminophylline is used to treat caffeine overdose. It can cause serious problems when combined with iohexol, which is an iodinated contrast agent used for imaging. This problem has been reported in patients who were given aminophylline before receiving iohexol. The combination of these two drugs should be avoided.
Major: Taking trimipramine together with sibutramine can cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure and heart problems.
Major: When ibutilide is used together with fluconazole, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is major.

Major: The drug givosiran can increase levels of liver enzymes in the blood. This can be a sign of liver damage. Taking the drug pirfenidone together with givosiran may increase this effect. It is important to monitor liver function when taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking sibutramine while taking rizatriptan can cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure and heart attack. This is because sibutramine increases the amount of rizatriptan in your body.

Major: Taking hydrocodone together with ozanimod can cause major drug interactions. This means that the combination of these drugs may have side effects that are worse than taking either drug alone. It is best to avoid this combination unless your doctor has told you to do so.
Major: When aldesleukin and pexidartinib are taken together, they can interact in a way that may cause serious side effects such as increased risk of bleeding.
Major: Doxepin and iohexol should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Doxepin may increase levels of iohexol in your body, which can lead to kidney damage.
Major: Ranolazine should not be used together with ceritinib because it can increase the risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Cobicistat can increase the levels of elagolix in your body by about 40%. This may increase side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, and weakness.

Major: When calcium phosphate is taken together with bictegravir, there is an increased risk of kidney problems. This is because calcium phosphate can increase the levels of bictegravir in your blood.

Major: When tenecteplase and ramucirumab are given together, they can interact in a way that makes tenecteplase less effective at dissolving blood clots. This interaction may increase the risk of complications from blood clots.
Major: Taking vitamin A while taking tretinoin can cause birth defects.
Major: Osimertinib and ivosidenib should not be taken together because they both target the same protein in the body. This can cause osimertinib to lose its effectiveness.

Major: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and other heart conditions. It should not be taken together with fingolimod, which is used for multiple sclerosis. This combination increases the risk of bradycardia (slow heart rate) and hypotension (low blood pressure).

Major: Taking yellow fever vaccine while taking tioguanine can cause major side effects. This is because yellow fever vaccine increases levels of a substance called thiopurines in your body. Thiopurines are broken down by an enzyme in your body called TPMT. Taking yellow fever vaccine lowers the amount of this enzyme, which can lead to severe side effects.
Major: Taking daunorubicin (liposomal) together with ribociclib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor has told you to take them together.
Major: Taking chlorpromazine with potassium chloride can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This is because chlorpromazine may increase the levels of potassium in your body.

Major: Taking midazolam together with ceritinib can be dangerous. It may cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, sedation, and coma. This interaction is due to the fact that ceritinib inhibits the enzyme that metabolizes midazolam. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.
Major: Dronedarone and ozanimod should not be used together because they can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This interaction is major.

Major: Bupropion is used to treat depression and smoking cessation. It may cause seizures as a side effect. Apalutamide is used to treat prostate cancer. Taking apalutamide together with bupropion increases the risk of having a seizure.
Major: When moxifloxacin is taken together with romidepsin, there is an increased risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Piroxicam is an anti-inflammatory drug. Ponatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking piroxicam with ponatinib can cause serious side effects such as bleeding and blood clotting problems. Therefore, this combination should be avoided.

Major: Oxytocin is used to induce labor and for other obstetric indications. Hydroxychloroquine is an antimalarial drug. When these drugs are given together, they can cause severe heart rhythm problems.

Major: Taking deutetrabenazine together with panobinostat can cause severe side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating. These effects may be more likely to occur when deutetrabenazine is taken at the same time as panobinostat than when it is taken alone. It is important for patients to talk to their healthcare provider about whether they should take these medications together.

Major: Gemzar (Gemtuzumab ozogamicin) is used to treat acute myeloid leukemia. It can cause liver problems. Ozanimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. When these drugs are given together, they may increase the risk of liver problems.

Major: Taking trimipramine together with dolasetron can cause serious side effects such as seizures, coma, and heart attack. This interaction is very likely to occur because trimipramine increases the levels of dolasetron in your body.

Major: Ranolazine should not be used together with siponimod because it can increase the risk of serious side effects. This interaction may occur because ranolazine can slow down the way the body breaks down siponimod.
Major: The tositumomab vaccine and rotavirus vaccine should not be used together because they can cause severe reactions. This is because tositumomab may affect how well the rotavirus vaccine works.
Major: Taking phenobarbital together with cabozantinib can cause major changes in how these drugs work in your body. This may increase side effects of both drugs.

Major: When palonosetron and ribociclib are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. In this case, palonosetron may not work as well when taken with ribociclib.
Major: The drug ziprasidone can cause serious changes in heart rate when taken together with the drug panitumumab. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Fludarabine can increase the levels of ozanimod in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and fever.

Major: Carbamazepine is used to treat epilepsy and neuropathic pain. Deferiprone is used to treat iron overload in patients with thalassemia major. Taking carbamazepine together with deferiprone can increase the risk of serious side effects such as aplastic anemia.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of olaparib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fatigue.
Major: When piroxicam and ramucirumab are taken together, they can interact in a way that may cause serious side effects such as stomach bleeding. This interaction is major.

Major: When anistreplase is given together with ponatinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the combination may increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: When topiramate is taken together with alimemazine, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking bedaquiline together with lapatinib can cause major side effects. This is because bedaquiline increases the levels of lapatinib in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you to do so.

Major: Amisulpride is used to treat schizophrenia. It should not be taken together with ceritinib because amisulpride can increase the levels of ceritinib in your body, which may lead to side effects.
Major: Fingolimod and cabozantinib should not be used together because they can cause dangerously low blood pressure. This interaction is well known to occur.
Major: Ketoconazole can increase the levels of artemether in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with propafenone, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. In particular, this combination may increase the risk of bleeding. Therefore, it is important to avoid taking anagrelide together with propafenone.
Major: When sotalol and enzalutamide are taken together, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When macimorelin is taken together with levosalbutamol, there is an increased risk of bronchospasm. This is because macimorelin can increase the levels of salbutamol in the body. Bronchospasm is a condition where the airways narrow and breathing becomes difficult.

Major: When haloperidol is taken together with osilodrostat, there is an increased risk of side effects such as hyperprolactinemia (high levels of prolactin), which can lead to changes in menstruation patterns, breast enlargement, and decreased sex drive. This interaction is major because it can cause serious harm.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause skin rashes when given together with certain drugs. This drug–drug interaction is major because the combination of these two drugs can be dangerous.
Major: The combination of ivacaftor and netupitant can cause major side effects. This is because ivacaftor increases the levels of netupitant in your body.
Major: When methylprednisolone is taken together with cinoxacin, there is an increased risk of side effects such as vertigo, dizziness, headache, and confusion. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking dihydroergotamine together with ozanimod can cause major side effects. Dihydroergotamine may increase the levels of ozanimod in your body. This can lead to serious heart problems.

Major: Taking amphotericin B together with sirolimus can cause serious side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is very likely to occur because amphotericin B is broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4, which is also used to break down sirolimus. By taking these drugs at the same time, the amount of sirolimus in your body may become too high. Therefore, you should avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you otherwise.
Major: Esomeprazole can increase levels of tacrolimus in your body by about 50%. This may lead to increased side effects of tacrolimus.

Major: Taking triflupromazine with chloroquine can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, breathing, and blood pressure. This interaction may be due to an effect on the heart’s electrical activity.

Major: Taking etodolac while being given iohexol can cause major problems. Etodolac can increase how much iohexol is absorbed into your body. This may lead to kidney damage.

Major: When glipizide is taken together with miconazole, there is an increased risk of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar). This is because miconazole blocks the action of glipizide, which can lead to low blood sugar levels. It is important for patients to monitor their blood sugar levels closely when taking these medications together.

Major: Edoxaban is an anticoagulant used to prevent stroke and systemic embolism in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation.
