Major: Oxytocin is used to induce labor and stimulate uterine contractions during delivery. Citalopram is an antidepressant. Taking citalopram together with oxytocin can cause serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: Imatinib should be used with caution when taking baricitinib. This combination can increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: The radioactive drug samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause major problems when taken together with abemaciclib. This is because samarium (153Sm) lexidronam may be removed from the body by the liver, which also metabolizes abemaciclib. When these two drugs are taken together, this can lead to too little of either drug being present in the body.

Major: When rituximab and cladribine are given together, they can have a severe effect on your body. This is because rituximab removes cladribine from your bloodstream, so you may not get enough of the medicine.
Major: When mesoridazine is taken together with ketoconazole, mesoridazine levels can go up in the blood. This may increase side effects of mesoridazine.

Major: The combination of dactinomycin and samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in an important way. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Major: When hydrocortisone and pimozide are taken together, they can interact in an undesirable way. This interaction is major. It can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, breathing, and sleep. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.

Major: The rubella vaccine can cause a severe reaction when given together with doxorubicin. This has been observed in some patients who received both drugs at the same time. It is important to give doxorubicin at least 7 days before or after receiving the rubella vaccine to avoid this problem.

Major: When chlorambucil and thalidomide are taken together, they can cause severe and life-threatening changes in the blood cell count. This is because these drugs affect the way the body makes blood cells.
Major: Taking vandetanib together with eribulin can cause serious side effects. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Iloperidone can increase the levels of hydroxychloroquine in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects such as abnormal heart rhythms.
Major: Cisapride and telithromycin should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. The risk of this problem is high.
Major: The drug tinzaparin can cause major bleeding when taken together with zanubrutinib. This happens because tinzaparin increases the effects of zanubrutinib on blood clotting.

Major: Fingolimod and cabozantinib should not be used together because they can cause dangerously low blood pressure. This interaction is well known to occur. It is thought that fingolimod slows down the heart rate too much when taken with cabozantinib, which also slows down the heart rate.

Major: When vemurafenib is taken together with rifampicin, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the way vemurafenib works in your body can be changed by taking rifampicin at the same time. As a result, the amount of vemurafenib in your blood may go down. This could make vemurafenib less effective.

Major: When kanamycin is given together with iopromide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: The irinotecan liposomal vaccine interferes with how the body processes rotavirus vaccine. This can increase side effects of rotavirus vaccine.

Major: When iopamidol and cefiderocol are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Major: Codeine can cause severe breathing problems when taken together with methylene blue. This problem has been reported in patients taking codeine for pain relief together with methylene blue as an emergency treatment for methemoglobinemia. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: When rilpivirine is taken together with ivosidenib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Major: When salmeterol is taken together with clarithromycin, there is an increased risk of hospitalization due to asthma attacks. This interaction is major.
Major: The combination of pirbuterol and ozanimod can cause serious side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor has advised you to do so.

Major: Taking pantoprazole together with atazanavir can cause major changes in how well these drugs work. This is because pantoprazole decreases the amount of atazanavir in your body. As a result, atazanavir may not work as well as usual.
Major: When plicamycin is given together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of harm to the heart. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking pazopanib together with clarithromycin can cause major side effects. This is because pazopanib is broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4, which is also used to break down clarithromycin. When these two drugs are taken together, they compete for this enzyme, which can lead to increased levels of both drugs in your body. This can increase your risk of side effects.
Major: When mipomersen and tocilizumab are given together, they can have a severe effect on your body. This is because mipomersen can increase the levels of tocilizumab in your blood.

Major: Ranitidine can increase the levels of rilpivirine in your body by about two times. This may lead to side effects such as nausea, dizziness, headache, and changes in heart rate. It is important to take rilpivirine as directed on the label.
Major: When indomethacin is taken together with iodixanol, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.
Major: When rituximab is combined with leflunomide, there is an increased risk of severe liver damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking ketoconazole together with colchicine can cause major side effects. This is because ketoconazole increases the level of colchicine in your body. The increased level of colchicine can lead to serious side effects such as liver damage.
Major: When vinblastine is taken together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as liver problems. This interaction is major.
Major: When fosamprenavir is given together with temsirolimus, the level of temsirolimus in the blood may be increased. This can increase the risk of side effects.

Major: Rifampicin can reduce the effectiveness of fedratinib by more than half. Fedratinib can also reduce the effectiveness of rifampicin by about one-third. This interaction is major because it can decrease the effectiveness of both drugs.
Major: Taking tositumomab (I-131) together with phenylbutazone increases the risk of serious side effects.
Major: Taking romidepsin together with dolasetron can cause severe side effects such as nausea and vomiting. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking azatadine together with potassium chloride can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This is because azatadine slows down the heart rate and lowers blood pressure while potassium chloride increases blood pressure.

Major: When taking anagrelide together with gilteritinib, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body. It is recommended to avoid this drug combination unless specifically advised by a healthcare provider.
Major: Taking phenylbutazone together with regorafenib can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase your risk of bleeding.

Major: When pegaspargase is taken with thalidomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs. It is best to avoid taking pegaspargase with thalidomide.

Major: Elagolix is used to treat pain due to endometriosis. It works by blocking the hormone testosterone from entering cells. Delavirdine is used to treat HIV infection. It blocks the action of an enzyme called CYP3A4. When these drugs are taken together, delavirdine can increase levels of elagolix in your body. This increases the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, headache, dizziness, and depression.

Major: Taking quinine together with mesoridazine can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This interaction has been observed in many patients and is well understood by doctors.
Major: Taking mefloquine together with saquinavir can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur because of how these drugs are metabolized in the body.
Major: Cisatracurium should not be used together with neomycin because cisatracurium can block the effects of neomycin. This interaction is major.
Major: When plicamycin and ibrutinib are taken together, they can interact in a way that makes ibrutinib less effective. This means that ibrutinib may not work as well to treat certain conditions.
Major: When oxtriphylline and riociguat are taken together, they can cause dangerously low blood pressure. This happens because oxtriphylline increases the effects of riociguat.

Major: The rotavirus vaccine can cause serious problems when given together with deflazacort. This problem has been seen in studies done in the lab and in patients. It is not clear how this problem happens.

Major: This study showed that insulin human zinc and grepafloxacin together can cause serious problems. The body breaks down insulin into parts to use it. Grepafloxacin may slow this breakdown. This can lead to too much insulin in your blood. It is not clear how often this problem happens.

Major: When triamcinolone is taken together with bupropion, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as high blood sugar, high blood pressure, and mood changes. This interaction is moderate to major.

Major: The yellow fever vaccine can cause a severe reaction when given together with the cancer medicine belinostat. This problem has been reported to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and is listed in the FDA drug labels for both drugs.

Major: Toremifene and pazopanib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because toremifene can increase levels of blood clotting proteins, while pazopanib can decrease levels of blood clotting proteins.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of indinavir in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects of indinavir.

Major: When doxepin is used together with potassium citrate, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Fentanyl is an opioid pain medication used for moderate to severe pain. It can be taken by mouth, placed on the skin, or given through a needle. Ivosidenib is a medicine used to treat a certain type of acute myeloid leukemia. It is taken by mouth. Taking ivosidenib with fentanyl may cause drowsiness. This is because fentanyl can increase the effects of ivosidenib. People taking this combination should talk to their health care provider about whether they should take them together.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with pimozide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body. It is recommended to avoid taking anagrelide together with pimozide unless specifically advised by a healthcare professional.

Drug_B: Bacillus calmette-guerin substrain tice live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: The combination of procarbazine and bacillus calmette-guerin substrain tice live antigen can cause severe reactions such as fever, chills, sweating, and flushing.

Major: Adalimumab is used to treat autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, Crohn’s disease, and ulcerative colitis. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. Taking adalimumab together with siponimod may increase the risk of serious infection due to an immune system response. This is because both drugs affect the immune system. Therefore, this combination should be avoided.
Major: Leflunomide is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Omacetaxine mepesuccinate is used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia. Taking these drugs together may cause severe liver problems.
Major: Taking pralatrexate together with upadacitinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Axitinib and tucatinib should not be taken together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Taking promazine together with arsenic trioxide can be dangerous. Promazine may increase the levels of arsenic trioxide in your body. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: Taking phenobarbital with fostamatinib can be dangerous. It may increase the side effects of phenobarbital. This interaction is well known to happen. The reason for this interaction is that fostamatinib reduces the amount of an enzyme that helps break down phenobarbital.

Major: Deflazacort can increase blood sugar levels. Berotralstat lowers blood sugar levels. Taking these drugs together may cause blood sugar levels to go too high or too low. Check your blood sugar levels often while taking these drugs together.

Major: The combination of fosaprepitant and naloxegol can cause severe drowsiness. This may increase the risk of falling asleep while driving. Therefore, patients should avoid driving after taking these drugs together.
Major: Taking lorcaserin together with rizatriptan can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this happens.

Major: When darolutamide is taken together with lumacaftor, there is an increased risk of side effects such as arrhythmia (irregular heartbeat) and cardiac arrest (heart attack). This interaction is major.
Major: When dicoumarol is taken together with gatifloxacin, it can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because dicoumarol increases the effects of gatifloxacin on blood clotting.

Major: Natalizumab and busulfan should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Natalizumab decreases the way the body breaks down busulfan, which can increase its levels in the blood. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: Amprenavir can increase levels of cobimetinib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of cobimetinib such as skin and eye problems, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and fatigue.

Major: Iloperidone is used to treat schizophrenia. It should not be taken together with cabozantinib because this can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. The mechanism of this interaction is that iloperidone inhibits the activity of an enzyme called CYP2D6 which metabolizes cabozantinib. This leads to increased levels of cabozantinib in the body and therefore increases the risk of side effects.

Major: When taking venlafaxine together with dextromethorphan, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because venlafaxine inhibits the breakdown of dextromethorphan by the liver enzyme CYP2D6. The exact mechanism is unknown.

Major: Natalizumab and thalidomide should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction has been observed in patients taking these drugs together. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are broken down by the body.
Major: Taking etodolac while receiving tositumomab (I-131) can cause major side effects. This is because etodolac may increase the activity of tositumomab (I-131), which could harm your body’s cells.

Major: Encorafenib is used to treat cancer. It works by blocking a protein called BRAF. Troleandomycin is used to treat bacterial infections. It works by blocking an enzyme called CYP1A2. When encorafenib and troleandomycin are taken together, they can increase each other’s side effects. This is because encorafenib and troleandomycin both block proteins and enzymes in the same pathway. Therefore, taking these drugs together should be avoided.

Major: The combination of goserelin and arsenic trioxide can cause severe side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4. When these two drugs are taken together, they may inhibit each other’s breakdown, leading to increased levels of both drugs in the body. This can increase the risk of side effects.
Major: Cidofovir can increase the levels of sirolimus in your body by about 10 times. This may lead to side effects such as kidney damage, high blood sugar, and increased risk of infection.

Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of quinine in your body by about two times. This may cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, dizziness, headache, seizures, and heart rhythm problems.
Major: Lepirudin is an anticoagulant used to treat blood clots. Ibrutinomab tiuxetan is a radioactive drug used to treat lymphoma. The combination of these drugs can cause severe bleeding.

Major: Bupropion is used to treat depression and smoking cessation. It can cause seizures as a side effect. Methylene blue is used to treat methemoglobinemia (a blood disorder) and as an antidote for cyanide poisoning. Taking methylene blue together with bupropion increases the risk of having a seizure.

Major: Ranolazine should not be used together with dabrafenib because it can increase the levels of dabrafenib in your body, which may cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking sertraline with macimorelin can cause severe changes in your blood sugar levels. This may increase your risk of developing diabetes.
Major: The combination of astemizole and conivaptan can cause serious abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is well known to occur because astemizole blocks certain channels in the heart cells.
Major: When cladribine is taken together with colchicine, there is an increased risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Enzalutamide and idelalisib should not be used together because they can increase side effects such as bleeding, diarrhea, and liver problems. It is not clear how these drugs interact to cause these side effects.

Major: Dofetilide is a medication used to treat an irregular heartbeat called arrhythmia. It works by blocking certain electrical signals in your heart. Mefloquine is another medication used to prevent and treat malaria. If taken together, dofetilide and mefloquine can increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart. Therefore, these two medications should be avoided when possible.

Drug_B: Human botulinum neurotoxin A/B immune globulin
Interaction_Explanation: Major drug–drug interactions occur when one drug makes another drug more dangerous or less effective. For example, diclofenac can make human botulinum neurotoxin A/B immune globulin less effective.
Major: Flutamide can increase crizotinib levels in your body by about 10 times. This may cause more side effects. Take flutamide as directed. If you have questions, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Major: When taking trabectedin together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body absorbs, distributes, metabolizes (breaks down), or excretes (gets rid of) the drugs. It is recommended to avoid this drug interaction. If you must take both drugs together, talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting treatment. They may recommend monitoring or dose adjustments.

Major: The drug ibrutinib can affect how well your body fights off viruses. It does this by decreasing the ability of white blood cells to fight off viruses. This can be a special problem for people who get vaccinated against rubella (a contagious disease caused by a virus). If you take ibrutinib and get vaccinated at the same time, your body may have a harder time fighting off the virus from the vaccine. This can make the vaccine less effective. It is important to talk to your health care provider before getting a vaccine if you are taking
Major: Anisindione is a blood thinner. It can increase the effects of Panobinostat, which is used to treat cancer. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Aminoglutethimide can increase fentanyl levels in the blood. This may cause increased drowsiness and other side effects.
Major: When rifapentine is given together with everolimus, the level of everolimus in the blood may go down. This can make everolimus less effective.

Major: Greppafloxacin and promethazine should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as seizures. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are metabolized by the body.

Major: Irinotecan and golimumab should not be used together because irinotecan can increase the risk of side effects from golimumab. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown but may involve the immune system.

Major: Meclofenamic acid is an anti-inflammatory pain reliever. It can be taken by mouth or applied to the skin. Danaparoid is used to treat blood clots. Taking meclofenamic acid while taking danaparoid can cause serious bleeding problems. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may involve the way these drugs affect platelets, which are small parts of the blood that help stop bleeding.

Major: When morphine and aripiprazole are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as sedation, dizziness, confusion, and coma. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are metabolized by the same enzyme.

Major: Tamoxifen is used to treat breast cancer. It works by blocking the effects of estrogen on breast cancer cells. Hydroxychloroquine is used to treat malaria, rheumatoid arthritis, and lupus. It works by stopping the body from making antibodies that attack healthy tissues. Taking tamoxifen together with hydroxychloroquine can increase the risk of heart problems.
Major: When glyburide and gatifloxacin are taken together, they can cause serious problems such as seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: When clarithromycin is taken together with berotralstat, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The exact reason for this interaction is that berotralstat increases the level of clarithromycin in the blood.
Major: Efavirenz can increase levels of ceritinib in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects of ceritinib.
Major: When lefamulin is taken together with isoprenaline, there is an increased risk of dangerously low blood pressure. This can cause dizziness, fainting, and other serious side effects.

Major: Etanercept can increase the side effects of carmustine. This is because etanercept can reduce the breakdown of carmustine by the body, which can lead to higher levels of carmustine in the blood. This can increase the risk of side effects from carmustine.

Major: When certolizumab pegol is used together with idelalisib, there is an increased risk of serious infection. This is because certolizumab pegol can increase the levels of idelalisib in your body.

Major: Iohexol is an iodinated contrast agent used for imaging of the blood vessels and organs of the abdomen. Desvenlafaxine is an antidepressant. Taking desvenlafaxine together with iohexol can cause serious harm or death. This interaction is very likely to occur because desvenlafaxine is eliminated through the kidneys and iohexol may block this process. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking pazopanib together with upadacitinib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking tramadol together with thiethylperazine can be dangerous. It may cause serious side effects such as seizures, hallucinations, and severe mental state changes. The risk of these events is higher when tramadol is taken with thiethylperazine than when tramadol is taken alone.

Major: Elotuzumab and tofacitinib should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction is very likely to occur because there is strong evidence from studies showing that this interaction can happen.

Major: Diltiazem and cobimetinib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as heart problems. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may involve how well these drugs work to block certain proteins in the body.

Major: When ketorolac and prasugrel are taken together, they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because ketorolac can decrease platelet function (platelets are blood cells that help stop bleeding), while prasugrel increases the risk of bleeding by acting on platelets.

Major: Olaparib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It works by preventing cancer cells from dividing and growing. Live vaccines work by giving you a small amount of the virus or bacteria that causes the disease. This stimulates your immune system to fight the infection. If you are taking olaparib and get a live vaccine, your body may not be able to make antibodies properly because olaparib can affect how well your body handles viruses or bacteria. This could decrease the effectiveness of the vaccine.

Major: Vemurafenib is used to treat melanoma skin cancer. Fostemsavir is an antiviral medication used to prevent cytomegalovirus infection in people who have weakened immune systems due to organ transplantation or HIV infection. Taking fostemsavir together with vemurafenib can increase the risk of serious skin reactions such as rash, blisters, or peeling at the treatment site. This interaction should be avoided.
Major: Fluoxetine can increase blood sugar levels. Taking macimorelin with fluoxetine may cause a greater increase in blood sugar levels than taking macimorelin alone.
Major: When propafenone is taken together with lumefantrine, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause a severe reaction when given together with venetoclax. This reaction may be life threatening.

Major: When taking lomefloxacin together with cabozantinib, there is an increased risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture. This is because lomefloxacin can increase the levels of cabozantinib in your body. It is important to note that this interaction has been observed in animal studies but not in humans yet.

Major: The combination of anakinra and talimogene laherparepvec can cause major drug interactions. Anakinra decreases the ability of talimogene laherparepvec to work. This may decrease the effectiveness of talimogene laherparepvec.
Major: When cytarabine and tofacitinib are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as liver damage. This interaction is well known and has been studied in many patients.
Major: When dicoumarol is taken together with nafcillin, it can cause bleeding. This is because dicoumarol increases the effects of nafcillin. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.
Major: Taking ondansetron together with arsenic trioxide can cause serious side effects such as severe allergic reactions. This interaction is major.

Major: Enoxacin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Prednisone is a steroid used to treat inflammation. Taking enoxacin and prednisone together can cause serious side effects such as tendon damage. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times. The mechanism of this interaction is that enoxacin increases levels of prednisone in the body.

Major: Sulfinpyrazone can increase the levels of acalabrutinib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of acalabrutinib such as nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, fatigue, and muscle pain.

Major: Taking moxifloxacin together with enzalutamide can cause serious problems in your heart rhythm. This problem may be more likely to happen when you take these drugs together than when you take them alone.
Major: Amphotericin B can cause serious kidney damage when combined with iohexol. This combination should be avoided unless absolutely necessary.
Major: Lepirudin should not be used together with apixaban because they both affect blood clotting. This can increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: When iohexol and edetate disodium are given together, they can interact in such a way that the effect of one or both drugs may be changed. This interaction is major.
Major: Deflazacort can increase levels of lorlatinib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of lorlatinib.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of neratinib in your body by about two times. This may cause more side effects. Take the drugs at least 3 hours apart to reduce this interaction.

Major: Taking chloroquine together with gatifloxacin can cause serious harm to your heart. This is because chloroquine can increase the levels of gatifloxacin in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking granisetron together with fluoxetine can cause serious side effects. This is because granisetron may increase the levels of fluoxetine in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as seizures, serotonin syndrome, and heart rhythm problems.

Major: Taking chloroquine together with pasireotide can cause serious harm to your heart. This interaction is very likely to happen because both drugs are commonly used and have long been known to interact. The exact way this happens is not clear but may involve the electrical activity of the heart muscle. It is important to avoid taking these two drugs together unless you have discussed this with your doctor first.
Major: This vaccine can cause skin rashes. If you are taking pralatrexate at the same time, this vaccine may increase your risk of skin rash.
Major: When ivosidenib is taken along with lumateperone, there is an increased risk of seizures. This interaction is major.
Major: When you take fenoprofen together with iothalamic acid, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because fenoprofen can increase the effects of iothalamic acid.
Major: Defibrotide can increase antithrombin alfa levels. This may cause bleeding.

Major: Taking furosemide together with etelcalcetide can cause major side effects. Furosemide can reduce the amount of etelcalcetide in your body by increasing how much you pee out of etelcalcetide. This can lead to serious side effects such as muscle weakness, cramps, and seizures.

Major: Fentanyl and idelalisib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as severe drowsiness and breathing problems. This interaction may also affect how well these drugs work.

Major: When bexarotene is taken together with mipomersen, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may happen because bexarotene and mipomersen are processed by the liver enzyme called CYP3A4.

Major: When dinoprostone is used topically on the cervix to induce labor, it can cause severe diarrhea when taken together with misoprostol. This interaction is very well known and has been studied many times.

Major: Clozapine and etoposide should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as neutropenia (low blood cell count) and seizures. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.
Major: Dabrafenib and zanubrutinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This combination has been shown to cause serious skin reactions.

Major: When budesonide is taken together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, taking budesonide together with teriflunomide may increase the risk of liver problems.
Major: When citalopram is taken together with terbutaline, there is an increased risk of side effects such as heart palpitations. This interaction is major.
Major: Boceprevir and edoxaban should not be used together because they both affect the same liver enzyme, which can lead to side effects.

Major: When ritonavir is taken with ivosidenib, it can increase the levels of ivosidenib in your body by about 10 times. This may cause side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, rash, fatigue, and anemia.

Major: Taking nafcillin together with glasdegib can cause major side effects. Nafcillin may increase the levels of glasdegib in your body. This can lead to serious side effects. Be especially careful when taking these drugs together.

Major: When dexamethasone and tofacitinib are taken together, they can increase the risk of infection. This is because dexamethasone can weaken the immune system and tofacitinib can increase the risk of infection.

Major: Levacetylmethadol (LAMA) is a drug used to treat chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It works by relaxing the airways so they become easier to breathe through. Vandetanib is a drug used to treat thyroid cancer. It works by slowing down the growth of thyroid cells. Taking LAMA together with vandetanib may increase the risk of side effects such as dizziness, drowsiness, and constipation.
Major: Flutamide can increase the effects of prilocaine. This may cause prilocaine to work too well. It is important to tell your doctor or pharmacist about all drugs you are taking.

Major: When anistreplase and drotrecogin alfa are given together, they can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because anistreplase and drotrecogin alfa both activate proteins in the blood that control clotting. When these proteins are activated, they can cause the blood to clot. However, when anistreplase and drotrecogin alfa are used together, they may activate these proteins too much, which can lead to excessive clotting and increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: When conivaptan is given together with ibrutinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and dehydration. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Digoxin is used to treat heart failure and certain types of irregular heartbeats. It can be toxic at high levels. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. Taking siponimod together with digoxin may increase the level of digoxin in your body, which could lead to overdose and serious side effects.
Major: Taking disopyramide with polyethylene glycol (PEG) can cause major side effects. PEG can make disopyramide less effective.

Major: Taking procarbazine together with dihydrocodeine can be dangerous. Procarbazine can cause certain types of blood cells to multiply in the wrong way. Dihydrocodeine can affect how well your body removes these extra blood cells from your body. This can increase your risk for bleeding or other problems.
Major: The combination of certolizumab pegol and rubella virus vaccine can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the vaccination may not work properly.
Major: Telaprevir can increase levels of ticagrelor in your body by about two times. This may cause bleeding. Be especially careful when taking telaprevir together with ticagrelor.
Major: Taking almotriptan together with sibutramine can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this happens.

Major: Taking ethinylestradiol together with rifapentine can be dangerous. This is because rifapentine increases the level of ethinylestradiol in your body. This can increase your risk of bleeding and blood clots.

Major: The rubella vaccine can cause a severe reaction when given at the same time as etanercept. This has been seen in some patients who were given both drugs together. It is important to give etanercept at least 7 days before or after the rubella vaccine to avoid this problem.

Major: The radioactive drug iodine-131 (I-131) can be taken up by the thyroid gland and used to treat thyroid cancer. However, if you take the other radioactive drug iodixanol (Iohexol) at the same time, it will also be taken up by the thyroid gland and may interfere with the treatment of thyroid cancer. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: The combination of paliperidone and ozanimod can cause serious side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor has advised you to do so.

Major: Taking atezolizumab together with upadacitinib can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor recommends it to treat a specific condition.

Major: Eliglustat is used to treat Gaucher disease. It should not be taken together with itraconazole because itraconazole can increase the level of eliglustat in your body, which may cause serious side effects.

Major: Ifosfamide is a chemotherapy drug used to treat cancer. Baricitinib is an immunosuppressant drug used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Major: Adalimumab is used to treat autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, Crohn’s disease, and ulcerative colitis. Ozanimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. Major: When cisplatin and iothalamic acid are given together, they can cause serious side effects such as nausea and vomiting. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times.

Major: When simvastatin and dronedarone are taken together, there is an increased risk of muscle problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking ondansetron with macimorelin can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is likely that taking these drugs together causes ondansetron to be broken down more quickly by the body. This may reduce how well ondansetron works.

Major: The combination of lumefantrine and rucaparib can cause major drug interactions. This means that the drugs may affect each other in a way that could be harmful. In particular, rucaparib may increase the levels of lumefantrine in your body. This can lead to an increased risk of side effects from lumefantrine. It is important to talk to your doctor about this potential interaction before taking both drugs together.

Major: When mesoridazine is given together with idarubicin, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: When conivaptan is given together with sirolimus, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs. Major: Eribulin and talimogene laherparepvec should not be used together because they can cause severe reactions.

Major: Saquinavir and elagolix should not be used together because they can increase the risk of liver problems. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: The combination of abarelix and ozanimod can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Major: When alteplase and fondaparinux are given together, they can interact in such a way that alteplase may no longer work properly. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking ofloxacin together with nilotinib can cause serious side effects such as seizures, irregular heartbeat, and heart attack. This interaction may be due to changes in how the body processes these drugs. It is important to follow the prescribing information for both drugs when taking them together.
Major: The combination of basiliximab and talimogene laherparepvec can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the drugs may have an effect on each other that could be harmful.

Major: Digoxin is used to treat heart failure and abnormal heart rhythms. Calcium gluconate is used to treat hypocalcemia (low levels of calcium in the blood) and hyperkalemia (high levels of potassium in the blood). Taking digoxin together with calcium gluconate can increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart such as ventricular tachycardia (fast heart rate). It is important to be aware of this potential interaction when taking these medications together.

Major: Labetalol is used to treat high blood pressure. It can be taken by mouth or as a liquid through the nose. Siponimod is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It is taken by mouth. Taking labetalol and siponimod together may cause a drop in blood pressure. This can be serious. People taking both drugs should talk to their doctor or pharmacist before taking them together.

Major: Bosutinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Letermovir is an antiviral medication used to prevent cytomegalovirus infection in patients who have received an organ transplant. Taking bosutinib together with letermovir can increase the risk of serious side effects. Therefore, taking these two medications together should be avoided unless your doctor has told you to do so.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. If you take siponimod while also taking talimogene laherparepvec, there is a very high chance of developing a skin reaction. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Ibrutinib and encorafenib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Ibrutinib may increase the levels of encorafenib in your body, which could lead to an increased risk of bleeding. Encorafenib may also increase the levels of Ibrutinib in your body, which could lead to an increased risk of bleeding.
Major: The combination of mazindol and procarbazine can cause severe side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless otherwise advised by your doctor.
Major: When simeprevir is taken together with enzalutamide, there is an increased risk of side effects such as rash, itching, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fatigue. This interaction is major.
Major: Dacarbazine can increase the levels of golimumab in your body. This may cause more side effects.
Major: When ergometrine is taken together with ceritinib, ergometrine levels increase in the body. This can lead to serious side effects such as high blood pressure, heart attack, and stroke.
Major: This is a major drug interaction. Taking aminolevulinic acid together with trifarotene can cause serious skin rashes.

Major: The drug mesoridazine can cause drowsiness when taken by itself. However, taking entrectinib together with mesoridazine may increase this drowsiness to a major level. This means that you should be especially careful when driving or operating heavy machinery after taking these two drugs together.

Major: Tirofiban and desirudin should not be used together because they can increase bleeding risk. This is because tirofiban slows down blood clotting while desirudin thins blood. The combination of these effects increases the chance of bleeding.
Major: When leflunomide is taken together with mycophenolate, there is an increased risk of liver damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking amitriptyline together with pasireotide can cause serious side effects such as confusion, hallucinations, seizures, and coma. This interaction is very likely to occur because amitriptyline increases the levels of pasireotide in your body.
Major: When cladribine is taken together with selinexor, there is an increased risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When rifabutin is taken together with ribociclib, it can increase the levels of ribociclib in your body by about 40%. This may cause side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, fatigue, and rash.
Major: The combination of doxorubicin and measles virus vaccine live attenuated should be avoided because there is a high risk of serious harm to the patient.

Major: Brodalumab is used to treat psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis. It should not be given together with measles vaccine because there is a high chance of getting measles from the vaccine. This is because brodalumab lowers the body’s ability to fight off infection.
Major: Taking methylergometrine together with epinephrine can cause severe high blood pressure. This may be dangerous for people who have certain heart problems.
Major: When zonisamide is taken together with mepenzolate, there is an increased risk of side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion. This interaction is major.
Major: Sevelamer can reduce the absorption of erdafitinib. This means that less erdafitinib reaches the body. This may affect how well erdafitinib works.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking lumefantrine together with selpercatinib can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. The combination should be avoided unless the benefits outweigh the risks.
Major: Iloperidone can increase the risk of serious side effects when taken together with primaquine. This interaction is major.
Major: When heparin is given together with ramucirumab, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because heparin can increase the effects of ramucirumab on blood clotting.

Major: Taking mesoridazine together with degarelix can cause serious side effects such as changes in heart rate, blood pressure, and temperature. These effects may be due to an increase in the levels of certain chemicals in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together unless specifically directed by your doctor.
Major: Taking ibritumomab tiuxetan together with cilostazol can cause major side effects. This is because cilostazol increases the amount of ibritumomab tiuxetan in your body.

Major: Arsenic trioxide can cause serious problems when taken together with asenapine. This problem has been reported in patients taking these drugs together. The exact reason for this problem is not clear. It may be due to the way arsenic trioxide and asenapine are broken down in the body.

Major: When vinorelbine is taken together with ketoconazole, the amount of vinorelbine in the blood can go up by more than 50%. This means that vinorelbine may have stronger side effects when taken together with ketoconazole.
Major: The combination of lumateperone and iopamidol can cause major side effects. This interaction may increase the risk of seizures.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Asparaginase can cause severe reactions when given together with talimogene laherparepvec. The combination should be avoided.

Major: Droperidol is an antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders. It should be avoided in patients taking amphotericin B, which is an antifungal medication. This combination can cause serious side effects such as heart rhythm abnormalities. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.
Major: Taking deflazacort together with fosaprepitant can cause serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Rifampicin can make deflazacort less effective. This may be because rifampicin makes deflazacort pass through the body more quickly.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. It is known that if you take talimogene laherparepvec while also taking lutetium Lu 177 dotatate, there is an increased risk of side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.
Major: When sirolimus is taken together with troleandomycin, there is an increased risk of side effects. This is because troleandomycin can increase the level of sirolimus in your body.
Major: The combination of ixekizumab and baricitinib can cause serious side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor specifically recommends it.

Major: The combination of epoprostenol and inotersen can cause major side effects. Epoprostenol can increase the levels of inotersen in your body. This can lead to bleeding, blood clots, and other serious side effects.
Major: When ruxolitinib is taken together with tositumomab, there is an increased risk of severe skin reactions. This interaction is major.
Major: Fluvoxamine is an antidepressant. Oxtriphylline is used to treat asthma. Taking fluvoxamine with oxtriphylline can cause serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: When cladribine and fludarabine are taken together, they can cause severe side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells to fight infection.

Major: When nilutamide is taken together with procainamide, there is an increased risk of procainamide toxicity. This is because nilutamide can inhibit the breakdown of procainamide by the liver. The result is that more procainamide stays in the body for longer periods of time.
Major: When carbamazepine is taken together with abiraterone, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.
Major: When primidone is taken together with copanlisib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking etodolac together with cabozantinib can cause major side effects. Etodolac may increase the levels of cabozantinib in your body, which could lead to serious side effects.

Major: Toremifene is used to treat breast cancer. It works by blocking the effects of estrogen on breast tissue. Delavirdine is an antiviral drug used to treat HIV infection. Taking delavirdine together with toremifene can decrease how well toremifene works. This may reduce the effectiveness of treatment for breast cancer.
Major: Taking quinine together with sotalol can cause serious changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This may lead to fainting, dizziness, or even death.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with ramucirumab, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by a change in how the body handles one or both drugs. It is important to follow the prescribing information for both drugs when taking them together.

Major: Osimertinib is used to treat lung cancer. It works by blocking a protein called EGFR. Rucaparib is used to treat certain types of ovarian cancer. It works by blocking PARP1 and PARP2 proteins. When these drugs are taken together, they can increase the risk of serious side effects because osimertinib may increase the levels of PARP1 and PARP2 proteins. This interaction is very well known and has been studied in detail.
Major: Taking dihydroergotamine and isometheptene together can cause severe headaches, nausea, vomiting, and other symptoms. This interaction is well known to occur.
Major: When certolizumab pegol and satralizumab are given together, they may increase each other’s effects on the immune system. This can cause more side effects than expected from either drug alone.
Major: Taking oxaliplatin together with hydroxychloroquine can cause severe nerve damage. This effect has been observed in patients taking these drugs together.

Major: Idelalisib and baricitinib should not be used together because they can cause severe side effects. Idelalisib decreases the activity of an enzyme called CYP3A4, which metabolizes baricitinib. This causes baricitinib levels to increase in the blood, leading to increased side effects.
Major: When potassium chloride is used together with orphenadrine, there is an increased risk of serious side effects on the heart. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking tramadol together with bupropion can cause seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: When cinoxacin is taken together with deflazacort, there is an increased risk of toxicity. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause more side effects than when they are used alone. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: When vasopressin is used together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of vasospasm. This means that the blood vessels constrict more than they would when vasopressin was used alone. Vasospasm can cause serious problems such as stroke or heart attack.

Major: When citalopram is taken together with rucaparib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because rucaparib can increase the effects of citalopram on blood clotting. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking rucaparib together with citalopram.

Major: Defibrotide can increase the risk of bleeding when used together with ticagrelor. This is because defibrotide may decrease platelet activity, while ticagrelor is a blood thinner that works by preventing platelets from sticking together to form clots. The combination of these effects can lead to an increased risk of bleeding. It is important for patients taking both drugs to be aware of this potential interaction and take appropriate precautions to prevent bleeding.

Major: Fludarabine can cause major problems when taken together with siponimod. This problem may occur because fludarabine increases the levels of siponimod in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.

Major: Taking prasugrel while taking defibrotide can be dangerous. Prasugrel lowers platelets, which can increase bleeding risk. Defibrotide increases platelet levels, which can counteract this effect of prasugrel. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor specifically advises you to take them together.
Major: The bosutinib and typhoid vaccine (live) interaction is major. Bosutinib decreases how much of the typhoid vaccine enters the body. This may decrease how well the vaccine works.

Major: When taking both trospium and potassium citrate together, there is an increased risk of side effects such as dizziness, lightheadedness, and headache. This interaction may be due to the fact that potassium citrate can increase the levels of trospium in your body.
Major: When cladribine and teniposide are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as bone marrow suppression. This means that your body makes too few blood cells to fight infection.

Major: When ticagrelor is taken together with ibrutinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because ticagrelor can increase the effects of ibrutinib on blood clotting. It is important to follow your doctor’s advice about taking these medications together.
Major: The drugs delavirdine and entrectinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Sonidegib is used to treat cancer of the skin called basal cell carcinoma. Fosaprepitant is used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy. Taking fosaprepitant together with sonidegib may increase the risk of side effects such as muscle weakness, muscle pain, and muscle damage. These effects can be severe and life threatening. This interaction is very likely to occur because the two drugs are metabolized by the same enzyme in the body. Therefore, avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you to do
Major: The combination of vinorelbine and measles virus vaccine live attenuated should be avoided because there is a high risk of serious harm to patients.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with granisetron, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, taking granisetron together with anagrelide may increase the risk of bleeding.
Major: When temsirolimus is taken together with lonafarnib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking moxifloxacin together with midostaurin can cause serious side effects such as seizures, heart rhythm problems, and QT interval prolongation. This interaction is major because it involves a change in the way the drugs work together.

Major: Taking ondansetron together with nilotinib can cause major side effects. This is because ondansetron can increase the levels of nilotinib in your body. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects from nilotinib.
Major: Etanercept can increase the risk of side effects when given together with paclitaxel. This interaction is major because it can be life threatening.

Major: Taking insulin human together with levofloxacin can cause major side effects. The body breaks down insulin human into smaller pieces called metabolites. These metabolites help insulin work better. However, levofloxacin may speed up the breakdown of some insulin human metabolites. This can make insulin less effective.

Major: Toremifene can increase levels of valbenazine in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of valbenazine such as involuntary movements. Be aware of this when taking these drugs together.
Major: When mesoridazine is given together with iopamidol, there is a major increase in the level of iopamidol in the bloodstream. This can lead to an increased risk of kidney damage.

Major: Sevoflurane is a medicine used to help people relax before surgery. Siponimod is a medicine used to treat multiple sclerosis. When these medicines are taken together, they can cause serious problems in the heart. This problem has been seen in studies done in the lab and in patients. The way these drugs work in the body may be different when given together than when given alone. For this reason, the two drugs should not be taken together.

Major: Taking diethylpropion together with vortioxetine can cause serious harm. Diethylpropion is a stimulant drug used to treat obesity and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Vortioxetine is an antidepressant. The two drugs together may increase serotonin levels too much, causing a dangerous condition called serotonin syndrome. This can result in confusion, restlessness, muscle tremors, seizures, and other problems.
Major: Taking guanfacine together with idelalisib can cause serious side effects. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor has told you to take them together.
Major: Amiodarone can increase the levels of clarithromycin in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects from clarithromycin.
Major: When dextropropoxyphene is taken together with macimorelin, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: Imipramine can increase the side effects of epinephrine. This is because imipramine slows down the way the body breaks down epinephrine. The result is higher levels of epinephrine in the bloodstream.

Major: Taking boceprevir together with triamcinolone can cause major side effects. Boceprevir increases the levels of triamcinolone in your body by about 10 times. This can lead to serious side effects such as Cushing’s syndrome.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction between two drugs used to treat different diseases. One drug is used for cystic fibrosis and the other for a type of cancer called cholangiocarcinoma. The combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects such as liver damage. Therefore, patients should avoid taking both drugs together.

Major: Natalizumab and baricitinib should not be used together because they can cause serious problems such as inflammation of blood vessels. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the immune system.
Major: Tacrolimus and plazomicin should not be used together because they can increase the risk of kidney injury. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: When triamcinolone is taken together with amprenavir, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking methotrexate and amoxicillin together can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, and rash. This interaction may be more likely to occur when taking high doses of amoxicillin.

Major: The rubella virus vaccine can cause a decrease in blood platelets. If you take palbociclib while receiving this vaccine, your risk of bleeding may increase because of the decreased number of blood platelets.

Major: Irinotecan and thalidomide should not be used together because they can cause severe side effects. Irinotecan can increase the levels of thalidomide in your body, which can lead to serious complications.

Major: When procainamide is given together with romidepsin, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body.
Major: Mazindol can cause serious harm when taken together with phenelzine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking dimercaprol while taking ferumoxsil can cause severe reactions. Dimercaprol may be removed from the body by the liver, but ferumoxsil can block this process. This can cause dimercaprol to build up in the body to dangerous levels.
Major: Arsenic trioxide can cause serious problems when taken together with amisulpride. This problem has been reported in patients taking these drugs together.

Major: Amisulpride and ribociclib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. The risk of this problem is high. If you take amisulpride and ribociclib together, your heart may beat abnormally. This problem has been seen in studies.

Major: When indomethacin is taken along with fondaparinux, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because indomethacin can increase the effects of fondaparinux, which increases the body’s sensitivity to blood clotting.
Major: Mifepristone can increase the levels of halofantrine in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects such as headache, dizziness, and abnormal heartbeats.

Major: When dextropropoxyphene is taken together with methdilazine, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as drowsiness, confusion, and seizures. This interaction is moderate to major.
Major: When budesonide is used together with certolizumab pegol, there is an increased risk of serious infections in the respiratory tract. This interaction is major.
Major: Interferon alfacon-1 can cause serious problems when given together with iopamidol. This combination should be avoided.
Major: When carfilzomib is given together with pexidartinib, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as bleeding and blood clotting problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Imatinib should be used with caution when taking lomitapide. This combination can cause serious side effects such as liver damage. The risk of these side effects may outweigh the benefits of treating the disease. Therefore, before starting imatinib treatment, talk to your doctor about whether you are also taking lomitapide.

Major: The measles vaccine can make your body produce substances called cytokines. These cytokines can cause inflammation throughout your body. This inflammation can be dangerous when you get the measles vaccine at the same time as a medicine called durvalumab.

Major: Taking teniposide while being vaccinated for typhoid can cause severe reactions such as fever, rash, and swelling of the lymph nodes. This is because teniposide weakens the immune system. It is recommended to stop taking teniposide at least one week before and after receiving the vaccine.

Major: The yellow fever vaccine can increase the risk of side effects from docetaxel, an anticancer medication. This interaction is major. It is best to receive the vaccine at least 14 days before starting treatment with docetaxel.
Major: When clotrimazole is taken together with lomitapide, there is an increased risk of liver problems. This interaction is major.
Major: When cladribine is taken together with dimethyl fumarate, there is an increased risk of serious liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Aminophylline is used to treat breathing problems such as asthma attacks. Iopamidol is used for CT scans to help prevent kidney damage. Taking aminophylline and iopamidol together can cause serious side effects on your heart rate and blood pressure.

Major: Ondansetron can increase the levels of desipramine in your body by about 50%. This may cause increased side effects such as drowsiness, dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, and urinary retention. Be especially careful when taking ondansetron together with desipramine if you are elderly, if you have glaucoma, if you have an enlarged prostate, or if you have bladder problems.
Major: Cisapride should be avoided in patients taking gatifloxacin because of a major drug interaction. This interaction may cause serious heart rhythm problems.

Major: The vincristine liposome vaccine interacts with rubella vaccine. This interaction is major. It means that the rubella vaccine may not work properly when given at the same time as vincristine liposome.
Major: This combination of drugs should be avoided because there is a high risk of severe liver damage.
Major: Ranolazine and ribociclib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. The mechanism of this interaction is well established.

Major: Taking infliximab together with duvelisib can cause major side effects. This is because duvelisib increases the level of infliximab in your body. This may increase your risk for certain types of cancer, lymphoma, or other types of infection.

Major: Taking pentamidine with macimorelin can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: When dextran is given together with zanubrutinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because dextran can increase the effects of zanubrutinib on blood clotting.
Major: Taking baricitinib together with atezolizumab can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor tells you to take them together.

Major: When donepezil is taken together with bupropion, there is an increased chance of having side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and loss of appetite. This interaction is major.

Major: When human immunoglobulin G (IgG) is given together with streptomycin, there is a major drug–drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. IgG can bind to streptomycin and form a complex. This complex may not be able to do its job properly. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.

Major: The combination of ivabradine and apalutamide can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because ivabradine slows down the heart rate and apalutamide increases the risk of QT prolongation. Patients should be closely monitored for this potential interaction.

Major: This study found that taking siponimod together with trastuzumab deruxtecan may increase the risk of serious side effects on the heart. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may be due to the way these drugs affect the heart. It is important to note that this interaction was only observed in mice and has not been confirmed in humans yet. However, given the potential risks, people should be careful when taking these two drugs together.

Major: When naltrexone is given together with remifentanil, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by the fact that remifentanil can increase the levels of naltrexone in the body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this potential interaction before you take both drugs together.
Major: Toremifene and idarubicin should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This has been observed in patients taking both drugs together.

Major: The combination of asparaginase and cladribine can cause major drug–drug interactions. Asparaginase can increase the level of cladribine in your body by about 10 times. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects such as bone marrow suppression, pancreatitis, liver damage, and other serious adverse events.

Major: The combination of piroxicam and ioversol can cause major problems. Piroxicam is a pain reliever and ioversol is an iodinated contrast medium used for X-ray examinations. When these two drugs are combined, they may cause kidney damage.

Major: Taking baricitinib together with deflazacort can cause major side effects. This is because baricitinib increases blood levels of deflazacort. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: Clofarabine should not be given together with iohexol because this can cause major side effects. This is because clofarabine may increase the levels of iohexol in your body.

Major: Prasugrel is a blood thinner used to prevent heart attacks and strokes after a recent heart attack or stroke. Edoxaban is also a blood thinner used to treat atrial fibrillation. Taking prasugrel and edoxaban together can cause bleeding because they both increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: When baricitinib is used together with bleomycin, there is an increased risk of lung damage. This is because baricitinib can increase the levels of bleomycin in the body. It is important to monitor patients for signs of lung damage when these drugs are used together.

Major: When vincristine is taken together with lomitapide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, vincristine may not work as well to treat cancer.

Major: The drug sirolimus can cause major problems when taken together with iodine-131 (a radioactive form of iodine used for imaging thyroid cancer). This problem may be caused by the fact that sirolimus is broken down by an enzyme in the liver called CYP3A5. Iodine-131 can block this enzyme, which can lead to higher levels of sirolimus in your body. This can increase your risk of side effects from sirolimus.
Major: Taking hydrochlorothiazide together with dolasetron can cause serious harm to your body. This combination should be avoided.

Drug_B: Mumps virus strain B level jeryl lynn live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: Thalidomide can increase the risk of infection when used together with live vaccines. Live vaccines are made from weakened viruses that cause the disease they protect against. The vaccine for mumps is a live vaccine. If you receive this vaccine while taking thalidomide, your body may have a harder time fighting off the virus in the vaccine. This can lead to more severe side effects from the vaccine.

Major: When triamterene is taken together with potassium acetate, there is an increased risk of hyperkalemia (high blood potassium levels). This can lead to serious side effects such as heart arrhythmias (irregular heartbeat) and even death.

Major: Tositumomab is used to treat certain types of lymphoma. Ponatinib is used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia and other cancers. Taking these drugs together may cause serious side effects such as increased risk of infection. This interaction is well known and has been studied.

Major: Taking phenobarbital with palbociclib can cause major changes in how well palbociclib works and how safe it is. This may increase side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, fatigue, fever, chills, cough, abdominal pain, rash, and mouth sores. It may also decrease how well palbociclib works.

Major: Quinidine is an antiarrhythmic drug used to treat irregular heartbeat. It should not be taken together with gilteritinib, which is used to treat acute myeloid leukemia. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects such as QT prolongation.
Major: When triamcinolone and thalidomide are taken together, they can interact in a way that increases the risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When taking clarithromycin together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective.
Major: When phenytoin is taken together with tacrolimus, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When gemfibrozil is taken together with bexarotene, there is an increased risk of side effects such as skin rash, swelling, and liver problems. This interaction is major.
Major: Cobicistat can increase the levels of lurbinectedin in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of lurbinectedin.

Major: Venlafaxine is an antidepressant. Vemurafenib is used to treat melanoma skin cancer. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may be related to how venlafaxine is broken down by the body. It is important to tell your doctor or pharmacist about all medications you are taking before starting a new medication.

Major: Taking fenfluramine with iopamidol can cause major side effects. Fenfluramine may increase the levels of iopamidol in your body by slowing down its removal from the body. This can lead to serious side effects such as kidney damage.
Major: Taking prasugrel together with dextran can increase the risk of bleeding. This is because dextran may decrease the effects of prasugrel on blood clotting.

Major: When triamcinolone is taken together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the combination can increase the risk of infection. It is recommended to avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you otherwise.
Major: When enalapril is taken together with potassium acetate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Arsenic trioxide and panobinostat should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and dehydration. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs are metabolized by the body.
Major: When certolizumab pegol is given together with siltuximab, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: Leflunomide levels can go up by 50% when taken together with amiodarone. This may increase side effects of leflunomide such as hair loss, liver problems, and diarrhea.
Major: Taking granisetron together with St. John's wort can be dangerous. St. John's wort makes the body break down granisetron faster than normal, which may cause granisetron to work less well.

Major: Nefazodone is an antidepressant. Fostamatinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects such as liver damage. Therefore, nefazodone should be avoided when taking fostamatinib.
Major: When taking vandetanib together with gilteritinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: Gemzar (Gemtuzumab) is used to treat acute myeloid leukemia. Arava (Leflunomide) is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Taking these drugs together may cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and liver damage.

Major: When thioridazine is taken together with orciprenaline, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by the fact that thioridazine slows down the way the body gets rid of orciprenaline. It is not clear how to avoid this interaction.

Major: Codeine should be avoided when taking molindone because it can cause serious side effects such as breathing problems. This is because codeine slows down the brain’s ability to control breathing. Molindone also slows down breathing. When both drugs are taken together, this effect may be increased.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause skin rashes when given together with certain medicines. This vaccine may increase the risk of skin rash when combined with vinorelbine.

Major: Taking triflupromazine with hydrocodone can be dangerous. Triflupromazine slows down the body’s ability to remove hydrocodone from the body. This can cause hydrocodone levels to build up in the bloodstream. This can lead to overdose and serious side effects.

Major: Taking iburtinib with fenoprofen can cause major side effects. Iburtinib decreases the amount of fenoprofen in your body by increasing how fast your body breaks down fenoprofen. This can increase your risk of bleeding.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction between ibritumomab tiuxetan and binimetinib. It means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may be due to the way these drugs are metabolized in the body.
Major: Taking thiethylperazine together with zonisamide can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction is major.

Major: Eszopiclone is used to treat insomnia. It can be taken before bedtime. Ceritinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It should be taken on an empty stomach. Taking eszopiclone together with ceritinib may cause drowsiness. This is because eszopiclone can increase the levels of ceritinib in your body. To avoid this, take ceritinib at least 6 hours after taking eszopiclone.
Major: When phenobarbital is taken together with cobicistat, it can increase the effects of phenobarbital. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: When ritodrine is given together with pasireotide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the combination of ritodrine and pasireotide may cause severe hypokalemia (low levels of potassium in the blood).

Major: Nilotinib is used to treat certain types of leukemia. It works by blocking a protein called Bcr-Abl. Inotuzumab ozogamicin is also used to treat certain types of leukemia. It works by attaching to CD22, which is found on the surface of cancer cells. Taking nilotinib together with inotuzumab ozogamicin can increase the risk of serious side effects because these drugs work in opposite ways.

Major: Efavirenz can increase the levels of sonidegib in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects of sonidegib such as muscle pain, weakness, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, rash, and hair loss.
Major: Taking testosterone together with pazopanib can be dangerous. Testosterone may increase the side effects of pazopanib. It is not clear how this happens.
