Major: When droperidol is given together with amphotericin B, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs.

Major: Grepafloxacin can increase the levels of daunorubicin in your body by about 10 times. This increases the risk of heart failure. Avoid this combination unless your doctor specifically tells you to use them together.

Major: Taking procarbazine together with siponimod can cause major side effects. Procarbazine can make your body produce a substance called interferon. Interferon can affect how your body handles certain medicines. Siponimod may be affected by this. This can increase the chance of side effects.

Major: When idarubicin is taken together with droperidol, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as QT prolongation. This is because droperidol can increase the levels of idarubicin in the body. It is important to follow the prescribing information for both drugs when taking them together.

Major: Taking methysergide together with idelalisib can cause serious harm to your body. This interaction is very likely to occur because methysergide and idelalisib are broken down by the same enzyme in your liver. When you take both drugs together, this enzyme cannot break down either of them properly. The exact mechanism of how this interaction causes harm is not clear.

Major: When ribociclib and oliceridine are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as constipation, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. These side effects may be more severe than when taking either drug alone.

Major: Dasatinib should be used with caution when taking cobicistat. This combination can increase the side effects of dasatinib. It is best to avoid this combination unless your doctor advises you to do so.
Major: When cinoxacin is given together with iohexol, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: When propranolol is taken with theophylline, it can cause severe poisoning due to overstimulation of the heart and central nervous system. This interaction is very well known and should be avoided.

Major: The rubella vaccine can interact with deflazacort, an immunosuppressant medication. This interaction is major. It is recommended to avoid using deflazacort at the same time as the rubella vaccine.

Major: Amphotericin B (lipid complex) and deferasirox should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Amphotericin B (lipid complex) may increase the levels of deferasirox in your body, which could lead to an increased risk of side effects.

Major: Nefazodone can increase levels of Ibrutinib in your body. This may cause serious side effects such as bleeding, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and fatigue. Be especially careful when taking these drugs together.
Major: The combination of ixekizumab and baricitinib can cause serious side effects. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless your doctor specifically tells you to use them together.
Major: Taking metformin together with ioversol can cause severe hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) because of an increase in the effects of both drugs.
Major: When cyproheptadine is taken together with zonisamide, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This interaction is major.

Major: When glyburide and gemifloxacin are taken together, they can cause serious problems such as seizures. This interaction is well known to occur. It is thought that this happens because glyburide increases levels of gemifloxacin in the body.
Major: Dolasetron can increase levels of desvenlafaxine in your body. This may cause increased side effects.
Major: When rilpivirine is taken together with ceritinib, there is an increased risk of side effects. This interaction is major. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Major: When calcifediol and ergocalciferol are taken together, they can increase each other’s levels in the blood. This can lead to high levels of calcium in the blood, which can cause serious health problems such as kidney stones and high blood pressure.

Major: Taking dolutegravir together with magnesium chloride can cause serious side effects such as seizures. This interaction has been observed in patients taking these drugs together. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.

Major: Taking prednisolone together with lomefloxacin can cause serious side effects such as seizures, tremors, and abnormal heart rhythms. This is because prednisolone can increase the level of lomefloxacin in your body.
Major: Cisapride should be avoided in patients taking danazol because of major drug interactions. Cisapride can increase the levels of danazol in the blood, which may lead to serious side effects.
Major: Taking diflunisal while taking tositumomab can cause major side effects. Diflunisal may increase the risk of bleeding when taken together with tositumomab.
Major: When dextropropoxyphene is taken together with opium, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as respiratory depression, sedation, and coma. This interaction is major.
Major: Taking pentamidine with tacrolimus can cause major side effects. This interaction may be due to an increase in the level of tacrolimus in your body.

Major: Taking miconazole with tolazamide can cause major side effects. Miconazole slows down the breakdown of tolazamide by the liver, which leads to too much tolazamide in your body. This can cause serious side effects such as low blood sugar levels.

Major: Taking deferiprone with iodine-131 (I-131) can cause major side effects. I-131 is used to treat thyroid cancer. It works by destroying thyroid cells. Deferiprone is used to treat iron overload conditions such as thalassemia. It binds to iron and removes it from the body. If you take deferiprone with I-131, it may reduce the effectiveness of I-131. This is because deferiprone can interfere

Major: Magnesium sulfate is used to treat and prevent seizures, eclampsia, and migraines. It can also be used as a laxative. Erdafitinib is used to treat bladder cancer. Taking magnesium sulfate while taking erdafitinib may increase the risk of serious side effects.
Major: When vinblastine is taken together with golimumab, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction is major.
Major: When rilonacept is taken together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Ibutilide is used to treat arrhythmia. It works by blocking certain channels in the heart. Picosulfuric acid is an over-the-counter supplement used for treating urinary tract infection. Taking ibutilide together with picosulfuric acid can increase the risk of serious side effects such as ventricular tachycardia. This is because picosulfuric acid can block those channels that ibutilide acts on. Therefore, taking picosulfuric acid together with ibutilide should be avoided.

Major: Taking abarelix together with vandetanib can cause major side effects. This is because abarelix can increase the levels of vandetanib in your body. This may lead to too much vandetanib in your body.

Major: Risankizumab (Risankiz) is a new drug for treating psoriasis. It works by blocking a protein called IL-17A. Infliximab (Infliximab) is another drug used to treat autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis and Crohn’s disease. Both drugs work on the same target, so they cannot be taken together. This can cause serious side effects.

Major: When isoprenaline is taken together with halofantrine, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.
Major: The radioactive drugs samarium (153Sm) lexidronam and lutetium (177Lu) dotatate should not be used together because they can damage cells and tissues.
Major: Rifampicin can reduce the effectiveness of larotrectinib. This is because rifampicin increases the breakdown of larotrectinib by the body.
Major: When tamoxifen is taken together with saquinavir, tamoxifen levels in the blood can go up. This may increase the risk of side effects of tamoxifen.

Major: The combination of bleomycin and samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the combination can lead to serious side effects or health problems. It is important for patients to talk to their healthcare provider about whether they should use these drugs together.
Major: When haloperidol is given together with oxaliplatin, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as seizures. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Taking insulin human together with enoxacin can cause major drug–drug interactions. This means that the combination of these drugs may have side effects that are worse than taking either drug alone.

Major: When gemifloxacin is taken along with warfarin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because gemifloxacin can increase the effects of warfarin. It is important to monitor patients closely for signs of bleeding when these two drugs are used together.

Major: Dofetilide is used to treat an irregular heartbeat called arrhythmia. Vandetanib is used to treat thyroid cancer. Taking these drugs together may cause serious changes in your heart rate. This interaction is very well known and has been studied many times.

Major: Taking decitabine together with infliximab can cause major side effects. Decitabine increases the levels of infliximab in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as severe infection.

Major: Mercaptopurine is used to treat leukemia. It works by blocking the growth of cancer cells. Teriflunomide is used to treat multiple sclerosis. It works by slowing down the immune system. Taking mercaptopurine together with teriflunomide can increase the risk of serious side effects such as pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas) and liver damage. This interaction is major.
Major: When bethanechol is taken along with bupropion, there is an increased chance of having a heart attack or stroke. This interaction is major.

Major: Lorlatinib is used to treat cancer. It works by blocking a protein called ALK. Benzhydrocodone is an opioid pain reliever. When these drugs are taken together, they can increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, dizziness, lightheadedness, and sleepiness. This interaction is major because lorlatinib blocks ALK, which may also be involved in controlling pain. Therefore, taking benzhydrocodone with lorlatinib could make the body feel more pain.

Major: Codeine can cause severe drowsiness when taken together with phenelzine. This is because codeine is broken down into active ingredients by an enzyme called monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI), which is blocked by phenelzine. This leads to higher levels of codeine in the body than expected, causing increased drowsiness.

Major: Levacetylmethadol is a painkiller used to treat severe pain. It works by blocking nociceptive signals from reaching the brain. Glasdegib is an anticancer agent used to treat acute myeloid leukemia. It works by inhibiting cell division. Taking levacetylmethadol together with glasdegib can increase the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and constipation.

Major: Warfarin is used to treat blood clots. It works by preventing the formation of new blood clots. Caplacizumab is used to treat autoimmune hemolytic stomatitis. It works by blocking an antibody that causes this condition. Taking warfarin and caplacizumab together may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because warfarin prevents the formation of new blood clots, while caplacizumab blocks an antibody that causes bleeding. The combination of these effects may cause excessive bleeding.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with lisdexamfetamine, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles anagrelide or lisdexamfetamine. It is important to talk to your doctor or pharmacist before taking anagrelide with lisdexamfetamine.

Major: Taking hydrocodone together with isavuconazonium can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, impaired coordination, and difficulty concentrating. These effects may be more pronounced when hydrocodone is taken at the same time as isavuconazonium than when it is taken alone. It is important to follow the instructions on the label of both drugs carefully and avoid driving or operating heavy machinery while taking them together.
Major: Taking deferiprone together with nilotinib can cause major side effects. It is not clear how this interaction works.

Major: Dofetilide is used to treat an irregular heartbeat called arrhythmia. It works by blocking certain electrical signals in your heart. Entrectinib is used to treat certain types of cancer. It blocks proteins in cells called tropomyosin receptor kinases. Taking dofetilide together with entrectinib can increase the risk of serious side effects on your heart. This is because entrectinib can increase levels of dofetilide in your body. Therefore, you should not take these two drugs together.

Major: The drugs sunitinib and pasireotide should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Sunitinib can increase levels of certain chemicals in your body, which can be life threatening when combined with pasireotide.

Major: When warfarin is taken together with edoxaban, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because warfarin already increases the risk of bleeding, and edoxaban also increases the risk of bleeding.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking antithymocyte immunoglobulin (ATG) together with fingolimod can cause serious side effects. ATG can increase the levels of fingolimod in your body by about 10 times. This may lead to bradycardia (slow heart rate), hypotension (low blood pressure), and other cardiovascular events.

Major: When ticlopidine is taken together with clozapine, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because ticlopidine increases the levels of clozapine in the blood. It is important to monitor patients for signs of bleeding when these two drugs are used together.

Major: Valdecoxib is a pain reliever used to treat arthritis. It can be taken by mouth. Iohexol is an iodinated contrast agent used for X-ray examinations of the digestive tract. If these drugs are taken together, they may increase the risk of kidney damage. This interaction is major.

Major: Enzalutamide can increase levels of prostate-specific antigen (PSA) when taken together with ozanimod. This may lead to false results from PSA tests. It is not clear whether this interaction will affect treatment decisions.

Major: Taking pimozide together with nilotinib can cause major side effects. Pimozide may increase levels of nilotinib in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as liver problems, dizziness, drowsiness, and seizures.

Major: When ziprasidone is taken together with primaquine, there is an increased risk of developing a serious condition called hemolytic anemia. This is because primaquine can increase the levels of ziprasidone in the blood. Hemolytic anemia is a condition where red blood cells break down more quickly than they are made. It can cause symptoms such as fatigue, weakness, pale skin, and shortness of breath. If you are taking these two drugs together, talk to your doctor or pharmacist about whether you should be concerned about this potential

Major: Taking indinavir together with bosutinib can cause major side effects. This is because indinavir increases the level of bosutinib in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor tells you to do so.

Major: Telithromycin and osimertinib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of side effects. This is because telithromycin can raise the level of osimertinib in your body. It is best to avoid this combination.

Major: Defibrotide can cause major drug interactions when taken together with zanubrutinib. This is because defibrotide may increase the levels of zanubrutinib in your body, which could lead to side effects. It is important to talk to your doctor about this potential drug interaction before taking these medications together.

Major: Fludrocortisone is a steroid hormone used to treat Addison’s disease. It can be taken by mouth or as an injection. Talimogene laherparepvec is a genetically modified virus used to treat melanoma. This drug is injected into tumors. Taking fludrocortisone at the same time as talimogene laherparepvec may increase the risk of infection.

Major: The combination of denileukin diftitox and rotavirus vaccine can cause severe reactions such as fever, rash, vomiting, diarrhea, and other symptoms. This interaction has been reported in patients who received both drugs together. It is recommended to separate the administration of these two drugs by at least one week.

Major: When taking ofloxacin together with repaglinide, there is an increased risk of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar). This is because of the way these drugs are metabolized (processed) by the body. The mechanism is well established.
Major: Enzalutamide can increase blood pressure. Taking enzalutamide with macitentan may cause dangerously low blood pressure. This interaction is major.

Major: Dabrafenib and pemigatinib should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction is very likely to occur because dabrafenib and pemigatinib both affect the same pathway in the body.

Major: When you take both edoxaban and desirudin together, they can interact with each other in an unpredictable way. This may increase your risk of bleeding. Therefore, it is best to avoid taking these drugs together.
Major: When anagrelide is taken together with voriconazole, there is a high risk of bleeding. This is because anagrelide lowers platelet levels and voriconazole increases bleeding.
Major: The smallpox vaccine can cause skin rashes when given together with dacarbazine. This combination should be avoided.
Major: Indinavir can increase the levels of naloxegol in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as diarrhea, abdominal pain, and bloating.

Major: The combination of halofantrine and cabozantinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. It is not clear exactly how this interaction happens.

Major: Enzalutamide can increase the levels of eravacycline in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects of eravacycline such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, headache, dizziness, lightheadedness, fatigue, and insomnia.
Major: The combination of sulindac and ioxilan can cause severe stomach pain. This may be due to the fact that sulindac increases the level of ioxilan in the blood.

Major: Clozapine and nelarabine should not be used together because they can cause a severe reaction in your body. This reaction may include seizures, coma, or death. It is not clear how this interaction works.

Major: Taking ergotamine together with ceritinib can cause major side effects. This is because ergotamine slows down the heart rate, while ceritinib speeds up the heart rate. This combination should be avoided unless your doctor specifically tells you to take them together.

Major: Taking chlorpropamide together with trovafloxacin can cause serious harm to your body. This is because chlorpropamide may increase the level of trovafloxacin in your blood. However, this interaction has not been well studied.
Major: The combination of denileukin diftitox and cladribine can cause severe changes in blood cell counts. This may increase the risk of infection or bleeding.
Major: Naloxegol and apalutamide should not be used together because naloxegol can reduce the effects of apalutamide. This is a major drug–drug interaction.

Major: Tamoxifen is used to treat breast cancer. It works by blocking the effects of estrogen, a hormone that promotes cancer growth. Carfilzomib is used to treat certain types of blood cancers. It works by stopping the growth of cancer cells. Taking tamoxifen together with carfilzomib may increase the risk of heart problems. This is because tamoxifen slows down the beating of the heart, while carfilzomib speeds it up. The combination of these two drugs should be avoided unless there is no other way to treat your

Major: The combination of maprotiline and cabozantinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects. It is not clear how this interaction happens.

Major: When taking both drugs together, there may be a risk of side effects such as diarrhea, vomiting, nausea, abdominal pain, and fever. This interaction may occur because clarithromycin can increase the level of copanlisib in your body.

Major: When ritonavir is given together with temsirolimus, it can increase the risk of side effects. This is because ritonavir can increase the level of temsirolimus in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether this combination is safe for you.
Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction. Taking asparaginase together with certolizumab can increase the risk of side effects. Asparaginase can reduce the levels of certolizumab in your body.

Major: Arsenic trioxide can increase the levels of amphotericin B in your body by about 10 times. This may cause serious side effects such as kidney damage, liver damage, changes in heart rate, and changes in blood pressure.

Major: Adalimumab is used to treat autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, Crohn’s disease, and ulcerative colitis. It can be given by injection under the skin or by infusion into a vein. Melphalan is used to treat multiple myeloma, a type of blood cancer. It is usually given by infusion into a vein. Taking melphalan together with adalimumab may increase the risk of serious side effects on the immune system. This interaction has been observed

Major: The varicella zoster vaccine (VZV) is used to prevent chickenpox infection in children and shingles (a painful rash caused by reactivation of the chickenpox virus) in adults. Gemcitabine is a chemotherapy drug used to treat various types of cancer. When these drugs are given together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that combining gemcitabine with the varicella zoster vaccine can decrease the effectiveness of the vaccine and may result in an increased risk of complications from chickenpox or shingles.

Major: The combination of vincristine liposome and tofacitinib should be avoided because there is a major drug interaction between them. This means that the drugs have an important effect on each other’s levels in the body. In this case, tofacitinib increases the level of vincristine liposome in the blood. This can increase the side effects of vincristine liposome.

Major: Taking trovafloxacin together with hydrocortisone can cause serious harm to your heart. This is because trovafloxacin increases the levels of hydrocortisone in your body. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together unless your doctor has told you to do so.

Major: When amitriptyline is taken together with anagrelide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles amitriptyline. It is recommended to avoid this combination unless specifically advised by a healthcare professional.
Major: Taking tenecteplase together with edoxaban can be dangerous. This is because taking them together may increase the risk of bleeding.

Major: Morphine and pimavanserin should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness and confusion. This interaction may occur because morphine slows down the body’s ability to remove pimavanserin from the body.

Major: Taking trastuzumab together with infliximab can cause major side effects. This is because infliximab may reduce the ability of the body to remove trastuzumab from the bloodstream. This can lead to an increased risk of heart problems.

Major: When dextromethorphan and escitalopram are taken together, they can increase each other’s effects. This may cause some people to feel worse than expected. It is important for patients to talk to their healthcare provider about this potential interaction before taking these medications together.

Major: Eptifibatide and anagrelide should not be used together because they can cause bleeding. This is because eptifibatide and anagrelide both increase blood flow by preventing platelets from sticking together. When these drugs are used together, they may cause too much bleeding.
Major: The combination of ibritumomab tiuxetan and tirofiban can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided unless otherwise recommended by your doctor.
Major: Nelfinavir can increase the levels of elagolix in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, headache, and hot flashes.

Drug_B: Bacillus calmette-guerin substrain tice live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: When dexamethasone is given together with BCG vaccine, there is a high risk of developing a serious infection. This interaction is very likely to occur because dexamethasone can weaken the immune system’s ability to fight off infections.
Major: Tofacitinib and tucatinib should not be used together because they can increase each other’s side effects. This is a major drug–drug interaction.
Major: Taking sufentanil together with procarbazine can cause severe drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and problems with coordination. This interaction should be avoided.

Major: Mitotane can increase levels of tacrolimus in your body. This may cause side effects such as high blood pressure, swelling, tremors, pain, and possibly kidney damage. Be alert for these symptoms. Consult your doctor or pharmacist if you have questions.

Major: Dabrafenib and siponimod should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Dabrafenib increases blood pressure while siponimod lowers blood pressure. The combination of these drugs may lead to dangerously low blood pressure.

Major: Taking darunavir together with naloxegol can cause major side effects. This is because darunavir may increase levels of naloxegol in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these drugs together.

Major: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Dexamethasone is a steroid used to reduce inflammation. Taking ciprofloxacin and dexamethasone together can cause serious side effects such as seizures.

Major: Atazanavir is used to treat HIV infection. It works by blocking an enzyme called CYP3A4. Vorapaxar is used to reduce the risk of heart disease in people with coronary artery disease. It works by blocking platelet aggregation. When these drugs are taken together, they can increase the risk of side effects because atazanavir blocks CYP3A4, which processes vorapaxar. This interaction is major.

Major: When sunitinib and avapritinib are taken together, they can interact in a way that makes avapritinib less effective. This means that avapritinib may not work as well to treat certain types of cancer. It is important for patients taking these drugs together to talk to their healthcare provider about whether this interaction might affect their treatment.

Major: Taking phentermine with tramadol can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, anxiety, hallucinations, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, and abnormal behavior. These effects may be due to the fact that tramadol increases phentermine levels in the body.

Major: Axitinib is used to treat kidney cancer. Cobicistat is used to increase the effects of other drugs. When these two drugs are taken together, they can have severe side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and loss of appetite. These side effects may be more likely to occur when taking cobicistat alone. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid taking axitinib and cobicistat together.
Major: Taking pazopanib together with sacituzumab govitecan can cause major side effects. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking paclitaxel together with upadacitinib can cause major side effects. The body breaks down paclitaxel into smaller molecules called metabolites. Upadacitinib may increase how quickly the body breaks down paclitaxel into these metabolites. This can reduce the amount of paclitaxel in your body and decrease its ability to work as well.
Major: Taking celecoxib with lithium can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is important to tell your doctor about all medications you take.

Major: Natalizumab and mogamulizumab are both drugs used to treat autoimmune diseases. They are both given by injection under the skin. When these two drugs are taken together, they can cause serious side effects such as nerve problems. These nerve problems can be life threatening. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid taking natalizumab and mogamulizumab together.

Major: When taking both drugs together, there is a major drug–drug interaction. This means that the combination of these two drugs can cause serious side effects. In this case, the combination of panobinostat and ibrutinib can lead to severe diarrhea. It is important for patients to talk to their healthcare provider about potential risks before starting treatment with these drugs.

Major: Erythropoietin is used to treat anemia caused by chemotherapy. Pomalidomide is used to treat multiple myeloma. Taking these drugs together can cause a severe drop in white blood cells. This can increase the risk of infection.
Major: When drotrecogin alfa is given together with nintedanib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because drotrecogin alfa increases the effects of nintedanib on blood clotting.
Major: Taking pantoprazole with velpatasvir can cause major drug interactions. This means that the drugs may work together in ways that are not expected and can be harmful.

Major: Deflazacort can increase the levels of moxifloxacin in your body by about two times. This may lead to an increased risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture. Avoid coadministration of these drugs unless otherwise advised by your doctor.
Major: When fosamprenavir is used together with fluticasone nasal spray, there is an increased risk of severe breathing problems. This interaction is major.

Major: Ifosfamide is used to treat cancer. It works by stopping cells from dividing and making them die. Iopamidol is used as a contrast agent for X-ray and CT scans. If you take iopamidol within 7 days of taking ifosfamide, there is a high risk of kidney damage. This is because both drugs can cause kidney damage on their own, but if taken together, they can cause much more severe kidney damage than when taken alone.
Major: When alimemazine is taken together with ribociclib, it can increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fatigue. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking zinc chloride while taking elvitegravir can decrease how well elvitegravir works. This may increase the amount of HIV in your body. It is important to talk to your health care provider before taking zinc chloride while taking elvitegravir.

Major: Nelfinavir can increase the levels of Ibrutinib in your body by about two times. This may lead to side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, fever, chills, and rash. Be sure to talk to your doctor before taking Nelfinavir with Ibrutinib.
Major: Arsenic trioxide can increase levels of cilostazol in your body. This may cause bleeding problems. If you take both drugs together, talk to your doctor first.

Major: When ibandronate is taken together with iodipamide, there is an increased risk of kidney damage. This is because ibandronate can be removed from the body by the kidneys, but iodipamide can reduce this removal process. The combination of these two drugs should therefore be avoided.

Major: Taking eszopiclone together with clarithromycin can cause major side effects. This is because eszopiclone is broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4, which is also used to break down clarithromycin. When these two drugs are taken together, they compete for this enzyme, leading to increased levels of both drugs in your body. This can cause serious side effects such as confusion, hallucinations, and seizures.
Major: Mercaptopurine and allopurinol should not be used together because they can cause severe liver damage. This interaction is well known and has been studied many times.
Major: When clomipramine is taken together with cabozantinib, there is an increased risk of side effects such as dizziness, drowsiness, and fainting. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking prednisolone at the same time as yellow fever vaccine can cause a severe reaction. This is because prednisolone affects the immune system. The yellow fever vaccine works by stimulating the immune system to produce antibodies against yellow fever. If the immune system is affected by prednisolone, this may reduce the effectiveness of the vaccine.
Major: Taking peginterferon alfa-2a together with ozanimod can cause major side effects. This interaction has been observed in studies. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: The drug tafenoquine can cause serious harm when taken together with typhoid vaccine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: Taking quinine together with adenosine can be dangerous. This is because quinine may increase the levels of adenosine in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as heart problems.

Major: Ruxolitinib is used to treat myelofibrosis and polycythemia vera. It decreases the activity of the immune system by blocking a protein called JAK1. The measles vaccine is a live virus vaccine that works by giving you a mild form of the measles infection so your body can fight it off. If you take ruxolitinib while getting the measles vaccine, your body may have a harder time fighting off the measles infection because ruxolitinib blocks part of your immune system. This can increase your

Major: Rifampicin can reduce the effectiveness of elagolix. This is because rifampicin increases the breakdown of elagolix by the body. As a result, more elagolix may be broken down before it reaches the part of the body where it is needed.
Major: Taking chloroquine together with tizanidine can cause serious harm to your heart. This interaction is very likely because there is strong evidence from studies showing this effect.
Major: The yellow fever vaccine can make your body produce antibodies to proteins on the surface of the virus. These antibodies may attack the obinutuzumab in your blood, which could be harmful.

Major: Amiodarone can increase doxepin levels in your body by about 10 times. This may cause drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, blurred vision, dry mouth, difficulty urinating, constipation, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and other side effects.

Major: When protriptyline is given together with iopamidol, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the drugs are processed in the body.

Major: When fluconazole is taken together with tolbutamide, there is an increased risk of developing serious side effects such as hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) and other complications. This interaction is major.

Major: When ziprasidone is taken together with glasdegib, there is an increased risk of QT prolongation. This means that the electrical activity of the heart is altered, which can lead to potentially dangerous side effects such as arrhythmia.

Major: When alfentanil is taken together with cobicistat, it can increase the effects of alfentanil. This may cause serious side effects such as breathing problems, drowsiness, sedation, and coma. Patients should be closely monitored when taking these drugs together.

Major: The combination of carboplatin and measles virus vaccine live attenuated can cause major drug interactions. Carboplatin decreases the activity of the immune system by interfering with how well the body makes antibodies against viruses such as measles. This may increase the risk of side effects from measles vaccine.

Major: When anagrelide is taken together with trazodone, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. The interaction may be caused by changes in how the body handles the drugs. It is best to avoid taking anagrelide with trazodone.
Major: When taking both drugs together, there is a high risk of bleeding. This is because ponatinib can increase the effects of acalabrutinib on blood clotting.

Major: When rivaroxaban is taken together with antithrombin alfa, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because rivaroxaban blocks antithrombin alfa from doing its job of controlling blood clotting.

Major: Anakinra can increase the risk of serious brain problems when used together with natalizumab. These problems may include seizures, stroke, or other brain problems. This interaction is very rare but can be severe.
Major: When vincristine is taken together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of side effects on the nervous system. This interaction is major.

Major: Mifepristone can increase levels of idelalisib in your body by about 50%. This may increase side effects such as diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath, skin rash, itching, muscle pain, joint pain, bleeding, bruising, weight loss, and hair loss.

Major: When anagrelide is used together with oxaliplatin, there is a high risk of severe bone marrow suppression. This can lead to serious complications such as bleeding or infection. Therefore, this combination should be avoided.

Major: Vemurafenib is used to treat melanoma skin cancer. It works by blocking a protein called BRAF. Pitolisant is used to treat narcolepsy. It works by blocking a protein called orexin receptor. When these drugs are taken together, they can block both proteins, which may increase side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fatigue.

Major: When dexfenfluramine is taken together with lithium carbonate, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as serotonin syndrome. Serotonin syndrome is a potentially life-threatening condition that can cause changes in mental state, muscle control, heart rate, and temperature.
Major: When erdafitinib is taken along with cholecalciferol, there is an increased risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.
Major: When sotalol and indacaterol are taken together, there is an increased risk of serious heart problems. This interaction is major.

Major: The drug perphenazine can cause drowsiness when taken alone. However, taking perphenazine together with cabozantinib may increase this drowsiness to a major level. This means that you should be especially careful when driving or operating machinery after taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking halofantrine together with danazol can cause serious heart problems. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are broken down by an enzyme called CYP2C19. However, this interaction is not well understood.
Major: When vasopressin is given together with cisapride, there is a high risk of serious side effects such as heart attack and stroke. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Major: Irinotecan and upadacitinib should not be used together because they can cause severe diarrhea. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but may involve the way these drugs affect the gut.
Major: The combination of pancuronium and paromomycin can cause severe changes in heart rate. This may lead to serious side effects.

Major: When gatifloxacin and iopamidol are given together, they can increase the risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture. This is because both drugs can affect the way the body processes certain proteins.
Major: The radioactive drug tositumomab (Tosi131) should not be used together with the chemotherapy drug plicamycin because this combination can cause severe side effects.
Major: The use of piroxicam together with iohexol can cause major problems. Piroxicam may increase the risk of kidney damage caused by iohexol.
Major: The combination of panobinostat and degarelix can cause severe side effects. This interaction may be due to the fact that panobinostat increases the levels of degarelix in the body.

Major: Taking methimazole together with lomitapide can cause severe side effects. This interaction may be due to an increase in the level of a chemical called thyroid hormone. It is important to talk to your doctor about this issue before taking these drugs together.
Major: Taking methotrexate and iohexol together can cause major harm. Methotrexate can make iohexol work much better than it should. This can lead to kidney damage.

Major: When bepridil is taken together with isoprenaline, it can cause serious side effects such as heart problems. The reason for this interaction is that bepridil slows down the way the body gets rid of isoprenaline. This interaction has been observed in studies.

Major: Thioridazine and doxepin can cause serious side effects when used together. Thioridazine may increase the amount of doxepin in your body. This can lead to severe drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and other dangerous effects. Do not use these drugs together unless your doctor tells you to.

Major: Taking vitamin A while taking eravacycline can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take vitamin A while taking eravacycline.
Major: Taking ondansetron together with tryptophan can cause severe drowsiness. This may be due to how these drugs affect the brain. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Major: Delavirdine strongly inhibits the activity of an enzyme called CYP2C19. This can cause major increases in the levels of fostamatinib in the blood. This may increase the risk of side effects.
Major: Efavirenz can increase levels of brigatinib in your body by about two times. This may lead to increased side effects of brigatinib.

Major: When doxepin cream is used together with vilazodone, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This is because vilazodone increases levels of doxepin in the body. It is important to be aware of this increased risk of drowsiness when these two drugs are taken together.

Major: Imatinib and bosutinib are both drugs used to treat cancer. When these two drugs are taken together, they can interact in a way that makes imatinib less effective. This means that the cancer may not respond as well to treatment.

Major: This is a major drug–drug interaction between omacetaxine mepesuccinate and caplacizumab. It can cause severe side effects such as bleeding. The mechanism of this interaction is that both drugs affect platelets. Platelets are blood cells that help stop bleeding when you get injured. Omacetaxine mepesuccinate increases the activity of platelets while caplacizumab decreases their activity. When these two drugs are taken together, they may cancel each other out and lead to excessive bleeding.
Major: When topiramate is taken together with mepyramine, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This combination should be avoided.

Major: The combination of ixekizumab and typhoid vaccine should be avoided because there is a high risk of serious side effects. This is because ixekizumab can weaken the immune system. Therefore, when this medicine is used together with a live vaccine, such as the typhoid vaccine, the vaccine may not work properly.
Major: Taking diatrizoate together with temsirolimus can cause major side effects. Diatrizoate can increase the levels of temsirolimus in your body, which may lead to serious side effects.
Major: Telaprevir can increase levels of ticagrelor in your body by about two times. This may cause bleeding. Be especially careful when taking telaprevir together with ticagrelor.

Major: Encorafenib and ribociclib should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Encorafenib works by blocking a protein called BRAF, which is involved in cell growth. Ribociclib also blocks cell growth but works by blocking another protein called CDK4. When these two drugs are used together, they may work against each other and cause unexpected side effects.

Major: Taking dextroamphetamine and ozanimod together can cause major side effects. Dextroamphetamine increases levels of ozanimod in your body. This can lead to very low blood pressure, heart rate, and breathing. Be especially careful when taking these drugs together.

Major: When amitriptyline is taken together with palonosetron, there is an increased risk of constipation. This interaction is major. The reason for this interaction is that amitriptyline inhibits the activity of CYP2D6, which helps to break down palonosetron.

Major: Epoprostenol is used to treat pulmonary hypertension. It can be taken by mouth or injection under the skin. Tinzaparin is an anticoagulant used to prevent blood clots. It is given by injection under the skin. Taking tinzaparin together with epoprostenol may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because both drugs can lower platelet levels. Platelets are small blood cells that help blood clot. The interaction between these two drugs has been studied in vitro and in animals. However, there have been no

Major: Escitalopram is an antidepressant. Vemurafenib is used to treat melanoma. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects such as QT interval prolongation. This is because escitalopram slows down the heart rate and vemurafenib speeds up the heart rate. Therefore, when taken together, they may lead to irregular heartbeat.
Major: When palbociclib and apalutamide are taken together, they can no longer work properly. This may reduce the effectiveness of these drugs.

Major: When levofloxacin is taken together with repaglinide, there is an increased risk of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar). This is because levofloxacin can increase the effects of repaglinide. It is important to monitor blood sugar levels closely when taking these medications together.

Major: Taking rolapitant together with carbamazepine can cause major side effects. This is because rolapitant may increase the levels of carbamazepine in your body. This can lead to serious side effects such as seizures.
Major: Escitalopram can cause serious problems when taken together with eribulin. This problem may be caused by eribulin decreasing how well escitalopram works.
Major: Morphine (liposomal) can cause drowsiness when taken by mouth. Pimavanserin can also cause drowsiness when taken by mouth. Taking both drugs together may increase the chance of drowsiness.

Major: Taking primidone together with naldemedine can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion. This interaction may be due to an increase in the levels of primidone in the body when taken with naldemedine.

Major: Taking chloramphenicol together with levacetylmethadol can cause major side effects. Chloramphenicol decreases the ability of the body to make red blood cells. Levacetylmethadol increases the ability of the body to make red blood cells. When these drugs are taken together, they may lead to too many or too few red blood cells. This can be dangerous.
Major: When morphine is taken together with chlorzoxazone, the amount of morphine in the blood can go up by more than 50%. This can lead to serious side effects such as overdose and death.

Major: Taking antithymocyte immunoglobulin (ATGI) together with leflunomide can cause major side effects. ATGI may increase the levels of leflunomide in your body by about 10 times. This can lead to severe liver problems.

Major: When teriflunomide is taken together with troleandomycin, there is an increased risk of side effects. This is because troleandomycin can increase the levels of teriflunomide in your body. It is important to talk to your doctor about this before taking these medications together.

Major: When taking ceritinib together with erdafitinib, there is a major drug–drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective.

Major: When betrixaban is given together with dalteparin, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because betrixaban increases the effects of dalteparin. It is important to be aware of this potential for increased bleeding when taking these two drugs together.

Major: Linezolid is an antibiotic used to treat certain bacterial infections. Sibutramine is a weight loss drug. Taking linezolid together with sibutramine can cause serious side effects such as severe mental state changes, seizures, and heart problems. This interaction may be due to linezolid inhibiting the action of an enzyme called monoamine oxidase type B (MAO-B), which normally breaks down certain brain chemicals. Sibutramine also acts on this enzyme. Therefore, taking both drugs together increases the amount

Major: Taking metamfetamine and lorcaserin together can cause serious side effects such as increased risk of heart disease and stroke. This is because metamfetamine increases the levels of lorcaserin in your body.

Major: When fluconazole and erythromycin are taken together, they can increase each other’s side effects. This is because fluconazole can slow down how quickly erythromycin leaves your body. This can cause erythromycin to build up in your body and potentially cause more side effects.

Major: When clozapine is taken together with methimazole, there is an increased risk of agranulocytosis. This is a rare condition where the body loses its ability to fight infection because of a lack of white blood cells.
Major: The yellow fever vaccine can cause liver damage. If you take bleomycin together with the yellow fever vaccine, this may increase the risk of liver damage.

Major: When epirubicin is taken together with quinidine, there is an increased risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and skin rash. This interaction may be due to quinidine increasing the level of epirubicin in the blood.

Major: Dactinomycin and ozanimod should not be used together because they can cause severe effects on the bone marrow. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown but may involve the immune system.
Major: Taking papaverine together with lofexidine can cause severe changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This may lead to serious problems such as heart attack, stroke, or even death.

Major: Taking tacrine together with ozanimod can cause severe liver problems. This interaction is well known to occur. The exact way this happens is not clear but may be due to the way these drugs are metabolized by the body.

Major: Taking insulin human (zinc) together with lomefloxacin can cause major side effects. The body absorbs insulin human (zinc) less well when taken with lomefloxacin, which may lead to too much or too little sugar in the blood.

Major: When clozapine and ondansetron are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism of this interaction is not clear, but it may be related to how well the drugs are eliminated from the body. It is important to talk to your doctor or pharmacist about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: Mitotane can increase deflazacort levels in the blood. This may cause side effects such as weight gain, fluid retention, and high blood pressure.
Major: Terfenadine is an anti-allergy medication. Vemurafenib is a cancer medicine. Taking these drugs together can cause serious side effects.
Major: Rosuvastatin and enasidenib should not be used together because they can increase the risk of serious side effects. This interaction is major.

Major: When clopidogrel is taken together with cabozantinib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because clopidogrel reduces platelet activity while cabozantinib increases platelet activity. The combination of these effects can lead to excessive bleeding.
Major: When ceritinib is taken together with levamlodipine, there is an increased risk of side effects such as low blood pressure. This interaction is major.

Major: The radioactive drug samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause major problems when used together with blinatumomab. This is because samarium (153Sm) lexidronam may be taken up by cells targeted by blinatumomab, which could lead to damage of these cells.

Major: The drugs pasireotide and apalutamide should not be used together because they can cause serious problems in your body. This problem may include changes in how well the drugs work in your body.
Major: Taking maprotiline with procarbazine can cause serious side effects. This interaction is well known to occur. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking abemaciclib while getting a live typhoid vaccine increases your risk of severe diarrhea and life-threatening infections. This is because abemaciclib decreases the body’s ability to fight off infections.

Major: When rifabutin is given together with ivacaftor, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. In this case, the ivacaftor may not work as well to treat cystic fibrosis. The exact reason for this interaction is not clear but may be due to changes in how these drugs are broken down in the body.
Major: Ardeparin can increase the risk of bleeding when used together with vorapaxar. This is because ardeparin can increase the effects of vorapaxar, which also increases the risk of bleeding.

Major: Taking phenylpropanolamine together with methylene blue can cause severe changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This is because phenylpropanolamine blocks the action of a chemical called acetylcholine, which normally slows down heart rate and blood pressure. Methylene blue also blocks the action of acetylcholine, but in the opposite direction—it speeds up heart rate and blood pressure. When these two drugs are taken together, they may cancel each other out and cause a very fast heart rate and blood pressure instead.

Major: Eribulin and ozanimod should not be used together because they can cause serious side effects. Eribulin slows down the movement of cells in the body, while ozanimod speeds up cell movement. When these drugs are used together, they may slow down cells too much or speed them up too much. This can lead to serious side effects.

Interaction_Explanation: Major: Tocilizumab is an immune system suppressing drug used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It can also be used to treat other autoimmune diseases such as juvenile idiopathic arthritis, cytokine release syndrome, and COVID-19. Major: When palonosetron is taken together with siponimod, there is an increased risk of serious side effects such as liver problems. This interaction is major.

Major: The combination of astemizole and nilotinib should be avoided because it can cause serious abnormal heart rhythms. This interaction is well known to occur and has been observed in many patients.

Major: Ritonavir can increase the levels of osilodrostat in your body by about 10 times. This may cause side effects such as high blood pressure, headache, nausea, vomiting, and menstrual irregularities.

Major: Taking midostaurin together with teriflunomide can cause serious side effects. This interaction may be due to an increase in the levels of midostaurin in the body. It is important to talk to your doctor about whether you should take these drugs together.
Major: When warfarin is taken together with sulfinpyrazone, the dose of warfarin should be increased because sulfinpyrazone can make warfarin less effective. This interaction is major.

Major: Taking zinc sulfate while taking elvitegravir can decrease how well elvitegravir works. This may increase the amount of HIV in your body. It is important to talk to your health care provider before taking zinc sulfate while taking elvitegravir.

Major: Taking clomipramine together with phenylephrine can cause serious side effects such as high blood pressure, heart palpitations, and seizures. This interaction is very likely to occur because clomipramine slows down the body’s ability to remove phenylephrine from the body.

Drug_B: Mumps virus strain B level jeryl lynn live antigen
Interaction_Explanation: Major: Gemcitabine is a chemotherapy drug used to treat cancer. It works by interfering with DNA synthesis. The mumps vaccine is a live virus vaccine used to prevent infection of children. This vaccine can cause side effects such as fever, rash, and swelling at the injection site.
Major: Taking atropine while taking potassium citrate can cause severe changes in heart rate and blood pressure. This may increase the risk of serious side effects such as heart attacks and strokes.

Major: When streptomycin is given together with atracurium, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear, but it may be related to how these drugs are metabolized by the liver. It is important to monitor patients closely when giving these two drugs together.
Major: Dolutegravir can increase the levels of magnesium in your blood when taken together. This may cause serious side effects.

Major: Mitotane can increase the levels of levamlodipine in your body. This may cause side effects such as headache, dizziness, flushing, nausea, vomiting, constipation, swelling of hands/feet, and muscle pain. Be alert for these symptoms.
Major: Taking baricitinib together with enfortumab vedotin can cause serious side effects. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When rituximab is used together with teriflunomide, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination of these drugs can cause serious side effects or make the drugs less effective. It is best to avoid taking these drugs together.

Major: Taking theophylline together with mexiletine can cause serious side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and other symptoms of intestinal obstruction. This interaction may be due to the fact that mexiletine inhibits the enzyme responsible for the metabolism of theophylline.

Major: When taking both drugs together, the dose of sotalol may need to be adjusted because it can be affected by theophylline. This is because theophylline increases the amount of sotalol in your body.

Major: The radioactive drug samarium (153Sm) lexidronam can cause serious problems when taken together with the chemotherapy drug romidepsin. This problem has been found in studies of patients taking both drugs together.

Major: Baclofen can increase hydrocodone levels in your body. This can cause serious side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, and problems with coordination. Be especially careful when driving, operating machinery, or performing hazardous activities.
Major: Erythromycin can increase the levels of ozanimod in your body by about two times. This may increase side effects such as diarrhea, headache, and fatigue.
Major: The drug thiotepa can cause severe allergic reactions when given together with the rubella virus vaccine. This combination should be avoided.

Major: When nabumetone is taken together with temsirolimus, there is an increased risk of side effects such as liver problems, kidney problems, skin rash, and bleeding. The mechanism of this interaction is not clear.
Major: Taking tofacitinib together with avapritinib can cause serious side effects. This interaction is very likely to occur because both drugs are broken down by an enzyme called CYP3A4.

Major: When rituximab and deferiprone are taken together, there is a major drug interaction. This means that the combination can cause serious side effects. The interaction may be caused by changes in how well the drugs are absorbed into the body.
Major: When drotrecogin alfa is given together with nintedanib, there is an increased risk of bleeding. This is because drotrecogin alfa increases the effects of nintedanib on blood clotting.
Major: Tofacitinib is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Guselkumab is used to treat psoriasis. Taking these drugs together may cause serious side effects.

Major: When rilonacept is taken together with fingolimod, there is a high risk of serious problems such as bradycardia (slow heart rate) and hypotension (low blood pressure). These effects may be due to fingolimod blocking the action of rilonacept.
Major: Taking alvimopan with meperidine can cause severe constipation. This may be due to the fact that alvimopan blocks the action of meperidine on the gut.

Major: Rifampicin can reduce the effectiveness of elagolix. This is because rifampicin increases the breakdown of elagolix by the body. As a result, more elagolix may be broken down before it reaches the part of the body where it is needed.
Major: Cisapride and tucatinib should not be used together because cisapride can increase the side effects of tucatinib. This interaction is major.

Major: Fingolimod and Ibrutinib should not be used together because they can cause serious problems such as bradycardia (slow heart rate) and arrhythmias (irregular heartbeat). These effects may occur even when both drugs are taken at their regular doses. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown but it may be related to the way these drugs affect the electrical activity of the heart.

Major: Mitotane can increase levels of glasdegib in your body. This may cause side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue, anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, and liver problems. Be cautious when taking these drugs together.

Minor: Betamethasone is a steroid used topically to treat skin conditions such as eczema. Empagliflozin is an oral medication used to treat diabetes. Taking these medications together may increase the risk of infection.
Minor: Taking amyl nitrite together with garlic does not seem to cause any problems. However, this interaction has not been well studied.
Minor: When ipratropium eye drops are used together with perphenazine, there may be a minor increase in the side effect of dry mouth. This interaction has been observed but has not been well studied.

Minor: The combination of indacaterol and velpatasvir is safe. There may be a slight change in the effect of either drug when they are taken together. However, this does not affect the effectiveness of the drugs.

Minor: Cangrelor is a medicine used to prevent heart attacks. Capsicum is a spice. Taking cangrelor with capsicum does not seem to change how well cangrelor works or how much of cangrelor ends up in your body.
Minor: The interaction between rocuronium and ranitidine is minor. This means that there is little chance of harm occurring when these drugs are used together.

Minor: When bortezomib is taken together with phenylbutazone, there may be an increased risk of stomach ulcers. This interaction is minor because the risk of stomach ulcers is small even without taking phenylbutazone.

Minor: Enoxacin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Mitoxantrone is a chemotherapy drug used to treat leukemia and other cancers. Taking these drugs together may increase the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. However, this interaction is unlikely to be harmful.

Minor: The drug aminoglutethimide can increase levels of cortisol in the blood. Cortisol is a hormone produced by the adrenal gland. It has many functions in the body, including controlling metabolism. The diabetes medicine pioglitazone can also increase levels of cortisol in the blood. Taking both drugs together may cause too much cortisol to be present in the blood. This is a minor drug interaction.

Minor: The drugs Indacaterol and Boceprevir have minor drug interactions. This means that they do not cause significant changes in their levels in the body when taken together. However, there may be some small effects on the heart rate and blood pressure.

Minor: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. Tretinoin is a vitamin A derivative used to treat acne. Taking ciprofloxacin with tretinoin may increase the risk of skin irritation.
Minor: The combination of docetaxel and armodafinil is unlikely to cause any problems. However, there is limited information available about this combination.

Minor: The combination of irinotecan and pipecuronium is considered to have a minor drug–drug interaction. This means that the interaction between these two drugs is unlikely to cause significant harm. However, there may be some side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and muscle weakness. Moderate: When vincristine is taken together with somatrem, there may be a moderate increase in side effects. This has been observed in studies but the exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Moderate: When aminoglutethimide is taken together with entrectinib, there is a moderate increase in the level of aminoglutethimide in the bloodstream.
Moderate: When repaglinide is taken together with aripiprazole, there is an increased risk of low blood sugar levels. This is because both drugs can increase the effects of each other.

Moderate: Fluvastatin can increase the levels of brentuximab vedotin in your body. This may increase side effects such as diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, fever, chills, dizziness, changes in liver function, changes in white blood cell count, and changes in thyroid function.
Moderate: When physostigmine is taken together with acebutolol, there is a moderate increase in the effect of physostigmine. This means that the side effects of physostigmine may be increased.

Moderate: When bisoprolol is taken together with iodipamide, the amount of bisoprolol in the blood may be reduced by up to 40%. This means that bisoprolol may lose its effect. The mechanism of this interaction is not clear.

Moderate: When ziprasidone is taken together with glyburide, there is an increased risk of low blood sugar levels. This may cause symptoms such as headache, dizziness, confusion, weakness, sweating, tremors, and seizures. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.

Moderate: Interferon beta-1a and binimetinib should be used with caution together. Interferon beta-1a can increase levels of a hormone called thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) in some people. This can cause problems like irregular heartbeat. Binimetinib can decrease TSH levels in some people. If your TSH level goes too high or too low, this could increase the risk of serious side effects such as an abnormal heart rate.

Moderate: When prazosin is taken together with triamcinolone, there may be an increased risk of high blood sugar levels. This interaction is moderate in severity. The exact mechanism for this interaction is not clear.

Moderate: When tacrine and granisetron are taken together, granisetron may be less effective at preventing nausea and vomiting. This interaction is moderate. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.
Moderate: Imipramine can increase the levels of sirolimus in your body. This may cause increased side effects.

Moderate: When fluvoxamine is taken together with glipizide, the amount of glipizide in the blood may be increased. This can lead to an increased risk of hypoglycemia. Hypoglycemia means low blood sugar levels. It is important to monitor blood sugar levels closely when taking these two drugs together.
Moderate: When hemin and tazemetostat are taken together, there may be a moderate increase in side effects. This interaction has been observed in studies but the exact cause is unknown.
Moderate: When bleomycin is given together with olaparib, there may be an increased risk of side effects on the lungs. This interaction has been observed but not well studied.

Moderate: When oxaprozin is taken together with potassium chloride, the levels of potassium in the blood may increase. This can be harmful for people who have certain conditions such as kidney disease or diabetes.
Moderate: Taking cefuroxime with magnesium hydroxide can decrease how well cefuroxime works. It is not clear why this happens.

Moderate: When reteplase and collagenase clostridium histolyticum are given together, they may interact in a moderate way. This means that the effects of one drug might be increased by the other drug.

Moderate: Tocilizumab is an immunosuppressant used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Secnidazole is an antiparasitic agent used to treat amoebiasis. Taking secnidazole together with tocilizumab may increase the risk of side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.
Moderate: When labetalol is taken along with morphine, there may be a moderate increase in the side effect of drowsiness. This is because labetalol can increase the effects of morphine on the brain.
Moderate: When quinine is taken together with atazanavir, the amount of quinine in the blood may increase. This can be harmful. It is not clear how this happens.

Moderate: The anthrax vaccine can increase the side effects of cisplatin. This is because cisplatin is broken down by the liver and kidneys, but the anthrax vaccine slows this process down. This causes more cisplatin to stay in your body for a longer time. This increases the chance of side effects from cisplatin.
Moderate: Elagolix can increase levels of etoposide in your body. This may increase side effects of etoposide. It is not clear how this interaction works.

Moderate: When levofloxacin is taken together with rilpivirine, there is a moderate risk of increased side effects. This is because levofloxacin can increase the amount of rilpivirine in your body. However, this interaction is unlikely to cause serious problems.
Moderate: When solifenacin is taken together with eluxadoline, there may be an increase in the side effect of constipation. This interaction has been observed but has not been well studied.
Moderate: When deserpidine is taken along with isometheptene, there may be a moderate increase in blood pressure. This is because isometheptene can block the action of deserpidine on the body.
Moderate: When tripelennamine is taken along with iloperidone, there may be an increased risk of drowsiness. This interaction is moderate. It is not clear how this interaction occurs.

Moderate: When anagrelide is taken together with deoxycholic acid, there may be a moderate increase in the side effect of diarrhea. This interaction has been observed but not well studied. It is not clear how this interaction happens.
Moderate: Interferon alfacon-1 can increase the risk of side effects when used together with oxaliplatin. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Moderate: When metoprolol is taken together with lorcaserin, the body may absorb more of lorcaserin than usual. This can increase side effects of lorcaserin.
Moderate: When chlorthalidone is taken together with sitagliptin, there may be a moderate increase in blood sugar levels. This is because chlorthalidone can reduce the effectiveness of sitagliptin.
Moderate: When vinorelbine and polatuzumab vedotin are given together, they may increase each other’s side effects on the heart.

Moderate: When clobazam is taken together with letrozole, the dose of clobazam may need to be adjusted because letrozole can increase the effects of clobazam. The exact amount of adjustment depends on how much letrozole is taken with each dose of clobazam.

Moderate: When bosentan is taken together with teniposide, bosentan may increase the side effects of teniposide. This interaction has been observed in some patients but not others. It is not clear why this interaction happens.

Moderate: Amiloride is used to treat hypertension and heart failure. It can be taken by mouth or injected into the vein. Heparin is also given through injection. Taking amiloride with heparin may increase the risk of bleeding. This is because amiloride slows down blood clotting.
Moderate: When repaglinide is taken together with St. John’s wort, the dose of repaglinide may need to be increased because St. John’s wort decreases the amount of repaglinide in the body.

Moderate: When salbutamol is taken together with abiraterone, there is a moderate increase in the level of salbutamol in the bloodstream. This may lead to an increased risk of side effects from salbutamol.

Moderate: When roflumilast is taken together with baricitinib, there may be an increased risk of liver problems. This interaction has been observed in studies done in animals and in people. The exact cause of this interaction is unknown. It is recommended to monitor for signs of liver problems when taking these drugs together.
Moderate: When taking both venlafaxine and clopidogrel together, there is a moderate risk of increased side effects such as bleeding. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.
Moderate: When nisoldipine is taken together with crizotinib, there is a moderate increase in the risk of side effects. The exact mechanism for this interaction is unknown.

Moderate: When palonosetron is taken along with salmeterol, there may be an increase in palonosetron side effects such as headache, diarrhea, and constipation. The exact reason for this interaction is unknown.

Moderate: The drug cobimetinib can increase the effects of hepatitis A vaccine when they are taken together. This means that the vaccine may work better than expected. However, this interaction has not been studied in children under 18 years old. Therefore, there is limited information about how well the vaccine works in children.

Moderate: When fludarabine is given together with lomustine, there is a moderate increase in side effects. This may be due to an increased risk of bone marrow suppression. However, this interaction is not well studied.

Moderate: When trimethobenzamide is taken together with methsuximide, there may be an increase in side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, headache, and confusion. This interaction has been observed but not well studied.

Moderate: When topotecan and talazoparib are taken together, they may increase each other’s side effects on the blood, such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fatigue. This interaction has been observed but the exact cause is unknown.
Moderate: When asparaginase is given together with methotrexate, the combination can increase the risk of liver toxicity. This is a moderate drug–drug interaction.

Moderate: When medroxyprogesterone acetate is taken with armodafinil, there may be an increase in side effects such as headache, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, insomnia, anxiety, and depression. The exact mechanism of this interaction is unknown.

Moderate: When brimonidine eye drops are used together with ambrisentan, there may be a moderate increase in blood pressure. This is because brimonidine can cause constriction of blood vessels, which can counteract the lowering effect of ambrisentan on blood pressure.

Moderate: Dasatinib can reduce the effectiveness of meningococcal polysaccharide vaccine group C. This means that people taking dasatinib may need to receive a higher dose of the vaccine than usual or receive more than one dose of the vaccine.

Moderate: When diclofenac eye drops are used together with sulfinpyrazone, there may be an increased risk of bleeding. This is because sulfinpyrazone can increase the blood levels of diclofenac. It is not clear how this happens.

Moderate: When methadone is taken along with brompheniramine, there is an increased risk of drowsiness. This interaction is moderate because the effect can be reduced by taking them at different times.

Moderate: When paclitaxel and hydroxychloroquine are taken together, they may increase the risk of peripheral neuropathy. This is a moderate drug–drug interaction. Peripheral neuropathy can cause pain, numbness, tingling, burning, or other sensations in your hands or feet. It can also affect how well these drugs work to treat cancer.
